title: tezcatlipoca_(fate)
body:
Nahuatl: "Smoking Mirror"

Assassin-class Servant currently summoned as [[Daybit Sem Void]]'s Grand Servant in [[Fate/Grand Order]]'s [[Nahui Mictlan (fate/grand order)|]] Lostbelt. Tezcatlipoca is a spider and jaguar deity in Aztec mythology, and he is fiercely at odds with [[Quetzalcoatl (fate)|]] due to their differing beliefs on human sacrifice. He was introduced as a playable character shortly after his story appearance - he is summonable as an Assassin, but appears in the story as a Ruler-class opponent. Illustrated by [[sho-u tajima]].

h4.Variants

* [[tezcatlipoca (young) (fate)|Child Tezcatlipoca]]

h4.Costumes

* [[tezcatlipoca (second ascension) (fate)|Second Ascension]]
* [[tezcatlipoca (third ascension) (fate)|Third Ascension]]

title: artoria_caster_(fate)
body:
Caster-class variant of [[Artoria Pendragon (fate)|]], introduced during the [[Fate/Grand Order]] 5th Anniversary event. First debuted in the second opening of [i]Cosmos in the Lostbelt[/i] and is a major character in [i][[Avalon le Fae (fate/grand order)|Lostbelt no. 6: Avalon le Fae]][/i].

She is an alternate version of Artoria who was chosen by the [[Staff of Selection (fate)|]] instead of the Sword of Selection, leading her to study magic instead of becoming a knight. Notably, she does not bear the Pendragon name, unlike her selves from Proper Human History. [spoiler]This is because Artoria Caster is completely unrelated to the Artoria from Proper Human History; she was created explicitly to fulfill the prophecy of Faerie Britain and destroy the Lostbelt, a mission originally assigned to [[Aesc (fate)|Lostbelt]] [[Morgan le Fay (Fate)|Morgan]] that she abandoned.[/spoiler] Her third ascension is also known as [b]Artoria Avalon[/b].

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[Takeuchi Takashi]]
[b]Voice Actress:[/b] [[Kawasumi Ayako]]

title: maid
body:
A person who wears a western (specifically Anglo-French)-style maid uniform. See [[wa maid]] for traditional Japanese maids.

In anime, maids typically wear some variation of the classic French or English maid uniform (the former is primarily decorative, with [[frills]], short [[skirt]], and bib [[apron]], while the latter is usually an ankle-length or mid-calf length dark-colored dress with a pinafore apron). The most indicative sign that a woman is a maid is a white [[maid headdress]] and some sort of white [[maid apron]].

If a character that is not usually portrayed with a maid uniform is drawn with one, also add the [[enmaided]] tag.

h4. Examples

* !post #5454405: English maid
* !post #5909501: French maid
* !post #17584: [[Victorian maid]]
* !post #6973173: [[Wa Maid]]

title: loli
body:
[[howto:rate|Sexually explicit]] or [[sexually suggestive]] artwork of girls who appear to be preadolescent, regardless of canonical age (the "millennia-old unaging vampiress that looks like a grade-schooler" trope, for example).

[[Loli]] is applicable to ratings Explicit, Questionable, and Sensitive. Completely work-safe, non-sexual (ie, [[howto:rate|rating:general]]) artwork of young girls should not be tagged as [[loli]], use [[child]] or [[petite]] instead. If you are unsure whether a post fits, ask in the "loli/shota check thread":[/forum_topics/8650].

This is a [[help:censored tags|censored tag]], which requires a "Gold+ Account":/user_upgrades/new to view.

h4. See also

title: hayabusa_(spacecraft)
body:
はやぶさ (hayabusa), also known as MUSES-C, is a space probe that the "JAXA":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Japan_Aerospace_Exploration_Agency developed and it's main purpose was to perform various technological experiments through a mission involving the returning of a sample from "an asteroid":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/25143_Itokawa]. 

This [[spacecraft]], while being hit with fatal complications many times over, returned to Earth. This great undertaking gathered social interest, and a "Hayabusa boom", big enough to make three movies, occurred. However, there are many space development fans who fear that this story may impede the improvement of the underlying causes like budgetary deficits. 

The solar paddles arranged in a H-shape, the four ion thrusters, a parabolic high-gain [[radio antenna]] and the re-entry capsule half embedded in the body are this probe's external characteristics. In Hayabusa's fan's artwork, almost always this "wok with a lid"-like shape a capsule is drawn. 

h4.See also 

* [[minerva_(spacecraft)]] / (asteroid rover) 
* [[spacecraft]] 
* [[atmospheric reentry]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hayabusa]

title: houjou_satoko
body:
A character from [[Higurashi no Naku Koro Ni]]. Voiced by [[Kanai Mika]].

She tends to end most of her sentences with 'wa' and is quite clever with setting up traps. She also cannot tell the difference between cauliflower and broccoli.

She has [[purple eyes]] (sometimes drawn as [[red eyes|red]] or [[pink eyes|pink]]) and [[short hair|short]] [[blonde hair]].

Her school attire consists of a [[black hairband]], [[green dress|green]] [[sailor dress]] with a [[white sailor collar]], [[yellow neckerchief]], and [[black pantyhose]].

Her casual attire consists of a [[sleeveless shirt|sleeveless]] [[collared shirt|collared]] [[pink shirt]] [[shirt tucked in|tucked in]] [[blue shorts|blue]] [[short shorts]].

Her best friend is [[Furude Rika]], her older brother is [[Houjou Satoshi]], and her uncle is [[Houjou Teppei]].

title: asclepius_(fate)
body:
Caster-class Servant seen in [[Fate/Grand Order]], first appearing in the [[Yugakshetra (fate/grand order)|]] Lostbelt. The son of [[Apollo (fate)|]] and Coronis, and the Greek god of medicine. Known for being able to revive the dead, resulting in him being punished by the gods. Namesake of the [[Rod of Asclepius]].

title: queen_of_sheba_(fate)
body:
A Caster-class servant met in the "[[Salem (fate/grand order)|Salem of the Heresy]]" chapter of [i][[Fate/Grand Order]][/i]'s Epic of Remnant substory as the [b]Caster of Midrash[/b]. She in truth is the Queen of Sheba, one of [[Solomon (fate)|]]'s wives, operating under the name [i]Tituba[/i] while in Salem. Her True Name is unknown.

She is depicted as being extremely greedy, and will usually do anything for any valuable items (especially [[gold]] and [[money]]).

title: napoleon_bonaparte_(fate)
body:
Archer-class Servant first debuted in [[Fate/Grand Order]] during the Lostbelt arc. The depiction of the [[napoleon bonaparte|famous military leader]] of the same name.

Napoleon's appearance is different from his self in history. His third ascension outfit seems to be based on the romantic oil painting [i][[napoleon_crossing_the_alps|Napoléon Crossing the Alps]][/i] done by Jacques-Louis David in 1801. It is stated that if he was summoned as a Rider, his height would decrease.

A tall, muscular man with [[brown hair]], [[blue eyes]], and facial hair in the style of [[goatee]] and [[long sideburns]]. Usually depicted in [[bara]] style with an [[open jacket|open]] [[leather jacket]] and [[epaulettes]] (with [[fringe trim]] and [[long sleeves]]) on top of an [[open shirt]] that shows off his [[pectorals]] and [[cross scar|cross scarred]] [[scar on chest| chest]]. When his jacket is not [[partially unbuttoned]] he usually wears his [[military uniform]] with a [[shoulder sash]], [[medal]], [[ascot]], [[belt]], [[tight clothes]] [[white pants]], and [[leather boots|leather]] [[knee boots]]).

He wields a [[huge weapon|huge]] [[cannon]] that shoots [[rainbow]]. According to in-game lines, the cannon was designed by [[Charles Babbage (fate)|]], despite the UK and France considered each other enemies during their lifetime.

A legend says that during his campaign in [[Egypt]], he spent a night inside the [[great pyramid of giza|Great Pyramid]] and had a vision of his most admired hero, Alexander the Great ([[Iskandar (fate)|]]). This fact is included in one of Napoleon's in-game lines and has inspired fans to depict them as a [[bara]] [[couple]], especially since both were known as charismatic military leader and historical connections.

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[Ryota-H]]
[b]Voice Actor:[/b] [[Hino Satoshi]]

title: abigail_williams_(fate)
body:
Foreigner-class Servant from [[Fate/Grand Order]]. The eponymous Witch of Salem, she is also known as "The Silver Key" which is a reference to the [[Cthulhu Mythos]]. She first appeared in [[promotional art]] for Epic of Remnant (post #2635525).

She has [[blue eyes]] and [[very long hair|very long]] [[blonde hair]], worn [[parted bangs|parted]] to both sides and decorated with [[multiple hair bows|multiple]] [[orange bow|orange]] and [[purple bow|purple]] [[hair bow]]s. She wears a [[black dress]] with [[white bloomers]] and an oversized [[black hat|black]] [[witch hat]]. Tends to be depicted in oversized clothes with her [[sleeves past wrists|sleeves past her wrists]], or just [[black panties]] with no bra and ribbons (sometimes butterfly-cut ones) coming from the multiple [[bow]]s on her neck covering her torso a little.

While using her powers, she gets a [[keyhole]] mark on her forehead, [[white skin]] and [[red eyes]] and can attack with [[tentacles]].

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[Kuroboshi Kouhaku]]
[b]Voice Actress:[/b] [[Oowada Hitomi]]

title: rags
body:
An old or tattered piece of clothing, usually seen worn on humanoid [[monster]]s or [[slave]]s.

In terms of appearance, they are usually very simple in design with almost no decoration/patterns and some sort of dull brown/grey color.

Not to be confused with [[cleaning rag]], which is used to wipe/clean things.

title: fn_scar_16
body:
The [b][[assault rifle]][/b] variant of the [[FN SCAR]], chambered for 5.56×45mm NATO [[rifle cartridge|cartridge]]. Also known as the SCAR-L or Mk16. Distinguishable by its curved 30-round STANAG [[magazine (weapon)|magazine]]. The tag can also be applied to the more compact SCAR-SC.
Its semi-auto civilian variant is referred to as the SCAR 16S.

title: finn_mertens
body:
An alternate universe version of [[Finn the Human]] that lives in a relatively normal world. After using the Ice Crown, he begins to lose his sanity and tries to turn his home into a frozen wasteland.

He has a [[long nose]] and wide eyes thanks to not being born in the irradiated world after the Great Mushroom War, but still has misshapen teeth. Like many alternate Finns, his right arm is [[single mechanical arm|mechanical]]. Also known as "Farmworld Finn" and "Ice Finn".

title: list_of_genshin_impact_tags
body:
A list of [b]currently in use[/b] tags related to [[Genshin Impact]].
For characters, see [[list of genshin impact characters]].

h4. Items

h6. Items seen on characters

* [[Vision (genshin impact)|]] - Gem that matches one's element and is used to summon elemental power
* [[Gnosis (genshin impact)|]] - An item held by an Archon [tn]A god of a specific element and region[/tn] that acts as their vision
* [[Delusion (genshin impact)|]] - Artificial vision made by the Fatui

h6. Gacha currency

* [[Primogem]] - The standard gacha currency. 160 of these can be exchanged for one Fate
* [[Intertwined Fate]] - A star-like item that can be used for pulling in the limited gacha once, has a pink-blue gradient
* [[Acquaint Fate]] - Can only be used in the permanent banner, colored in blue
* [[Stella Fortuna]] - The item recieved once you pull a duplicate character, can be used to enhance said character
* [[Genesis Crystal]] - Premium currency only obtained through in-game purchases 

h6. Inventory items

* [[Artifact (genshin impact)|]] - Character equipment. Can have a variety of appearances depending on its type.
* [[Cloud Retainer Damasked Device (genshin impact)|]] - A paper bird companion given as a gift to the player from the [[Cloud Retainer (genshin impact)|]].
* [[Crimson Agate (genshin impact)|]] - A red crystal found in Dragonspine. Used at the Frostbearing Tree.
* [[Crown of Insight]] - A crown with a triquetra shape. Used to level up a character's talents to their final stage.
* [[Handguard (genshin impact)|]] - A handguard dropped by [[Nobushi (genshin impact)|]] and [[Kairagi (genshin impact)|]].
* [[Itty Bitty Octobaby (genshin impact)|]] - A tiny octopus companion.
* [[Mora (genshin impact)|]] - Genshin's equivalent to "gold" or "coins". Has a triquetra shape printed on it.
* [[Oculus (genshin impact)|]] - Found in the open world. Used at Statues of the Seven.
* [[Serenitea Pot (genshin impact)|]] - A teapot gadget which grants access to the housing mechanic.
* [[Shiki Koshou]] - A shikigami companion given as a gift to the player from [[Shiki Taishou]].
* [[Waverider (genshin impact)|]] - A boat.
* [[Wind Glider]] - Artificial wings used to glide.

title: seia_(blue_archive)
body:
A character from [[Blue Archive]]. Member of the [[Tea Party (blue_archive)|]]. Her full name is Yurizono Seia.

She has [[fox ears]], [[fox tail]], [[long hair|long]] [[blonde hair]], [[gradient eyes|gradient]] [[pink eyes|pink]]-[[yellow eyes]], and a [[cross halo|cross-shaped]] [[yellow halo|yellow]] [[halo]]. She wears a [[white dress|white]] [[sleeveless dress]] with [[detached sleeves]] that go [[sleeves past fingers|past her fingers]], and [[petticoat]] under her dress. She wears a [[white bow|white]] [[hair bow]] and [[hair flower]] on her head.

Sometimes drawn with a [[white bird]], often a [[long-tailed tit]], perched on her.

Her firearm is [[webley_self_loading_pistol|Webley M1913]] pistol.

Voiced by: [[Tanezaki Atsumi]]

title: trapdoor_springfield
body:
The "Trapdoor Springfields", named due to their distinctive hinged breechblock that opened like a trap door, are the collective name for a series of weapons created by the Springfield Arsenal from 1865 to 1903. The Model 1873 pattern was the first breech-loaded [[rifle]] adopted as standard-issue for the United States Military, and was chambered in the .50-70 Government black-powder [[rifle_cartridge|cartridge]] since the model 1866 was officially adopted. Due to budget concerns and the overwhelming amount of muzzle-loading [[musket]]s filling government storage after the war, the Arsenal elected to base their new designs on the existing patterns, rather than creating a wholly new design. 

Visually, the Trapdoor Springfields of all types still resemble their Civil War-era heritage with an obvious [[caplock]] hammer on the side, but the large Allin hinged breech-block is the distinguishing feature. Trapdoor Springfields saw use during the Indian Wars, [[Spanish-American War]], and Philippine-American War. 

h4. See also

* [[Krag Jorgensen]] A Norwegian-designed bolt-action rifle with more ammunition capacity than the Trapdoor Springfields, that would officially replace it in 1892.
* [[Martini-henry ]] The British counterpart to the Trapdoor Springfield, as an single-shot rifle.
* [[Berdan rifle]] The Russian counterpart to the Trapdoor Springfield, as an single-shot rifle.

h4. See also
* [[list of weapons]]
* Wikipedia article: "Springfield_Model_1865":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Springfield_Model_1865]
* Wikipedia article: "Springfield_Model_1866":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Springfield_Model_1866]
* Wikipedia article: "Springfield_Model_1873":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Springfield_model_1873]
* Wikipedia article: "Springfield_Model_1884":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Springfield_model_1884]

title: suzuki_ichirou
body:
(鈴木 一朗 [i]Suzuki Ichirō[/i], born October 22, 1973)

Sometimes simply known as Ichiro (イチロー).

A Japanese former professional baseball outfielder. He began his career in 1992 playing for the [[Orix Buffaloes]] (then the Orix BlueWave) of Nippon Professional Baseball before joining Major League Baseball in 2000, starting with the [[Seattle Mariners]] and staying with them until 2012. Suzuki spent two seasons each with the [[New York Yankees]] and the [[Miami Marlins]] before finishing out his career as a Mariner in 2018. He officially retired on March 21, 2019.

He had a unique ritual of holding his bat upright at arm's length, and tugging at his sleeve before getting set for each pitch.

Because of his achievements both in Japan and the United States, he was elected in both Japanese and American Baseball Halls of Fame; his induction into the US Hall of Fame was the first for a Japanese player.

title: arcueid_brunestud
body:
A character from the visual novel [[Tsukihime]], who also makes an appearance in the fighting game [[Melty Blood]] by [[Type-Moon]]. She is voiced by [[Nabatame Hitomi]] in the original Tsukihime anime, by [[Yuzuki Ryouka]] in Melty Blood, and [[Hasegawa Ikumi]] in Type Lumina, the remake, and as [[Archetype_EARTH|Archetype: EARTH]] in [[Fate/Grand Order]].

She has [[short hair|short]] [[blonde hair]] styled in [[hair intakes]], [[medium breasts|medium]] to [[large breasts]], as well as [[red eyes]]. Her clothing consists of a white [[turtleneck sweater]], a [[long skirt|long]] [[purple skirt]] and [[black pantyhose]]. In the remake, she wears a [[blue skirt|blue]] [[pleated skirt|pleated]] [[miniskirt]] instead along with a silver [[necklace]].

h4. Appearance

title: eos_(neural_cloud)
body:
Eos is a female character from the game [[Girls' Frontline Neural Cloud]].

Eos was a Greater Sanctifier of the Reverse Tower of Babylon.  She was created at the same time as [[lord eosphoros (neural cloud)|Eosphoros]] as a complementary counterpart to him.  As Eos and Eosphoros were created from the same template, [[Antonina (neural cloud)|]] describes them as something akin to twins. Before the events of the game she was registered as KIA.

Prior to her release as a playable Agent during the Entropic Dichotomy event, she first appears in the game as a disguise form taken on by Eosphoros.

title: rydia_(young)_(ff4)
body: The child version of [[Rydia (ff4)|]], who joins as a temporary party member after the events in Mist Village. She can use extremely basic White Magic and a wider selection of Black Magic, and is only able to summon [[Chocobo]].

title: ainz_ooal_gown
body:
The Antho-protagonist from the series [[overlord_(maruyama)|Overlord by Maruyama]].

He is the Evil Overlord ruling the Great Tomb of Nazarick. Ainz, originally called Momonga, is a [[skeleton]] mage called a "[[Lich]]" and one of the most powerful people in the world who, while good with tactics and quick thinking, lacks foresight and often underestimates the behavior of his underlings. This has set the plot in motion that everyone wants to conquer the world for him, something he often worries about. Nicknamed "The Strongest Spellcaster, with the Appearance of a Skeleton" due to the aforementioned reasons.

Ainz also sometimes plays the role of "[[Momon (overlord)|]]", a black knight who fights with two huge swords, often with the purpose of collecting new information by doing undercover missions. Helping him in this endeavor is [[Narberal Gamma]], assuming the name "[[Nabe_(Overlord)|]]" and pretending to be his colleague, rather than servant.
other_names: アインズ・ウール・ゴウン
モモンガ(オーバーロード)

title: rydia_(ff4)
body:
A playable summoner in [i][[Final Fantasy IV]][/i]. Found by [[Cecil Harvey]] in the ruins of her hometown, the hero takes it upon himself to take her to the nearest inn. Rydia is initally distrusting of Cecil, but eventually warms up to him as he goes on a quest to cure his beloved [[Rosa Farrell|Rosa]] of a fatal fever.

[spoiler]After being knocked off a ship by Leviathan, Rydia is taken to the Feymarch, the Land of Summons, and discovers her full potential as a summoner. The warped time flow of the Feymarch causes Rydia to reach adulthood by the time she reunites with Cecil.[/spoiler]

h4.See also

* [[Rydia (Adult) (ff4)|]]
* [[Rydia (Young) (ff4)|]]

title: rapunzel_(nikke)
body:
A playable character in [[Goddess of Victory: Nikke]]. 

A member of the Pioneer squad along with [[Scarlet (Nikke)|Scarlet]] and [[Snow White (Nikke)|Snow White]]. A saint-like figure who appeases the spirits of those who have died on the surface. Often found lost in prayer, she is also prone to reminiscence. [spoiler]In spite of her innocent attitude, she is a huge pervert. This salacious mind has been attributed to a long-gone friend "[[red_hood_(nikke)|Red Hood]]" who is fond of adult magazines.[/spoiler]

Like all members of [[Pioneer (Nikke)|]], Rapunzel is named after the tiular character of the "german fairy tale of the same name":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rapunzel].

She has [[blue eyes]] and [[very long hair|very long]] [[blonde hair|yellow hair]] tied to a [[braid]]. She wears a [[nun]]-themed outfit consists of a [[black robe]], and an [[armored bodysuit]]. She also carries a [[staff]]-esque [[rocket launcher]].

h4. Skins
* !post #5930195: Default
* !post #8350854: [[Rapunzel (Pure Grace) (nikke)|Pure Grace]] ([[Goddess (Nikke)|]])
other_names: ラプンツェル(勝利の女神:NIKKE)

title: snow_white_(nikke)
body:
A playable character in [[Goddess of Victory: Nikke]]. 

A member of the [[Pioneer (nikke)|]] squad along with [[Scarlet (Nikke)|Scarlet]] and [[Rapunzel (Nikke)|Rapunzel]]. A puritanical pilgrim who wanders the surface in an effort to protect humanity. As a member of Pioneer, her days are spent wiping out Raptures with extreme prejudice. [spoiler] Because of the lack of food on the surface, she forced herself to survive by eating spoiled [[field ration]]s, and has become quite fixated on any food she can find.[/spoiler]

Like all members of Pioneer, Snow White and her weapons are references from the "German fairy tale of the same name":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Snow_White].

She has [[yellow eyes]] and [[white hair|white]] [[long hair]]. She's a [[mecha musume]] with a [[single mechanical arm]]. She wears a [[visor (armor)]], a [[white cloak]], has [[dog tags]], [[shoulder armor]] and [[armored boots]]. Usually carries a [[assault rifle]] and a [[sniper rifle]]

h4. Official Art
* !post #6045146: Default
* !post #7510760:  [[Snow White (white knight) (nikke)|White Knight]]
* !post #6819032: [[Snow White (innocent Days) (nikke)|Innocent Days]] ([[Goddess (Nikke)|]])
other_names: スノーホワイト(勝利の女神:NIKKE)

title: scarlet_(nikke)
body:
A playable character in [[Goddess of Victory: Nikke]]. 

A member of the Pioneer squad along with [[Snow White (Nikke)|Snow White]] and [[Rapunzel (Nikke)|Rapunzel]]. She's a wandering swordswoman who's partial to a good drink. Despite the common perception of melee weapons being ineffective in combat, she chooses to wield a [[sword]]. [spoiler] Although she likes [[alcohol]], she doesn't hold it very well and can easily get [[drunk]]. [/spoiler]

Like all members of Pioneer, Scarlet is named after a figure from folklore: the titular character Hongryeon (which is Scarlet's name in Korean) from the Korean folktale "The Legend of Janghwa and Hongryeon":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Janghwa_Hongryeon_jeon].

She has [[yellow eyes]], [[grey hair|grey]] [[long hair]] and [[medium breasts]]. She carries a [[sword]] which she keeps in her [[sheath]] on her [[weapon on back|back]]. She wears a [[large hat|large]] [[jingasa]], a [[white leotard]], resembling some sort of [[japanese armor]] with [[clothing cutout|cutouts]]. Wears a few pieces of japanese armor though reduced in size [[sode]] for her left arm, [[kote]] on her right arm, and a single sided left thigh protector [[haidate]].

h4. Skins

* !post #6045158: Default
* !post #7021141: [[Scarlet (black shadow) (nikke)|Black Shadow]] ([[Goddess (Nikke)|]])
* !post #8361958: [[Scarlet (black shadow) (longing flower) (nikke) |Longing Flower]] (Skin, Black Shadow)

title: list_of_girls'_frontline_characters
body:
A list of all characters in [i][[Girls' Frontline]][/i], first organized by weapon type, then by rarity, then by rough in-game release order.

[expand=Table of Contents]
* 1. "Tactical Dolls":#dtext-tdoll
** 1.1 "Handguns":#dtext-hg
** 1.2 "Rifles":#dtext-rf
** 1.3 "Assault Rifles":#dtext-ar
** 1.4 "Machine Guns":#dtext-mg
** 1.5 "Shotguns":#dtext-sg
** 1.6 "Unused":#dtext-unused
* 2. "Fairies and drones":#dtext-fairy
* 3. "Heavy Ordnance Corps":#dtext-hoc
* 3. "NPCs":#dtext-npc
* 4. "Enemies":#dtext-enemy
** 4.1. "Sangvis Ferri":#dtext-sf
** 4.2. "KCCO":#dtext-kcco
** 4.3. "Paradeus":#dtext-paradeus
** 4.4. "ELID":#dtext-elid
** 4.5. "Miscellaneous":#dtext-misc
* 5. "GF-adjacent characters":#dtext-rc
** 5.1. "Girls' Frontline Neural Cloud":#dtext-nc
*** 5.1.1. "Dolls":#dtext-ncdoll
*** 5.1.2. "Agents and NPCs":#dtext-ncagent
*** 5.1.3. "Enemies":#dtext-ncenemy
** 5.2. "Girls' Frontline 2: Exilium":#dtext-exilium
*** 5.2.1. "Dolls":#dtext-exiliumdoll
*** 5.2.2. "Others":#dtext-exiliumother
** 5.3. "Codename: Bakery Girl":#dtext-bakerygirl
[/expand]

h4#tdoll. Tactical Dolls / 战术人形

Tactical dolls are named after the weapon they're based upon. If there's a pixiv tag with a firearm name, assume it stands for both any weapon present and character name. Some Chinese names for firearms have been added for easier searching on the official wiki.

title: hannah_(neural_cloud)
body:
Hannah is a female AI character from the game [[Girls' Frontline Neural Cloud]].  She is an agent (AI) developed in 42Lab's Rossum Sector by the agent [[Turing (neural cloud)|]].  She's initially a non-playable character, but was added to the roster of playable characters with the Critical Cascade story event.

Under Turing's care she was created and raised, and thus viewed Turing as a mother figure.

title: st_ar-15_(girls'_frontline)
body:
An android representing the Colt [[AR-15]] in [[Girls' Frontline]], specifically one by Spikes Tactical.

She has a long [[pink hair]] with [[streaked hair|a blue streak]], a [[one side up|part of her hair tied to the side]] with a [[hair ornament|hairpin that is shaped like a cross-section of an AR-15 quad rail]], and [[blue eyes]]. In her default images she wears a white [[dress]], [[fingerless gloves]] and a [[single thighhigh]] on her left leg. In her 'Literary Girl' skin she wears white [[thighhighs]] and a [[school uniform]]. her rifle's [[magpul]] stock is replaced with a PDW-style stock.

A member of the [[M4A1 (girls' frontline)|]]-led [[Anti-Rain (girls' frontline)|AR Team]], AR-15 is very insecure about being the only civilian model weapon in her team. This goes so far as to her becoming self-conscious when the Commander looks at her trademark. 

Would receive a [[ST AR-15 (MOD3) (girls' frontline)|Neural Upgrade]].

Her illustrator [[LIN+]] adapted her design from his Pixiv Fantasia character, known under many names, who in their last incarnation was known as [[Berlinetta (pixiv fantasia)|]]. She is voiced by [[Katou Emiri]].

title: final_gear
body:
A mecha-themed, all-female shooting game by Chinese studio Flashwing. An evolution of the original [[Artery Gear]], the game came into being as its own IP after a set of nasty lawsuits ended up splitting Flashwing in half. It is a more direct evolution of the shooter gameplay of the original Armor Girls, while [[Artery Gear: Fusion]] went in a different direction. Final Gear is, as noted, a separate IP from Artery Gear, and does not feature the same characters.

The game shut down on March 5, 2024.

body:
Codenamed "Turing" is a female AI character from the game [[Girls' Frontline Neural Cloud]].  She is an agent (AI) developed by 42Lab to administrate their AI development sector "Rossum." title: baalia_(neural_cloud)
body:
Avatar of [[Girls' Frontline Neural Cloud]] Producer Kamie, introduced in the February 5th 2021 Beilan Island Shelter Broadcast as a result of needing a Live2D avatar for those devlogs. Supposedly designed in reference to the second character in Kamie's name (咩, miē), as it can be read as the bleating of a sheep or goat, so they designed a well-endowed goat-demon girl, dubbed Kamiēzǐ (卡咩子), otherwise transcribed by fans as Kamieko. In the non-Chinese versions of the game, her name gets localized as Memeko in Japanese and Korean, and Baalia in English.

Notably appears in-game as the Baalia Training Machine as part of the EXP Collection stages, and as the cause behind the events of the April Fools' "Fool's Duality" event.

h4. See also

* "List of Girls' Frontline Neural Cloud characters":[/wiki_pages/list_of_girls'_frontline_characters#dtext-rc]

h4. External links

* "IOP Wiki: Baalia":[https://iopwiki.com/wiki/Baalia]
other_names: めめ子(ニューラルクラウド)

title: fashion
body:
Posts with a focus on fashion. This primarily involves attention to detail and coordination present in a character's outfit, often in a pose meant to show off the outfit. Outfits will usually reflect current fashion trends, real life [[tag group:fashion style|fashion styles]], runway fashion, and street fashion. This tag will often overlap with [[alternate costume]], [[casual]], and [[contemporary]].

This tag also encompasses other fashion-related posts such as posts featuring fashion modeling, fake magazine covers, or clothing design.

title: titans_(gundam)
body:
[b]The Titans[/b] (ティターンズ [i]Titānzu[/i]) are the main antagonists of the [[Mobile Suit]] [[Zeta Gundam]] anime TV series. They are also featured in [[Gundam Sentinel]] and in [[Advance of Zeta]]: The Flag of Titans. 

They were an elite unit that the [[Earth Federation]] established in [[gundam_0083|U.C. 0083]] after the conclusion of [i]Operation Stardust[/i]. Their original intention was to defend the Earth Federation against supporters and military remnants of the Principality of [[Zeon]], as well as to investigate Zeon sympathizers. However, [spoilers]they employ brutal genocidal tactics against innocent spacenoid civilians from several colonies, what sparks the creation of [[military]] resistance groups like the [[space]] bound [[AEUG]] and the [[earth_(planet)|Earth]] bound Karaba, as the conflict escalates into a full-blown civil [[war]] known as "The Gryps War".[/spoilers] 

[spoilers]The Titans' army eventually grew too big and turned rogue, allying themselves with [[neo_zeon|Axis Zeon]] in order to fight against the Anti-Earth Union Group in an attempt to gain control over the Earth Sphere. They were all but wiped out by the AEUG at the end of the Gryps Conflict ([[gundam_zz|U.C. 0088]]), while some of its very few surviving MS pilots joined [[Neo Zeon]] or the [[Earth Federation]].[/spoilers]

h4. Notable members
* [[Jamitov Hymen]] - Supreme leader and creator
* [[Paptimus Scirocco]] - High officer, ace MS pilot and designer of several powerful advanced MS
* [[Bask Om]] - Infamous brutal spaceship captain

title: hizack
body:
A fictional [[mecha]] from the [[Gundam]] series. It first appeared in [[Zeta Gundam]] from 1985.

[b]RMS-106 Hizack[/b]

A [[mobile suit]] developed by the [[titans_(gundam)|Titans]] based on the legendary [[Zaku II]] series from [[Zeon]]. 

In order to snuff out the Zeon remnants, the Hizacks were made to greatly resemble the Zaku, but packed much more powerful beam weapons in addition to the Zaku [[machine gun]]s. [[Earth Federation]] Hizacks are blue colored, while the Titans opted for the classic Zaku II green color scheme for their units. The Hizack replaced the [[GM Quel]] and was the standard Titans MS at the start of [[zeta_gundam|The Gryps War]], but was quickly replaced itself by the [[Marasai]].

After The Gryps War some grey colored units were seen deployed by the [[Neo Zeon]] [[full_frontal|Sleeves]] during their [[gundam_unicorn|Attack on Torrington base]].

h4. Variants
* [[Hizack Custom]]
* [[Hizack Cannon]]
* [[EWAC Zack]]
* [[zaku_marine_type|Marine Hizack]]

* [[Hobby Hizack]]

title: rhino_(girls'_frontline)
body:
An android representing the [[Chiappa Rhino]] [[handgun]] in [[Girls' Frontline]].

A small and nimble Doll adept in concealment and infiltration, and always makes surprising discoveries in unexpected places. Having been through a lot of training and accumulated plenty of combat experience, she is very confident in her own abilities. Serious and down-to-earth, she follows every single order to the tee, but also often gets her leg pulled by others. She falls for all kinds of fibs, so she starts having doubts even when people are actually telling the truth. The reason why she's always wearing a cape that clearly doesn't fit her seems to be a subject that one should steer well clear of.

h4. Appearance

title: takarazuka_revue
body:
A Japanese all-female musical theater troupe, founded in 1913 and based in Takarazuka, Hyougo Prefecture, Japan. Women play all roles in lavish, Broadway-style productions of Western-style musicals, and sometimes stories adapted from shoujo manga and Japanese folktales.

The Revue has had a marked influence on anime and manga, including the growth of the shoujo and [[yuri]] genres, as well as the [[bishounen]] trope.

title: nahel_argama
body:
A fictional [[military]] [[spacecraft]] from the [[Gundam]] franchise.

[b]SCVA-76 Nahel Argama[/b]

A one-off assault cruiser built by [[Anaheim Electronics]], meant to supplant the badly damaged [[AEUG]] [[Argama]]. Sporting 5 hangars, 5 catapults, and a multitude of weapons, the Nahel Argama was a mighty battleship in its own right, but perhaps its greatest asset was the immensely powerful High Mega Particle Cannon that could vaporize a colony in a single shot. 

It was operated by [[Bright Noa]] until he left command of the ship to the [i][[Gundam Team]][/i], and after that it was turned to the Federation, where it served in the prestigious [[char's_counterattack|Londo Bell unit]].

title: pentagon_jr
body:
Mexican professional wrestler, currently working for [[WWE]] under the ring name [b]Penta[/b]. Also known as [b]Penta El Zero M[/b] and previously worked for Lucha Libre AAA Worldwide, Lucha Underground, and [[All Elite Wrestling]]. He is well-known for his catchphrase [i]Cero Miedo[/i], which translates to "Zero Fear" in Spanish and his gimmick of breaking his opponent's arm. He is the older brother of WWE wrestler Rey Fenix. 

h4. Known moves

* [i]Fear Factor[/i] (Package [[Piledriver (wrestling)|]])
* The Sacrifice (Grounded Hammerlock & Inverted Armbreaker)
* Pentagon Driver (Pumphandle Half Nelson Driver)

A magical tool created by the [[Seth Twiright]] inspired by the [[katana|swords]] from the eastern kingdom of Jakoku. After Leviantha's Cathastrophe, it was recollected by [[Irina Clockworker]] who hand it to the eldest son of the Venomania family, who used it to fullfill his wish leading to the infamous Venomania Incident and the disappearance of countless women across Asmodean.

title: goal_balloon_(sonic)
body:
A gameplay objective featured in the [[Sonic (series)|Sonic the Hedgehog series]], specifically serving as the finish marker for [[Amy Rose]]'s Action Stages in [[Sonic Adventure]].

Goal Balloons are large yellow balloons decorated with blue circles, each marked with a red five-pointed star. A distinct red ring hangs from a rope beneath the balloon. They are typically found floating stationary in mid-air until Amy interacts with them.

title: gensokyo's_first_hakurei_miko
body:
The Miko of the Hakurei Shrine from the time when Gensokyo was first formed. [spoilers]Revealed in the end of [[Foul Detective Satori]] to be the one who sealed [[Miyadeguchi Mizuchi]] away.[/spoilers]

Note that she is not the direct canon equivalent of [[Sendai Hakurei no Miko]], a character from [[M.U.G.E.N]] depicted as Reimu's immediate predecessor. This Hakurei comes from long before that time.

title: sonic_the_hedgehog_(summer)
body:
An official alternate costume for [[Sonic the Hedgehog]] in [i][[Sonic Speed Simulator]][/i].

It features:
* A vibrant yellow Hawaiian shirt.
* A blue luau necklace.
* Stylish sunglasses perched on his head.
* The Light Speed Shoes, modeled after their appearance in [i][[Sonic Adventure]][/i], complete with yellow glowing heels. The soles of these shoes also feature the text "Sonic Adventure".

The design of the costume draws inspiration from multiple sources:
* Overall Concept: Based on the [[Joypolis]] Watermelon Sonic Plushie.
* Sunglasses: Identical to the sunglasses Sonic wears during his story's ending screen in [i]Sonic Adventure[/i].
* Shell Bracelet: First seen in [i][[Sonic X]][/i], Episode 9: "The Last Resort".
* Shoes: Directly replicates the Light Speed Shoes from [i]Sonic Adventure[/i].

title: patchouli_knowledge
body:
The "Unmoving Great Library". Stage 4 boss of [[Touhou]]'s [[Embodiment of Scarlet Devil]] and later a recurring playable character in the first few fighting games.

She has [[very long hair|long]] [[purple hair]] with [[blunt bangs]], [[purple eyes|matching eyes]], and [[multiple hair bows|multiple]] [[blue bow|blue]] and [[red bow|red]]/[[pink bow|pink]] [[hair bow|hair bows]]. She wears a [[pink_hat|pink]] or [[white headwear|white]] [[mob cap]] with a [[crescent hat ornament|crescent ornament]] on it, as well as a [[hat ribbon|ribbon]], and single or [[double bun]] [[bun cover|covers]]. She also wears a [[vertical-striped dress|vertically striped]], [[purple dress]] under a [[robe]] with [[long sleeves|long]], [[wide sleeves]], and has [[white footwear|white]] [[shoes]] with [[footwear bow|bows]] on them.

A magician youkai, resident librarian and instructor of the [[Scarlet Devil Mansion]], and a close friend to [[Remilia Scarlet]]. She has mastery over the seven elements corresponding to Japanese weekday names - Sun, Moon, Fire, Metal, Wood, Water and Earth - earning her the nickname "One-Week Wizard", but her reclusive lifestyle (she's apparently not left her library in 100 years, which is interpreted in some doujins as signs of [[hikikomori]] behavior) has taken a toll on her health, limiting her powers by way of asthma and anemia. Due to her baggy clothing, her bust size and overall body shape are still open to debate.

On [[NicoNico]], she is linked to [[Gachimuchi]] thanks to "a certain misheard line":https://www.nicovideo.jp/watch/sm2852390 uttered by [[Billy Herrington]]. Such images are tagged with: "Patchouli, Urgh!" in Pixiv.

h4. Example

* !post #8421082: Usual Appearance

h4. See also

* "[[Mukyuu]]", a nonsensical catchphrase attributed to her
* [[Voile]], the (unofficial) name generally used in reference to the mansion's library, which Patchouli tends
* [[Catchouli (hazuki ruu)|]], a disgustingly adorable [[chibi]] [[cat girl]] version created by [[Hazuki Ruu]]
* [[Patchoung (aoshima)|]], a version of her created by [[Aoshima]]

h4. External links

* "Touhou Wiki: Patchouli Knowledge":http://en.touhouwiki.net/wiki/Patchouli_Knowledge
other_names: パチュリー・ノーレッジ

body:
Main character from [[Starship Troopers]] and its adaptation [[Uchuu no Senshi]].

[b]Juan "Johnnie" Rico[/b] is a young human soldier of [[philippines|Filipino]] ([[argentina|Argentine]] in the anime and film adaptations) ethnicity and a member of the [[Mobile Infantry]], a futuristic military unit equipped with [[power armor]]s that is involved in an interstellar war between mankind and an [[arachnid]] [[alien]] species known as the "Bugs".

title: senji_muramasa_(fate)
body:
[i]"Convergence is the proof of the ideal. As if forging a sword, as if burning up your own life, you will continue to strike steel."[/i] -- Description of the Limited/Zero Over Craft Essence

[[Fate/Grand Order]] character. An NPC first appearing in [[Shimousa (fate/grand order)|]], he is summoned as a pseudo-Servant using the body of [[Emiya Shirou]], as foreshadowed in the Limited/Zero Over [[Craft Essence (fate)|]].

He is later introduced as a playable Saber-class Servant in the New Years 2021 event. He also appears as an Alter Ego-class servant in [[Avalon le Fae (fate/grand order)|]].  [spoiler]He is one of the [[Foreign Disciples (fate/grand order)|]].[/spoiler]

title: code:_ultimate_(elsword)
body:
[[eve (elsword)|Eve]]'s third character class following [[code: nemesis (elsword)|Code: Nemesis]], also being the final class of this path.

[b]Appearance[/b]
Building up on the [[Code: Nemesis (elsword)|]] design, [[Eve (elsword)|]] keeps her hair down while wearing a [[mecha musume]]-like outfit with [[thigh boots|thighhigh]] [[armored boots]] and [[black gloves]].
Notable changes are the new existence of an mechanical [[crown]] which covers her emotion core which is visible in her [[code: exotic (elsword)|first]] and [[code: nemesis (elsword)|second]] class of this path. Followed by the expansion of her [[mechanical wings]] to an extensive size. Her [[armored skirt|]] also becomes more pronounced and longer, becoming more of an [[armored dress]] at this point. Lastly, her [[mechanical ears]] also change to become more [[spikes|spike]] shaped. 
Lastly, her companions of [[Moby (elsword)|]] and [[Remy (elsword)|]] further evolve as well.

Post #2945607 - Offical game art.

title: zinger_(donkey_kong)
body:
Common enemy [[wasp]]s from the [[Donkey Kong_(series)|]] series, debuting in the original [[Donkey Kong Country]]. 

They act as obstacles to be avoided, due to their abdomen being covered in [[spikes]]. Usually the Kongs alone can't defeat them with a simple jump, and need either a thrown projectile or an Animal Friend.

They come in a multitude of colors, with yellow being the default.

h4. See Also
* [[Buzz (donkey kong)|]]

title: pkd_blaster
body:
The [b]Phlanger-Katsumata "Doppelgänger" (PKD) series blaster[/b] is a futuristic looking and very powerful and devastating [[handgun]] from the 1982 [[cyberpunk]] movie [[Blade Runner]].

Because of its stopping power it is the weapon of choice of most Blade Runners when "[[murder|retiring]]" [[Replicant]]s. 

The name of the weapon shares the same initials from the [[real life]] [[science fiction]] author [[Philip K. Dick]] as a tribute, since he wrote [[do_androids_dream_of_electric_sheep?|the short story on which the movie was based]]. The prop for the film was developed using parts from a [[revolver]] and the firing mechanism of an old Austrian battle [[rifle]].
other_names: デッカードブラスター

title: turtwig
body:
[[pokemon_(creature)|Pokémon]] #0387 in the National Pokédex, a Grass-type starter.

A small, light green, quadruped Pokémon resembling a [[turtle]] or [[tortoise]].

Evolves into [[Grotle]], then [[Torterra]].

Japanese name: [b]Naetle[/b]

title: laimu_(vtuber)
body:
[i]Not to be confused with [[Lime (Vtuber)|]].[/i]

An English-speaking [[virtual youtuber|VTuber]] and a member of [[Vinesauce]]. Streaming since 2011, she debuted as a VTuber in September of 2021.

She has since gone on to grow significantly, having collaborated with other VTubers like [[Snuffy (Vtuber)|]], [[Dokibird (Vtuber)|]], and [[Mint Fantome]], among many others, such as [[Bao (Vtuber)|]], [[Matara Kan]], and many other [[VShojo]] girls.

She is a [[lime (Fruit)|]]-themed [[ferret]] [[ferret girl|girl]], though before debuting as a VTuber, she was portrayed as a [[seal (animal)|]].

When streaming with Dokibird, Mint Fantome, and Snuffy, they are known as the "Sloppy Sisters."

h4. Costumes

title: who's_that_pokemon_(meme)
body:
A parody of the eyecatch screens used in the [[pokemon (anime)|Pokémon anime]] before and after the commercial breaks. The first half of the episode cut to commercial with a [[silhouette]] view of a [[Pokemon_(creature)|Pokémon]] and asked, "Who's that Pokémon?" and returned from the commercial by colorizing the silhouette to reveal the Pokémon with a cry of "It's (species name)! (Pokemon says its name)."

h4. External links
* "Bulbapedia: Who's That Pokémon?":[https://bulbapedia.bulbagarden.net/wiki/Who's_That_Pok%C3%A9mon%3F]

title: karna_(fate)
body:
Lancer-class Servant in [[Fate/Apocrypha]] (Lancer of Red) and a Servant of [[Jinako Carigiri]] in [[Fate/extra CCC]], where he is referred to as Launcher.

Depicted as a [[white hair]]ed man with [[blue eyes]], he dons a unique set of [[armor]] with a [[cape]]. In Fate/Extra CCC, his cape is replaced with a [[fur collar]] and metal scales.

He is also a playable Servant in [[Fate/EXTELLA]] and [[Fate/Grand Order]].

He sometimes has [[heterochromia]], with the one [[red eyes|red eye]] being a weapon from which he fires his [[Brahmastra (fate/apocrypha)|]] technique (this technique is also the reason why Jinako calls him Launcher).

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[pako (pakosun)|]]
[b]Voice Actor:[/b] [[Yusa Kouji]]

title: hannibal_chew
body:
A character from the 80s science fiction film, [[Blade Runner]]. He is played by Asian-American actor "James Hong":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/James_Hong .

[b]Hannibal Chew[/b] is an excentric Asian bio-engineer expert at developing [[replicant]] eyes.

title: eldon_tyrell
body:
A character from the 80s science fiction film, [[Blade Runner]]. He is played by American actor "Joe Turkel":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Joe_Turkel .

[b]Dr. Eldon Tyrell[/b] is the biomechanics genius who founded (and owns) the large and powerful Tyrell Corporation. His most famous creations are the organic androids known as [[replicant]]s.

title: vritra_(fate)
body:
Lancer-class Servant introduced in the [[Eikou no Santa Claus Road|Christmas 2020 event]] of [[Fate/Grand Order]]. A serpent, dragon or demon in Hinduism, known as the personification of drought who kept the world's water captive until he was slain by Indra.

She chooses to appear in Fate/Grand Order as a [[dragon girl]], though as a [[dragon]] she didn't inherently have a gender. She wields the [[vajra (object)|]] that defeated her, now in the form of a [[spear]].

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[La-na]]
[b]Voice Actress:[/b] [[Asahina Madoka]]

title: lead_pipe
body:
A pipe made of lead (or any other metal), which is often used as an improvised bludgeoning [[weapon]].

For pipes that are part of a sewage or piping system, use [[industrial pipe]] instead.

h4. Examples

* !post #6251041

h4.See also

* [[List of Weapons]]

title: split_screen
body:
When the image is split into two halves with a line. Several uses for this include comparing a character's different forms; placing two characters side by side in two columns (for more columns, see [[column lineup]]); or a technique used to convey [[split theme|two clashing characters]].

h4. See also

* [[Column lineup]] - character lineup split into different columns or rows
* [[Split crop]] - only one side of the character is shown 
* [[Split theme]] - for images composed as one character but with two different halves

title: aizono_manami_(2nd_costume)
body:
The second/Halloween-themed [[official alternate costume|costume]] of [[Nijisanji]]'s [[Aizono Manami]], as seen on "Twitter":[https://twitter.com/manami_aizono/status/1189929607530606593].

h4. Appearance

* !asset #25672314
* !asset #25672315
other_names: 愛園愛美(5万人記念衣装)

title: aizono_manami
body:
A [[Nijisanji]] [[virtual YouTuber]], part of the duo [[Benizuwaigani (nijisanji)|Benizuwai-gani]] and designed by [[Itolife]]. 

She is portrayed with [[long hair|long]] [[pink hair]], [[yellow eyes]], and [[large breasts]]. 

h4. Costumes

h5. Official costumes with a model

* !post #3470735: [[Aizono Manami (1st costume)|Default]]: Maid
* !asset #25672314: [[Aizono Manami (2nd costume)|2nd costume]]: Halloween
* !asset #25672356: 3rd costume: Jersey
* !asset #25672473: [[Aizono Manami (4th costume)|4th costume]]: Date casual
* !post #7180268: [[Aizono Manami (5th costume)|5th costume]]: "Another Form"
* !post #6594533: [[Aizono Manami (6th costume)|6th costume]]: Kimono

h5. Costumes shared with other members

* NijiFes: Group Green (post #6933466)

h4. Nijisanji units and groups

* [[Benizuwaigani (Nijisanji)|]] (debut)

h4. External links

title: sugar_lights_(umamusume)
body:
Character from [i][[Umamusume]][/i].

A scientist [[horse girl]] who is confined to a wheelchair due to injuries in the past, she wants to realize her dreams, presumably of becoming a successful runner, through her invention.

She is the host of the [i]Run, Mecha Umamusume![/i] scenario, being the creator of [[Mecha Umamusume ST-2 (umamusume)|]] (or "Saty" for short), built in her image.
h4. Appearance 

* !post #8353014
other_names: シュガーライツ(ウマ娘)

title: shakacat
body:
An early 2024 [[ad|advertising]] campaign by [[McDonald's]] Japan for their "shaka shaka" shake-in-bag seasoned [[french fries|fries]] (known internationally either as McShaker Fries or as [[Shake Shake Fries]]), typically featuring or referencing one of two anime cat girls shaking said bag to a rendition of [[Nyanyanyanyanyanyanya! (vocaloid)|]] (from either post #7275638 or post #7278645).

A 2025 iteration of the campaign would have [[Hatsune Miku]] as the anime cat girl shaking the bag (as seen in post #8911236).

h4. See also

* [[Teriyaki (Synthesizer V)|]], another McDonald's collab in 2025 featuring [[Kasane Teto]]

title: garaho_flip_phone
body:
A type of Japanese [[Android (os)|]] [[smartphone]] that resembles a feature phone, being able to be folded like a [[flip phone]]. They are typically larger and more rectangular than Western flip phones, and often feature a LED display on the outside that shows the date and time.

They are commonly made by AQUOS and Sharp.

title: babysitter
body:
A person who temporarily looks after [[child]]ren while their parents are busy. Often played for laughs with an [[exhausted]] or [[annoyed]] babysitter looking after rambunctious [[aged down]] versions of other characters.

Unlike a [[teacher]], this is not necessarily a formal position - older [[siblings]] are often assigned a babysitter role, for example.

title: cleavage_cutout
body:
A [[clothing cutout]] that exposes a character's chest, [[breasts]], [[pectorals]] or [[cleavage]]. A cutout is a hole or opening that closes at both the upper and lower edges, in the same layer of clothing. Note that having a cleavage cutout doesn't necessarily mean the character has cleavage to begin with.

title: welrod_mkii_(girls'_frontline)
body:
An android representing the [[Welrod]] handgun in [[Girls' Frontline]].

Would receive a [[Welrod MkII (MOD3) (girls' frontline)|Neural Upgrade]]. In the prequel spin-off game, [[Girls' Frontline Neural Cloud|Neural Cloud]], Welrod is named Insidious. Appears in the sequel [[Girls' Frontline 2: Exilium]] as [[welrod (girls' frontline 2)|herself]].

She has [[short hair|short]] [[blonde hair]] tied into [[twintails]] and [[green eyes]]. Her default outfit consists of a [[grey shirt|grey]] [[collared shirt]], [[black vest|black]] [[pinstripe vest]] with [[notched lapels]], [[blue necktie]], [[blue gloves]], [[grey corset]], [[military jacket]] that is usually worn [[jacket on shoulders|on shoulders]], [[brown belt]], [[black skirt|black]] [[pinstripe skirt]], [[thigh holster]]s, [[grey socks]], and [[black footwear|black]] [[shoes]].

title: watcher_(evolution_smp)
body:
The Watchers are a powerful unseen entity in [[Evolution SMP]], associated with eyes and the color purple. They are capable of jumping through different versions of [[Minecraft]], creating portals for the players to use. They speak exclusively in poems and riddles.

[[Grian (youtuber)|]] became the third Watcher at the end of his series. Because of this, Watchers are also commonly used in [[Hermitcraft]] and [[Traffic Life series]] fanart.

title: gyaru
body:
Japanese [[fashion]] style that peaked in the 2000s. Although it has generally declined in real life, it still has many followers and remains popular in various Japanese media, particularily the manga & anime industry.

It has many diverse substyles, with some commonalities. Gyaru style typically involves styled and coloured hair, trendy and often sexy gyaru-style clothing (especially from the shops in the mall Shibuya 109), and [[gyaru makeup|heavy makeup]], with a focus on false [[eyelashes]], enlarging the eyes, contouring, and circle lenses. Additionally, many gyaru use the "gyaru-moji" (ギャル文字) style of typing and certain specialized slang (ギャル語). There are also certain common hobbies among gyaru: dancing [[Para Para]] was at one time a very popular activity in gyaru circles.

Two common elements of gyaru looks, especially in anime and manga representations, are tanned skin ([[ganguro]] - especially for older or throwback styles) and bleached hair. However, not every gyaru has tanned skin or bleached hair, and not every character with tanned skin and bleached hair is a gyaru.

In mainstream media, gyaru are usually depicted as either an energeric or an extroverted character, while adult media depicted either as a high-school student [[prostitution|prostitute]] or a character with unusually high sex drive.

Male [[gyaru]]s are known as [[gyaruo]]. Do not add the gyaruo tag to an [[otoko no ko]] who dresses up as a gyaru.

h4. Examples

* !post #1092131
* !post #7147489
* !post #4188980
* !post #5865647

h4. Substyles

* !post #5836809: [[Ganguro]]
* !post #8058722: [[Manba Gyaru]]
* !post #8898155: [[Onee Gyaru]]
* !post #9134534: [[Kogal]]

*Himekaji is not inherently a gyaru substyle, but is closely associated.

title: ump40_(girls'_frontline)
body:
An android representing the [[H&K UMP|H&K UMP40]] in [[Girls' Frontline]].

Curiously, one of the few select instances of dolls that can be obtained in-game that are unambiguously considered non-canon, even more so than other cases. [spoiler]She ends up representing three characters in-game as a result: the non-canon acquireable UMP40, who hangs out with [[MP5 (girls' frontline)|]], the canon UMP40 who was [[UMP45 (girls' frontline)|]]'s sister and died during the Butterfly Incident, and the UMP40 OGAS that developed in UMP45's Neural Cloud on the basis of her memories of UMP40.[/spoiler] In the sequel [[Girls' Frontline 2: Exilium]], UMP40 appears as [[Lainie (girls' frontline 2)|]][spoiler], the OGAS receiving her own body[/spoiler].

Her original illustrator [[Renatus.Z]] adapted her design from one of his Pixiv Fantasia characters, [[Natius (pixiv fantasia)|]]. Following Renatus' departure, other illustrators have picked her up to do her skins. She is voiced by Uema Umi.

h4. Appearance

title: lord_el-melloi_ii
body:
[[Aged up|Older version]] of [[Waver Velvet]].

[spoiler]He is only a steward of the title, having been given it by [[Reines El-Melloi Archisorte]], the proper heir of the house of El-Melloi. This was both in recognition of his accomplishments, as well as in exchange for assisting the El-Melloi after the destabilizing impact made by the death of [[Kayneth El-Melloi Archibald|Kayneth Archibald]].[/spoiler]

Can be summoned in [[Fate/Grand Order]] under the Caster designation, but as the host body of [[Zhuge Liang]] (similar to how [[Tohsaka Rin]] is the host of Ishtar).

[spoiler]He is responsible for dismantling the Holy Grail after the fifth Holy Grail War. He is also the only surviving master of the 4th Grail War, following the deaths of [[Emiya Kiritsugu]] and [[Kotomine Kirei]].[/spoiler]

[[Tohsaka Rin]]'s lecturer at the Magus Association and possesses an interest in the popular culture of Japan (though he likes little else about the country).

Featured as the eponymous protagonist of [[Lord El-Melloi II Case Files]] novel series written by Sanda Makoto and illustrated by [[Sakamoto Mineji]].

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[Takeuchi Takashi]]
[b]Voice Actor:[/b] [[Namikawa Daisuke]]

h4. Appearance

title: reversible_couple
body:
A [[couple]] that switches between dominant and submissive roles, sexual or not. 
This can involve any sexual act and does not require [[anal]] or vaginal [[sex]], but it is the most common depiction.

Especially in [[yaoi]], a reversible couple will top and bottom for one another. [[Hetero]] and [[yuri]] couples may make use of a [[strap-on]] to achieve penetration. 

Different roles for each character can appear in:- 

* Single image: post #6739606, post #6138695
* In a related image: post #6755546 with post #6755554
* Non-sexual depiction: post #6657405, post #6534375 with post #6537710, post #6947169 with post #6947170
* Implied [[reversible couple]]: post #6573362, post #6921017

This tag does not apply to images where a character tops and bottoms with different individuals.

h4. See also 

* [[assertive female]]
* [[muscular uke]]
* [[top/bottom dynamic annotated]]
* [[role reversal]]

title: top/bottom_dynamic_annotated
body:
When an illustration indicates who tops, and who bottoms in a relationship. Alternately, the illustration may contain [[multiple views]] of the same character annotated as being "top" and "bottom" versions of them.

Depending on context, that means either who's the one penetrating and penetrated, the one who dominates and the one who submits, the one who is active and who is passive, and so on. This also applies to other related terms, such as seme (攻め) and uke (受け), tachi (タチ) and neko (ネコ), or 凸 and 凹.

This practice is especially common in [[yaoi]] works that do not depict penetrative sex directly, as top/bottom preference in a character is often associated with specific personality traits, though it may also be seen in non-yaoi works.

h4. Examples

* !post #8897706
* !post #6492944
* !post #8862207
* !post #5199633
* !post #1334794

title: sendai_hakurei_no_miko_(osana_reimu)
body:
The [[Sendai Hakurei No Miko]] from the very popular fanwork [[Osana Reimu]] and its sequel [[Reireimu]], a story about Sendai Miko, a young Reimu, and an [[EX-Rumia|adult]] [[Rumia]]. This brown-haired version looks almost identical to Reimu herself, only taller and more endowed - and usually wearing some sort of [[mask]].

Other variations exist which show her taking more from the [[sendai hakurei no miko (m.u.g.e.n)|M.U.G.E.N]] version of the character, such as her outfit and pitch-black hair. Again, a mask is often used to distinguish her as the Osana Reimu Sendai.

title: sendai_hakurei_no_miko_(m.u.g.e.n)
body:
先代博麗の巫女 ([i]Sendai Hakurei no Miko[/i], "The previous generation's Hakurei shrine maiden")

A fanmade [[M.U.G.E.N]] character by MUGEN author Pre-to and [[Touhou]] [[Original]] Character.

Depicted as [[hakurei_reimu|Reimu]]'s predecessor. She was apparently not created with a proper given(first) name, so her name may vary. Usually portrayed as a powerful physical fighter.

She wears a [[nontraditional miko|customized]] miko uniform consisting of a one-piece skintight [[leotard]] rather than a sarashi (frequently resulting in [[sideboob]]), sturdy [[combat boots]], and sometimes [[hakama pants]] rather than a skirt.

Also, unlike Reimu, she does not wear a ribbon on the back of her head, although in some depictions, she wears one to tie her long hair together near the end. Some artists depict her as muscular and/or covered in scars.

She is usually depicted as Reimu's mother, though as a fan character her relation to Reimu on the Hakurei family tree can change with each depiction.

title: gunko
body:
Gunko is a character from [[One Piece]]. She was first introduced during the Elbaph Arc, along with [spoilers]other [b]God's Knights[/b] like [[Figarland Shamrock]], [[Shepherd Sommers]] and [[Rimoshifu Killingham]][/spoilers].

She wears a [[double-breasted]] [[black jacket]] that has [[sleeves past fingers]] and a [[black hat|black]] [[peaked cap]], most likely a [[rogatywka]]. She's dressed in [[black panties]] and [[black boots]]. Depending on the height of her [[bandaged leg|bandaged legs]], she may have [[bare legs]].

Gunko has [[heterochromia]] in the form of both [[mismatched pupils]] and [[mismatched irises]]. A [[mouth mask]] adorns her face. She has [[short hair]] and there are [[goggles on headwear|goggles on her hat]].

As for Gunko's [[devil fruit power|powers]], [spoilers]she ate the Aro Aro no Mi, a [[devil fruit]] that grants her the power to cast and use [[arrow (symbol)|arrow symbols]] in various ways[/spoilers].

Technically, when testicles are tagged, it is actually the scrotum surrounding the testicles which is visible in most cases. A true view of the testicles would require a cross-section.

title: love_live!
body:
A Japanese multimedia franchise by [[Bushiroad]] in collaboration with [[Sunrise (company)|]], revolving around groups of fictional high school girls who become idols to compete in the titular national school idol tournament.

It is notable for being one of the first to link the fictional idol character with the [[real life]] semi-idol group consisting of a newly recruited [[voice actor|voice actress]] specifically for the character (with the exception of some members of the first installment who already had an existing voice acting and music career). This format would later be replicated by its sister franchise [[BanG Dream!]], which is fully managed by Bushiroad themselves.

h4. Series

* [[Love Live! School Idol Project]]
* [[Love Live! Sunshine!!]]
* [[Love Live! Nijigasaki High School Idol Club]]
* [[Love Live! Superstar!!]]
* [[Link! Like! Love Live!]]
* [[Love Live! Bluebird]]

h4. Games

* [[Love Live! School Idol Festival]] 
* [[Love Live! School Idol Festival ~After School ACTIVITY~]]
* [[Love Live! School Idol Festival All Stars]]

title: aesc_(fate)
body:
Old English for "[b]ash tree[/b]", alternatively known as [b]Tonelico[/b] in the original Japanese.

The savior in the legend of Faerie Britain in Lostbelt no. 6, Avalon le Fae. [spoilers]She is the Lostbelt's [[Morgan le Fay (Fate)|]] before she gave up her ideal of saving the Faeries after countless betrayals and turns into the tyrannical Lostbelt Queen when Chaldea arrives.[/spoilers]

Her appearance is almost identical to that of [[Artoria Caster (second ascension) (fate)|Artoria Caster's second Ascension]], [spoilers]as they both originated as Faeries of Avalon[/spoilers]. The most prominent differences are the color of the bow holding up her [[capelet]] being [[black bow|black]] instead of [[blue bow|blue]]/[[purple bow|purple]] and the staff she holds not being the [[Staff of Selection (fate)|]]. Other differences include the design & color of the [[brooch]] on the bow, the size of the bow on the back of her hat, and the design on the side of her hat, though not all of these may be incorporated in illustrations. [spoiler]Her summonable form's [[aesc (savior) (fate)|second Ascension]] also resembles [[Artoria Caster (third Ascension) (Fate)|Artoria Caster's third Ascension]] for similar reasons.[/spoiler]

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[Takeuchi Takashi]]
[b]Voice Actress:[/b] [[Ishikawa Yui]]

title: tastiera_(racehorse)
body:
[tn]Italian: "(Musical) Keyboard". Follows his family's musical theme naming.[/tn]
Japanese racehorse. Sired by [[Satono Crown (racehorse)|]] and foaled by Partitura (from [[Manhattan Cafe (racehorse)|]]).

Winner of the 2023 [[Tokyo Yushun]] (Japanese Derby) and the 2025 Queen Elizabeth II Cup (the one in Hong Kong). However, both of his major wins were marred by the incidental death of another racer: [[Skilfing (racehorse)|]] at the Derby and, most tragically, [[Liberty Island (racehorse)|]] at the QEII Cup.

He is a bay horse with a distinctive, roughly heart-shaped star marking as well as a pastern on his right hindleg and a sock on his left hind leg.

In the context of [i][[Umamusume]][/i], the horse is often drawn with his sire's [[Satono Crown (umamusume)|Umamusume counterpart]], especially in reference to the simultaneous ascendancy of Season 3's main cast and their RL progeny.
[spoiler]He is also directly refered to as the "Horse girl with green eyes" in Satono Crown's ending.[/spoiler]
If depicted as a horse girl, Tastiera will almost always have the distinctive "heart-on-a-stem" marking in the same way Satono Crown has her distinctive "crown" marking.

title: liberty_island_(racehorse)
body:
[tn]Named after the island where the [[Statue of Liberty]] is situated.[/tn]
Japanese [[horse|racehorse]]. Sired by [[Duramente (racehorse)|]] and foaled by Yankee Rose.

This filly is famous for outright dominating the 2023 Triple Tiara by winning all three races and becoming the seventh Japanese Triple Tiara, the third in five years, following [[Almond Eye (racehorse)|]] in 2018 and [[Daring Tact (racehorse)|]] in 2020. Unfortunately, victory became elusive afterwards and any chance she would have broken out of her slump was rendered moot when she fell at the 2025 Queen Elizabeth II Cup in Hong Kong and needed to be euthanized.

She was a bay filly with a star and thin broken stripe marking. She can be easily distinguished by her mane fringe braid, decorated with a pompom of some sort.

In the context of [i][[Umamusume]][/i], Liberty Island is often drawn together with other Triple Tiara winners as well as her RL sire [[Duramente (umamusume)|]], with her racing outfit often making references to the Statue of Liberty or those of her sire.

title: assault_lily
body:
A mixed-media franchise that began in 2013 as a series of 1/12 scale action figures from Azone International. The figures are based on Azone's Picco Neemo doll line and thus compatible with the 1/12 fabric clothes produced by them and 3rd parties.

Artists that have done character key illustrations for the franchise include [[Yaegashi Nan]], [[Nauribon]] and [[hotaru (ultraroly poly)|Hotaru]].

The background story is set in the near future, where mankind is under threat by mysterious giant monsters called Huge that can only be fought by Lilies—girls who can use weapons called CHARMs to channel the power of Magie. Lilies fight in teams of five or more known as "Legions," and attend academies known as "Gardens" which train and command them.

Other parts of the media mix include ongoing stage plays since 2016; several light novels and webnovels; two anime series, [i]Assault Lily: Bouquet[/i] and [i]Assault Lily: Fruits[/i]; and a social game for phones and PCs, [i]Assault Lily: Last Bullet[/i], that began service in early 2021.

title: touhou
body:
"東方" (Japanese for "eastern") 

A series of "bullet hell" vertical shooter games created by [[ZUN (artist)|]], featuring a large cast of girls and almost no male characters.

Touhou first appeared on the NEC PC-9801 computers in its first five games between 1996 and 1998 before going into hiatus, during which time ZUN left his former team, Amusement Makers. These games make up the [[Touhou (PC-98)]] era. In 2002 he returned as the one-man doujin group [i]Team Shanghai Alice[/i] and released Touhou for Windows, thus exposing it to a larger audience. 

The games themselves, mostly in the [[danmaku]] ("bullet hell") genre, are addictive and have acquired a large following. In particular, his original music is incredibly popular and is the subject of numerous doujin remix albums.

Currently Touhou has nineteen mainstream danmaku shooter games, six danmaku spinoffs, six fighting spinoffs and an action spinoff, with the fighting games and action game made in collaboration with Tasogare Frontier. The series also has a number of supplementary materials including manga, short stories, fanbooks, and music CDs.

The backgrounds and personalities of its characters (the majority of which come from the Windows generation) are often expanded upon in doujins and, occasionally, ZUN canonizes some concepts. 

Touhou is also notable for being a [i]de facto[/i] open source franchise, in which ZUN allows various fan works such as doujinshi and video games to be published and sold with little to no licensing fees. This allowed the franchise to remain popular to this day.

[b]NOTE:[/b] Don't tag individual Touhou games unless the game is directly referenced by the post. All of the characters in a picture having debuted in the same game is not enough to count. The full cast of a game (with or without the protagonists) appearing will usually count, so long as no other characters are present.

A "Direct Reference" can include, but may not be limited to:
* Depiction of [[gameplay mechanics]] found in the game (post #4907093)
* Any kind of [[parody]] of the game or other work (post #4546543)
* A character drawn in a pose from their official art (post #4495699)
* A character wearing an outfit from a game or other work instead of their "usual" outfit, ranging from outfits that only differ slightly (post #4419411), to outfits that differ entirely, (e.g [[Turbo Byakuren]]). This may also include physical changes specific for a game (post #1366406)
* The name of the game or other work being written in the post (post #3865937)

title: concrete
body:
A prominent presence of concrete, such as a (background) wall or a floor. If a character is positioned against a concrete wall, also use [[against wall]], or on a concrete floor, also use [[on floor]].

h4. See also
* [[Concrete mixer truck]]
* [[Construction site]]

title: pottery
body:
[b]pottery[/b] are any objects that made from fired [[clay]] or other moldable materials, and hold both liquids and solids inside of them, this especially included any vessels and trays that hold [[food]]s and [[drink]]s like [[bottle]]s, [[jar]]s, [[pot]]s, [[dishes]], and [[bowl]]s. Any general clay objects can be categorized as pottery, but more specific ceramic materials like earthenware, porcelain, and stoneware can also be broadly covered by this tag.

h4. Related tags

* [[potters wheel]]
* [[cinder block]]
* [[brick]]
* [[concrete]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Pottery":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pottery]

title: potters_wheel
body:
A [[machine]] used for spinning [[clay]] or another moldable material to make symmetrically even pattern on the workpiece to create the perfect shape of the [[pottery]] by trimming excess clay off it, with user's bare hand or some hand [[tools]], before it can fired. It can be electrical or foot-powered.

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Potter's wheel":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Potter%27s_wheel]

title: blunderbuss
body:
A [b]blunderbuss[/b] is a [[firelock]] muzzle-loading [[gun|firearm]] with a short, large caliber barrel, which is flared at the muzzle and frequently throughout the entire bore.  this allows the weapon spread all the projectiles to any directions, from its flared muzzle, A blunderbuss can fire round lead pellets and any smaller projectiles of relevant quantity and/or caliber. It's essentially a one-shot muzzle-loaded [[shotgun]], during the 17th century to the 18th century.

h4. See also

* [[List of Weapons]]
* [[Flintlock]]
* [[Musket]]

h4. External link

* "Wikipedia: Blunderbuss":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Blunderbuss

title: dreyse_needle_gun
body:
The [b]Dreyse needle gun[/b] is an single-shot [[bolt action]], breech-loading [[rifle]] that was invented by Johann Nikolaus von Dreyse. It is famous for being the first bolt-action rifle that has been fielded by an national military, and serve as the design basis of all future bolt-action rifles that surpassed it. It entered in service as the main infantry weapons of the [[Prussia]]n Army in 1841, toward the unification of the [[German Empire]] in 1871. After the unification, it was replaced by an improved version of it as the [b]Mauser Model 1871[/b], which further improvement of the design has led to the rise of the the Mauser [[gun|rifle]] family, which its latest version is the [[Mauser 98]].

Its military designation as the "ignition needle rifle" (German: Zündnadelgewehr) was based on its firing pin, since it passed like a needle through the paper  [[cartridge]] to strike a percussion cap at the base of the bullet.

h4. See also

* [[List of Weapons]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Dreyse needle gun":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dreyse_needle_gun
* "Wikipedia: needle gun":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/needle_gun

title: fusil_mle._1866
body:
The [b]Fusil modèle 1866[/b] (Also known as the [b]Chassepot[/b]) is a single-shot breech-loaded [[bolt action]] [[rifle]] that was invented in 1866 by Antoine Alphonse [b]Chassepot[/b] and used a needle ignition mechanism to fire a wax paper cartridge, like [[dreyse needle gun]].

h4. See also

* [[List of Weapons]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Chassepot":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chassepot

title: madsen_machine_gun
body:
The [b]Madsen[/b] [[machine gun]] is a Danish magazine-fed, recoil-operated [[light machine gun]]. It can recognized by its curved [[magazine (weapon)|magazine]] that feeds from the top, the [[bipod]] on its [[barrel shroud]] and its carry handle, like the [[bren lmg|Bren]], but unlike it, the Madsen is more shorter than the Bren and lacks a pistol grip.

h4. See also

* [[List of weapons]]

h4. External links

* Wikipedia entry: "Madsen machine gun":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Madsen_machine_gun

title: hawker_hurricane
body:
The Hawker Hurricane was a British fighter aircraft built for the [[Royal Air Force]]. Serving alongside the contemporary [[Supermarine Spitfire]] in [[World War II]], this early monoplane was initially armed with 8 .303 [[browning m1919|Browning]] [[machine gun]]s in its wings. Later Hurricanes were commonly fitted with four 20mm cannons and could also carry a 500lb bomb under each wing (these earned the nickname "Hurribombers"). The Mk.IID version was an anti-tank model used extensively in Africa which sported 2x.303 machine guns loaded with tracers for aiming its 2x40mm anti-tank cannons.

The Sea Hurricane was a carrier-based variant. Some standard models were mounted on merchantmen with catapults and used for convoy protection.

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Hawker Hurricane":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hawker_Hurricane

title: browning_m1919
body:
The [b]Browning M1919[/b] is a .30-06 caliber [[weapon]] developed by [[john moses browning|John M. Browning]] as an adaptation of the [[Browning M1917]] to an air-cooled, closed-bolt, [[ammunition belt|belt-fed]] medium machine gun. It served as the main general-purpose machine gun of the United States military during [[World War II]] and the [[Korean War]] era. After the Lend-Lense Act was signed, many M1919's were re-chambered in the standard [[rifle cartridge]]s of other alllied nations' militaries. Famously, .303 caliber M1919s served as the main aircraft armament of the [[Supermarine Spitfire]] and [[Hawker Hurricane]] fighters, and other countries with their own industrial bases such as [[FN Herstal]] of [[Belgium]] were allowed to mass-produce their own M1919s under license.

The Browning M1919 is usually seen mounted as the fixed armament or movable turret on [[military vehicle|military]] [[aircraft]]s and [[ground vehicle]]s. In the infantry role, the early-war M1919A4 was used as a medium machine gun with a [[tripod]], though later in the war saw the development of the M1919A6 with a rifle stock and bipod in order to turn the weapon into a true [[light machine gun]]. It could also be picked up and fired from the hip in times of true need or desperation, though artistic depictions of this are usually references to [[Dr. Strangelove]].

In Anime, the weapon is connected most to [[Francesca Lucchini]] of [[Strike Witches]], though it is used by several other characters in the [[World Witches Series]] as well. 

h4. See also

* [[List of Weapons]]
* [[M1919A4 (Girls' Frontline)]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: M1919 browning machine gun":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/M1919_Browning_machine_gun
other_names: ブローニングM1919重機関銃

title: internet
body:
The Internet is the global system of interconnected [[computer]] networks that uses the Internet protocol suite (TCP/IP) to communicate between networks and devices.

This tag can be applied when a "generic" depiction of internets, such as web browser, social media, etc., appeared in the image.

h4. See Also
* [[egosearching]]
* [[social network]]

title: allen_wrench
body:
[b]Allen wrenches[/b] (also known as "hex keys") are small L-shaped hexagonal-prismatic steel bars that used as a [[wrench]] to loosen or tighten fasteners like [[bolt (hardware)|]]s or [[screw]]s  that have heads with internal hexagonal recesses (sockets).

h4. See also

* [[Impact wrench]]
* [[Socket wrench]]
* [[tools]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Hex key":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hex_key]

title: pipe_wrench
body: A type of [[adjustable wrench]] designed to turn pipe fittings. Example: post #6481743. It can be identified by the adjustable jaw on top of the rest of [[wrench]], the teeth on both of its jaws, and It handle being colored red.

title: lug_wrench
body:
[b]Lug wrenches[/b] are a type of [[wrench]] that that have specifically-shaped holes (its "sockets") on their ends to physically fit a [[motor vehicle|vehicle]] wheel [[nut (hardware)|]]s (the wheel "lugs"), the fasteners used to hold the smaller parts of the wheel together in place, and are used to either loosen or tighten them.

A lug wrench can come as either L-shaped metal rod, or X-shaped piece, and may be considered as non-ratcheting [[socket wrench]], because they used special shaped holes can be [[socket (tool)|swappable]] with other pieces or not. A lug wrench may be confused with an tire lever by referring them as "tire iron''  a tool that used to separate the tire or hubcaps of the wheel that may be covering a wheel's lug nuts.

h4. See also

* [[Impact wrench]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Lug wrench":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lug_wrench

title: blaser_r93
body:
The [b]Blaser R93[/b] is a [[bolt action]] precision rifle offered in a multitude of calibers and barrel lengths manufactured by the German firearms manufacturer Blaser. it had a number of features rare on an typical hunting rifle, including a straight-pull cycling system and a proprietary Blaser saddle scope mount for mounting the optic directly to the quick-change barrel.

h4. External links
* "Wikipedia: Blaser R93":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Blaser_R93

title: beretta_px4
body:
The [b]Beretta px4[/b] is semi-automatic [[handgun]] that was manufactured by Beretta to compete with the [[glock]] brand. Its gun design consists of steel slide and polymer frame, It come in three sizes (full, compact, and subcompact) and three calibers (9x19 Parabelleum, .45 ACP, .40 S&W).

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Beretta Px4 Storm":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Beretta_Px4_Storm
* "Beretta: Px4 Family":https://www.beretta.com/en-us/firearms/by-gun-family/px4-storm-family

title: mannlicher_m1886
body:
Ferdinand Mannlicher's first straight-pull [[bolt action]] [[rifle]] that was designed in 1886, to serve as the standard infantry weapon for [[Austria-Hungary]]. The rifle was quickly made obsolete by the introduction of the Lebel Model 1886 rifle with its new smokeless cartridge. As such it was quickly replaced in Austrian service by more modern Mannlicher rifles, up to [[Mannlicher m1895]].

It used a wedge-lock straight pull action bolt. It was the first straight-pull bolt-action service rifle of any nation.

h1. External links
* "Wikipedia: Mannlicher M1886":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/mannlicher_m1886

The rifle [[firing| fires]] the 8×56mmR in its 5-rounds, en-bloc [[clip (weapon) | clip]] and internal-magazine loading system, as its original predecessor weapon, the [[mannlicher m1886]]
