title: martini-henry
body:
The [b]Martini-Henry[/b] is a single-shot [[lever action]] breech loading [[rifle]] that fires the .577/450 as its [[ammunition]] and was developed in 1870, as the main [[soldier|infantry]] weapon for [[army]] of the [[United kingdom|British]] empire, in many colonial wars of the late 19th century, until it was replaced by the [[lee-enfield|Lee-Metford]] in its roles, as 20th century began. Its name came from the two source: Friedrich von [b]Martini[/b], the Swiss designer who invented its lever-activated falling-block action, and Alexander [b]Henry[/b], the Scottish gunsmith who developed the weapon's [[rifling]].

h4. See also

* [[List of Weapons]]
* [[Martini-Henry (Girls' Frontline)]]
* [[Trapdoor Springfield ]] The American counterpart to the Martini-Henry, as an single-shot rifle.
* [[Berdan rifle]] The Russian counterpart to the Martini-Henry, as an single-shot rifle.

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Martini henry":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Martini–Henry
* "Powder and Lead: Martini henry":https://powderandlead.net/martini-henry/
other_names: マルティニ・ヘンリー銃

title: sylphiette_(mushoku_tensei)
body:
A female character from the novel, manga and anime series [[Mushoku Tensei]]. A beloved childhood friend of [[Rudeus Greyrat]], [spoiler]later on known under the cover identity [b]Fitts/Fitz[/b] before eventually becoming Rudeus's [[polygamy|first]] wive. She is also the granddaughter of [[Elinalise Dragonroad]][/spoiler].

She is of mixed heritage (she has elven, human and beast race ancestors), and inherited [[pointy ears]] from the former. Her hair was initially [[green hair|green]] and short, but due to the ordeal following the Teleport Catastrophe, it became [[white hair|white]] (she also let her hair grow longer).

h4. External links

* "Mushoku Tensei Wiki: Sylphiette":[https://mushokutensei.fandom.com/wiki/Sylphiette]
other_names: シルフィエット・グレイラット

title: berdan_rifle
body:
The [b]Berdan rifle[/b] is a single-shot, breech-loaded [[rifle]] invented by American engineer Hiram Berdan and is chambered in 10.75×58mmR [[ammunition]]. It was the service rifle of the Imperial Russian Army from 1870 to 1891, and evetually replaced by [[Mosin-Nagant]]. 
This tag covers all the two variants: Berdan I which is a trapdoor breech block gun, and the [[bolt action]] Berdan II.

h4. See also

* [[List of Weapons]]
* [[Martini-henry]] The British counterpart to the Berdan, as an single-shot rifle.
* [[Trapdoor Springfield]] The American counterpart to the Berdan, as an single-shot rifle.

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Berdan rifle":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Berdan_rifle

title: space_ishtar_(fate)
body:
Avenger-Class variant of [[Ishtar (fate)|]] from the Servant Universe in [[Fate/Grand Order]], first appearing in [[Battle in New York 2019]] before being featured in the [[Saber Wars II]] event.

Each ascension is presented as a different individual, with [b]Astarte[/b] as her [[Space Ishtar (First Ascension) (fate)|first ascension]], [b]Space Ishtar[/b] as her [[Space Ishtar (Second Ascension) (fate)|second ascension]] (nicknamed Ishtarin), and [b]Ishtar Astarte[/b] as her [[Space Ishtar (Third Ascension) (fate)|third ascension]].

Astarte and Ishtarin were originally fragments of the primordial goddess [[Space Ishtar (Astarte Origin) (fate)|Astarte Origin]], being split into good and evil halves. Ishtarin was raised by [[Tohsaka Tokiomi|Professor Tokiomi]] and started work as a bounty hunter alongside [[Calamity Jane (fate)|]] after his death, while Astarte was raised by [[Yagyuu Munenori (fate)|Munenori]] to be the emotionless leader of the Space Shinkageryuu. [spoiler]While Ishtarin was initially assumed to be the good half and Astarte the evil half, it's revealed in one of Tokiomi's recordings that the opposite is true. This revelation is what allows them to synchronize into Ishtar Astarte.[/spoiler]

[[Bel Maana (fate)|]] is summoned when using their [[Noble Phantasm (fate)|]] [b]Edin Shugurra Quasar[/b], manifesting the massive goddess shrine the size of a galaxy (or rather, a galaxy that takes the form of a goddess).

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[Morii Shizuki]]
[b]Voice Actress:[/b] [[Ueda Kana]]

title: sitonai_(fate)
body:
[[Fate/Grand Order]] character first appearing in the [[Gotterdammerung (fate/grand order)|]] Lostbelt. An Alter Ego-class pseudo-Servant who is three divine spirits in one body - the Ainu Kamuy Sitonai, the Norse goddess Freyja and the Finnish witch-queen Louhi inhabiting the body of [[Illyasviel von Einzbern]], specifically the one from [[Fate/Stay Night]].

Appearance-wise, she is simply [[Illyasviel von Einzbern]] wearing an approximation of [[ainu clothes]] in white with purple trims and accents, using patterns based on triangles and rhombuses instead of traditional Ainu patterning. She is carrying a short [[sword]]. This apparently is due to Sitonai having the strongest influence out of the divine trio in her body. Her hair is also in [[low-tied sidelocks]], while Illya leaves her sidelocks untied.

She also carries a [[bow (weapon)|]] for her Noble Phantasm, and is seen in battle with a large white bear named [[Shirou (bear) (fate)|Shirou]] at her side.

For tagging purposes, she considered a different character than [[Illyasviel von Einzbern]]. Only tag both if both are in the image.

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[BLACK (artist)|]]
[b]Voice Actress:[/b] [[Kadowaki Mai]]

title: kamichama_karin
body:
Kamichama Karin is a fantasy shoujo manga about a 13-year old girl named [[Hanazono Karin]] who discovers that she has the hidden power of a goddess.

Infamous for its art style, which gives everyone [[very big eyes]]. One [[quality]] "image":https://media.japanesewithanime.com/images/175/sakuga-houkai-kamichama-karin.jpg/ of Karin in particular has been widely circulated and is mistakenly associated with [[Tsukimiya Ayu]]'s catchphrase "[[uguu~]]".

title: anya's_mother_(spy_x_family)
body:
A character from the backstory of the manga and anime [[Spy x Family]]. She was the biological mother of the main character [[Anya (spy x family)|]]. Judging by her wearing the same hospital gown as her daughter and expressing a desire to soar through the skies like a butterfly, she was likely imprisoned by the same scientists who experimented on Anya, inadvertently granting her the superpower of [[mind reading]].

From her limited appearances, she resembles an older Anya or [[Ashe (rengoku_no_ashe)|]] from [[Rengoku no Ashe]], another manga by [[Endou Tatsuya]].

title: quality
body:
[tn]This term is properly spelled "QUALITY" (without the quotes), in ALL CAPS. This tag is written in lowercase due to limitations in Danbooru's tagging system.[/tn]

The term "QUALITY" indicates (with ironic intent) glaring yet humorous errors and flaws in commercial works of poor quality or works of otherwise good quality. This can be caused by poor budgeting (blowing most of the budget of an anime into the first episodes, per example), a small budget or outsourcing to cheaper studios, although it can also be as a result of a honest mistake.

The Japanese equivalent is "ヤシガニ" ("Coconut crab"), a reference to [[Lost Universe]]'s 4th episode which, due to the show's notoriously bad animation, was turned into a byword for bad animation in general. A more descriptive term is "作画崩壊" ("Animation collapse").

This tag can be applied to any posts that [i]intentionally[/i] recreates the disfigured art or animation frame for humorous purposes. Do [i]not[/i] apply this tag to any other post with generally poor quality otherwise. For posts featuring an error unintentionally created by an artist, see [[artistic error]].

h4. See also
* [[Anubis-kun]]
* [[cursed M4A1 (meme)]]
* [[Ecce Homo]]
* [[Mobile Suit Gundam: Cucuruz Doan's Island]]
* [[quality cabbage (meme)|]]
* [[running ganger (meme)]]
* [[Sader]]
* [[Takahashi Youichi (style)]]

title: strasbourg_(azur_lane)

title: sheska_(girls_und_panzer)
body:
Character from [[Girls und Panzer]] spin-off series [[Girls und Panzer Little Army]].

A German girl with long [[pink hair]].

She is introduced in Little Army II. She met [[Nakasuga Emi]] in Germany before, in the same senshadou team, and later comes to Japan as well and joins Kuromorimine Girls' Academy and their senshadou team, eventually competing against Emi.

title: ashiya_douman_(fate)
body:
Alter Ego-class Servant seen in [[Fate/Grand Order]], first introduced in the [[Shimousa (fate/grand order)|]] arc as [b]Caster of Limbo[/b]. Ashiya Douman is best known as the [[onmyouji]] rival of [[Abe no Seimei (fate)|]]. He is one of the [[Foreign Disciples (fate/grand order)|]] helping facilitating the advent of the Alien God.

As an Alter Ego, his component spirits are "Itzpapalotl":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ītzpāpālōtl, "Chernobog":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chernobog_and_Belobog, and [[Akimitsu-dono]]. Perhaps due to Itzpapalotl being a female goddess, Douman's gender is listed as unknown in official material.

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[Furumi Showichi]]
[b]Voice Actor:[/b] [[Morikawa Toshiyuki]]

title: akimitsu-dono
body:
A minor character appearing in [[Fate/Grand Order]]. A component of [[Ashiya Douman (fate)|]]'s spirit origin as an Alter Ego servant, known as the [b]Evil Spirit Left Minister[/b] (Akuryou-safu). He materializes him as a vengeful spirit when using his Noble Phantasm, where he appears as a black skeleton.

His true name is Fujiwara no Akimitsu, [[Fujiwara no Michinaga (fate)|]]'s son.

title: blue_archive
body:
A Korean mobile gacha RPG developed by Nexon Games (Previously known as NAT Games before the merger), MX Studio and published by Shanghai Yostar (JP) and [[Nexon]] (Global). Known as Project MX in its earliest development.

The game revolves around a player character, known simply as "[[Sensei (blue archive)|]]" (先生 / teacher), a person brought in to assist in running the city of Kivotos following the mysterious disappearance of the president of its General Student Council. The player must assist in solving local issues, managing students, and assisting various schools, while investigating the mystery behind why the GSC president left. Gameplay takes place in a 3D isometric view, but is largely automatic, with player input being limited to triggering "Skill Cards" that enable students' special abilities.

The story begins with a prologue, and each set with Volumes each. starting from the 1st volume (which is Abydos) until the 5th Volume (which focuses on Hyakkiyako). Main story expansions may update every week or months.

The [[Blue Archive the animation|Anime adaptation]] aired on April 7, 2024. The First Season included the Foreclosure Task Force and the Handyman 68, with a major focus of the First Volume in the Game's lore

Blue Archive also had collaborations outside from the game, including peculiar choice such as [[World of Warships]].

title: halo
body:
A bright ring or circle of light typically hovering above or traditionally behind the head that either symbolizes purity or to denote that the character is an [[angel]] or [[icon (religion)|saint]]. This tag applies generally to all kinds of halos which hover over one's head, such as a [[mechanical halo]], not just those that are considered traditional - for such halos only, see [[traditional halo]].

Currently, the most common usage of halos on Danbooru are in [[Blue Archive]] due to the abundance of students with unique halos hovering over their heads, which symbolize each individual's personality and their citizenship in the academic city of Kivotos.

Not to be confused with the optical phenomenon caused by ice crystals in the atmosphere surrounding the sun or moon, forming a halo [i](see [b]External Links[/b])[/i], or halo-like artifacts of light caused by bright light sources interacting with the camera lens. The latter is a [[lens flare]].

For the video game, see [[Halo (series)|]].

title: putit
body:
The [[Elona]] version of the basic [[slime (substance)|]] monster, a direct reference to the [[slime_(Dragon_Quest)|iconic mascot characters]] of [[Dragon Quest]].

Like most slime monsters in RPGs that directly reference Dragon Quest, the standard types are some of the weakest monsters in the game, (although [[snail|snails]] are still weaker,) but more powerful palette-swap versions exist.

Putits are blue-gray and jelly bean-shaped with a pointy "tail", and have two black dot eyes.  They are otherwise featureless and often semi-transparent.

Unlike other games' slimes, putits are specifically listed as being loved by women in their game world, as their "meat" is considered "great for the skin", and eating a putit corpse gives massive training to charisma.  Players often ranch putits for this reason.

Elona+ putits and slimes can be evolved into [[slime girl]]s if female, or [[roper|ropers]] if male.

title: mihono_bourbon_(umamusume)
body:
Character from [i][[Umamusume]][/i]. She has [[long hair|long]] [[brown_hair|brown]] [[inward flipped hair]] with [[double-parted bangs]] decorated with a [[metal_hairband|metal]] [[hairband]].

Mihono Bourbon has an appropriately stoic and robotic personality to the point that even her character lapses are somehow in-character, often making her do a confused "does not compute" [[blank stare]] à la [[Space Cat (meme)|]].

Ironically, despite her theme, she is terrible with technology, sometimes to the point of frying computers by her simple presence. Her history is intertwined with Rice Shower's as they were rivals in real life. She refers to her [[Trainer (Umamusume)|]] as "Master".

title: oda_nobunaga_(koha-ace)
body:
Archer-class servant of [[Saber (fate)|Artoria]] from the Type-Moon parody work [[Koha-Ace]], originally appearing under the alias "Demon Archer". She also appears as a playable servant in [[Fate/Grand Order]] and as the servant of [[Asama Kaname]] in [[Fate/type Redline]].

She is a [[genderswap (mtf)|]]ped version of the Japanese Sengoku-era warlord [[Oda Nobunaga|of the same name]]. Often referred as "Nobu" for short.

Her Noble Phantasm is Three Thousand Worlds, a barrage of shots from the many muskets she used that gained her the title of "Devil King of Sixth Heaven".

Nobunaga is often depicted in [[naked cape]] as a result of a running gag in Koha-Ace about how she would occasionally "feeling hot", referencing the real life counterpart's death during the Honnouji temple incident. This were later elaborated upon in a more symbolic meaning in [[Fate/Grand Order]] (where this specific "outfit" is available as her final ascension art) as being her "accepting" her death and giving up on her honor and power that she can't take to the afterlife.

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[keikenchi]]
[b]Illustrator:[/b] [[pako (pakosun)|]] ([[Fate/Grand Order]])
[b]Voice Actress:[/b] [[Kugimiya Rie]]

title: okita_souji_(koha-ace)
body:
A [[genderswap]]ped depiction of the [[Okita Souji|Captain]] of the [[Shinsengumi]], she is a Saber-class and Saberface Servant of [[Kohaku (tsukihime)|]] in the TYPE-MOON parody work [[Koha-Ace]] by [[Keikenchi]]. She also appears as a playable character in [[Fate/Grand Order]] and as the servant of [[Akagi Kanata]] in [[Fate/type Redline]].

Her Noble Phantasms are her signature Shinsengumi haori, the Shinsengumi Flag of Sincerity, and Mumyou Sandanzuki. Despite her middling stats and personal skills, she is a force to be reckoned with in the Grand Order conflict.

Okita's running gag within the series revolves around her [[coughing blood]] at any random moment, a reference to her [[real life]] counterpart who suffered from tuberculosis.

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[Takeuchi Takashi]]
[b]Voice Actress:[/b] [[Yuuki Aoi]]

title: mysterious_heroine_xx_(fate)
body:
Foreigner-class version of [[Mysterious Heroine X (fate)|]]. She has three distinct designs depending on her Ascension level:

* [[mysterious heroine xx (first ascension) (fate)|First Ascension]] is her wearing a [[full armor]] [[exoskeleton]].
* [[mysterious heroine xx (second ascension) (fate)|Second Ascension]] loses some of the armor to show her face, and she wears a large [[blue scarf]], [[skin tight]] clothes under her armor, and metal gloves and boots.
* Third Ascension loses the armor completely, and she wears a blue [[baseball cap]], a [[white bikini]], [[strappy heels]], and a blue [[shrug (clothing)|]].

Mysterious Heroine XX wields [[Twinmyniad (fate)|]], a double-bladed version of [[Rhongomyniad (fate)|]]. Her breasts get [[medium breasts|slightly]] [[large breasts|larger]] with each Ascension, though never as big as [[Artoria Pendragon (lancer) (fate)|]].

Personality-wise, she's an older, more mature version of Heroine X (and also fills the role of being a swimsuit version of her).  She's nowhere near as obsessed as X is with eliminating all the other Sabers, to the point that she sometimes forgets about it completely, and is more focused on eliminating Foreigners. In-universe, she's a Galactic Police officer, but more or less abandons her post to go to Chaldea after the events of the 2018 summer event (2020 for North America).

While her First and Second Ascensions are given character tags, her Third Ascension bikini and shrug is considered her 'default' costume and thus has not been given a tag.

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[BUNBUN]]
[b]Voice Actress:[/b] [[Kawasumi Ayako]]

title: voyager_(fate)
body:
[[Fate (series)|Fate series]] character. A Voyager-class Servant who appears in [[Fate/Requiem]] and [[Fate/Grand Order]].

He is a young boy with [[blonde hair]] and [[blue eyes]]. In [[Fate/Requiem]], he is [[Utsumi Erice]]'s Voyager-class Servant, whose True Name is initially unknown. He is initially thought to be either Antoine de Saint-Euxpery or The Little Prince. His True Name is later revealed to be the space probe [i]Voyager[/i] that was launched in 1977, making him the youngest Heroic Spirit in the franchise.

He appears in [[Fate/Grand Order]] as a Foreigner-class Servant.

title: katsushika_hokusai_(fate)
body:
Foreigner-Class servant in [[Fate/Grand Order]]. A famous Japanese artist. Some of his more prominent works include the [[kanagawa okinami ura|Great Wave off Kanagawa]] (part of the Thirty-six Views of Mount Fuji), and the first known portrayal of tentacle porn, [[the Dream of the Fisherman's Wife]], among others.

Similarly to [[Artemis (fate)|]] and [[Orion (Bear) (fate)|Orion]], the girl who is summoned is not actually Hokusai; the small black [[octopus]] following her is the [[Tokitarou (fate)|true Hokusai]], while she herself is his daughter "Katsushika Oei":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Katsushika_%C5%8Ci], who served as her father's assistant and even produced some works under his name. He takes over her body upon reaching ascension 3, giving her an octopus-themed costume and a purple color scheme.

They have a [[katsushika hokusai (swimsuit saber) (fate)|Swimsuit Saber]] variant, introduced for the summer 2019 event.

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[Kuroboshi Kouhaku]]
[b]Voice Actress:[/b] [[Yukana]] (Katsushika Oei)

title: kingprotea_(fate)
body:
Alter Ego-class Servant first seen in [[Fate/Extra CCC Fox Tail]], and can be summoned in [[Fate/Grand Order]]. She is a version of [[Matou Sakura]] created after the legend of Earth Mother Goddesses in various myths. Appears as a [[giantess]] wrapped with [[bandages]] and a [[moss]]-covered body. In [[Fate/Extra CCC Fox Tail]] her [[bandage over one eye|eye bandage]] appears over her left eye, while in [[Fate/Grand Order]] it appears over her right eye. This is likely so that the battle sprite has her uncovered eye facing towards the player.

Her floral namesake is the [[protea (flower)|king protea]]. Her component spirits are all Earth Mother goddesses, including Titania (Titan), "Airavata":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Airavata, and [[Tiamat (fate)|]].

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[Wada Arco]]
[b]Voice Actress:[/b] [[Han Megumi]]

body:
Leader of the [[Nemo (fate)|]] series and the captain of the [[Nautilus (fate)|]], first appearing in the [[S I N (fate/grand order)|]] chapter under the alias [b]Captain[/b]. Identifiable by his long [[twintails]] and feathered [[turban]]. Similarly to the servants appearing in the [[Shinjuku (fate/grand order)|]] singularity, he is a Phantom servant summoned by [[Sion Eltnam Sokaris]]. His components are [[Captain Nemo]] and [[Triton]], though he wouldn't reveal his true name until the end of the [[Yugakshetra (fate/grand order)|]] chapter. Starting in the [[Atlantis (fate/grand order)|]] chapter, other members of the Nemo series begin to manifest in Novum Chaldea.

title: strapless_dress
body:
A [[dress]] that has no shoulder straps, attached sleeves, [[halterneck]] or other shoulder- or collarbone-related attire holding up the upper portion of the dress, instead relying on the tightness of the dress (usually around the hip or waist area) to keep it in place. The shoulders and upper chest area should be [[bare shoulders|bare]], which also implies the lack of a strapped [[bra]].

Strapless dresses must [b]not[/b] cover the shoulders or arms in any way outside of separate articles of clothing or jewelry such as [[detached sleeves]], [[gloves]], or [[armlet]]s.


Strapless dresses, [[sleeveless dress]]es, and [[off-shoulder dress]]es are mutually exclusive to each other.


h4. Correct examples

* !post #7404412
* !post #6552983: A strapless dress worn with [[elbow gloves]]
* !post #5904407: A strapless dress worn with [[detached sleeves]]
* !post #3359469: A strapless dress that has a [[bra]] worn underneath
* !post #7496980: A strapless dress worn over a [[shirt]]
* !post #9221044: A strapless dress (black) worn over a [[sleeveless]] outfit (grey)

h4. Incorrect examples
Do not tag [[off-shoulder dress]]es as "strapless dress".
* !post #7930228
* !post #7249221
* !post #7108025
* !post #3507146
* !post #8001840

h4. See also

* [[Tag Group:Attire]]

title: nemo_(fate)
body:
Umbrella tag for the members of the Nemo Series from [[Fate/Grand Order]]. [[Captain Nemo (fate)|]] is the leader of the series and the first one to appear in the [[S I N (fate/grand order)|]] chapter as [[Sion Eltnam Sokaris]]' servant, with [[Marine Nemo (fate)|Marine]] only briefly appearing. The rest of the series only manifest after he declares his true name in the [[Yugakshetra (fate/grand order)|]] chapter and manifests the [[Nautilus (fate)|]]. The series is a result of Memory Partition he learned from his master, allowing Nemo to divide his skills up into [[multiple persona|multiple selves]] to manage all the operations of his submarine.

Although the Nemo Series' genders were initially left ambiguous, the male-to-female ratio was eventually confirmed to be 3:3 by Fate/Grand Order material XI. In-game details, such as the annual Valentine's Day event, have shed light on the genders of each Nemo: the confirmed men are Captain and the Marines, the confirmed women are Engineer and Baker, and Professor and Nurse's genders are still unknown, though Professor is implied to be female.

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[astg]]
[b]Voice Actress:[/b] [[Hanamori Yumiri]]

h4. Members
* !post #7000634: [[Captain Nemo (fate)|]]

title: nei
body:
One of the main protagonists of [[Phantasy Star II]].

[b]Nei[/b] is one of the few Numans alive during the game.  She has [[long hair|long]] [[purple hair]], [[long pointy ears]], [[red eyes]], her default attire consists of a [[purple leotard]] with matching [[purple gloves|purple]] [[elbow gloves]], [[purple boots|purple]] [[thigh boots]], and a [[purple choker]]

[spoiler]She is really a bio-human [[mutant]] entity created by scientists, and she dies trying to fight her evil older sister [[Neifirst]].[/spoiler]

title: halo_installation
body:
A series of seven [[Ringworld]]-like space stations found in the [i][[Halo (series)|Halo]][/i] series. Numbered as Installation 01 to 07 and dotted throughout the Milky Way galaxy, these stations contain very similar and recognizable architecture all throughout, and a human-habitable surface on the interior side of the ring with a number of different biomes. There are no fauna inhabiting those biomes, only flora, and each station is tended to by an AI caretaker. Additionally, outside the galaxy, there is the star-shaped Installation 00 that is much larger than the other Installations and can manufacture and position new Installations in place of any that are destroyed.

This tag can apply to the more straightforward depiction of an Installation from outside, or to the [[atmospheric perspective]] effect where the surface's upwards curve causes the entire station to be observable in the sky.

title: impasto
body:
A painting technique where paint is laid on an area of the surface thickly, usually thick enough that the brush or painting-knife strokes are visible. Paint can also be mixed right on the canvas. When dry, impasto provides texture; the paint appears to be coming out of the canvas.

The technique is commonly achieved with [[oil painting (medium)|oil]] or [[acrylic paint (medium)|acrylic paint]] due to their thicker consistency.

Can be synonymous with [[impressionism]], the difference being the depth of the paint

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Impasto":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Impasto]

title: van_gogh_(fate)
body:
Foreigner-class Servant seen in [[Fate/Grand Order]], introduced during the [[Imaginary Scramble]] event. She is a [[genderswap (mtf)|]]ped version of [[Vincent Van Gogh (person)|]], a Dutch post-impressionist painter who is among the most famous and influential figures in the history of Western art, though he was considered a failure and a madman during his lifetime. His most famous paintings include [i]The Starry Night[/i], [i]Cafe Terrace at Night[/i], and the [i]Sunflowers[/i] series.

[spoiler]It is revealed later that the named servant is not in anyway related to Van Gogh but instead is "Clytie":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Clytie_(Oceanid), a water nymph and daughter of Oceanus and Tethys from Greek Mythology, and her existence is more in line with the [[passionlip (fate)|Alter]] [[meltryllis (fate)|Egos]] where they are [[kingprotea (fate)|goddesses]] and [[sitonai (fate)|deities]] forced into a mixed existence of human form. 

[[Vincent Van Gogh (person)|]] in [[Fate (series)|]] has the ability to transform Servants into Gods through his artwork, thus he was targeted by the Outer Gods who desired him for their plans. However, rather than submitting to their wills, he killed himself in an act of defiance that carried over with him even as a Heroic Spirit. This forced the Outer Gods to instead create another "Van Gogh" using his powers and memories and mixing his "Spirit Origin/Saint Graph":https://typemoon.fandom.com/wiki/Saint_Graph with that of Clytie's, creating a cruel combination of Clytie (her body), "Vincent" (his abilities) and with power of that of an "Outer God/Foreigners'":https://typemoon.fandom.com/wiki/Foreigner.

Their existence as a Servant thus becomes an endless struggle of conflicting existence, where Vincent will constantly try to kill himself by various curses (as seen from their first ability; Void Space Fine Arts), and Clytie, who is determined to stay alive, will defy his attempts (reviving herself with the "Guts" skill).[/spoiler]

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[Kibadori Rue]]
[b]Voice Actress:[/b] [[Takahashi Karin]]

body:
An [[original]] [[Touhou]] character created by [[Haniwa (Leaf Garden)]], a doujin circle known for its [[Touhou]] doujins, for thier doujin [[Thought of Dolls]]. She is a living doll who has lost her memory other then the fact she's looking for someone, She has brown eyes and green hair in two long curly tails. She is dressed as a Victorian-era doll. 
* !post #83107

title: eyes_in_shadow
body:
When the eyes of someone or something stand out (can be seen) while the area surrounding the eyes are covered in shadows that completely obscure all details. Think "glowing eyes peering out of a cave" level of darkness.

Often goes along with [[face in shadow]]. [[Why dis ninja look so mad (meme)]] is a notable example.

Not to be confused with [[shaded face]], [[no eyes]], or [[hair over eyes]].

h4. Examples

* !post #9165569
* !post #8051887

h4. Non-examples

* !post #8825787: [[no eyes]]
* !post #9025904: [[shaded face]]: shadowed without a tangible light source

h4. See Also

* [[Eyed silhouette]]
* [[Face in shadow]]
* [[Glowing eye]]
* [[Glowing eyes]]
* [[Mouth in shadow]]

title: himiko_(fate)
body:
A Ruler-class Servant in [[Fate/Grand Order]], first seen in the [[GUDAGUDA Yamatai-koku]] event. The Priest-Queen of Yamatai-koku, a country from ancient Japan. She supposedly used a form of magecraft called Kidou, and united the divided nation of Wa-koku through the power of oracles. [[Iyo (fate)|]] is her disciple and successor after her death.

title: super_saiyan_4
body:
A form of [[Super Saiyan]] that originally appeared in the anime-only [[Dragon Ball GT]]. Born from gaining control over the [[Golden Oozaru]] form, its main features are red fur covering the torso, longer hair, red lining around the eyes, and the addition of a [[monkey tail]] even if the user already had them cut beforehand.

[[Son Goku]] is the first to achieve this form, followed by [[Vegeta]] and their fusion, [[Gogeta]] (whose Super Saiyan 4 form is different from his fusees, since his hair turns [[red hair|red]] and his body gains brown fur instead). It can be upgraded into [[Super Full Power Saiyan 4]].

[[Dragon Ball Heroes]] would later introduce a further evolution to this form, with the long name of [[Super Full Power Saiyan 4 Limit Breaker]].

The form would be canonized with its appearance in [[Dragon Ball DAIMA]], though appearance-wise it would see some changes, such as rendering the hair in the same color as the fur, and the arms and hands getting proportionally larger per GT's original concepts.

h4. Appearance

* !post #8584095: GT (Goku)
* !post #9034537: Daima
* !post #6794293: GT (Vegeta)
* !post #8268835: GT (Gogeta)

title: action_movie_fx_(meme)
body:
An app for Apple devices released in 2011 allowing you to overlay various action movie VFX over self recorded video.

One of the most recognizable, and probably overused effects, is "Side-Swiped" where a car is hit from the side by a [[police car]].

The app (and stock videos) later gained resurgences around 2023 as a part of various ironic shitpost [[meme]] videos, often without removing the [[green screen]] for comedic effect.
h4. Examples
* !asset #22156898: Side-swiped
* !asset #22187368: The Jet
* !asset #25629374: Missile

title: tomoe_gozen_(fate)
body:
Archer-class Servant in [[Fate/Grand Order]]. Referenced in the Babylonia singularity as one of the heroes Gilgamesh summoned to defend his kingdom, and who later perished defeating an enemy commander. She makes her playable debut in [[Shimousa (fate/grand order)|]] as [b]Archer of Inferno[/b]. Despite her steadfast nature and her fiery and graceful style of combat (she wields a [[sword]], a [[naginata]], and a [[bow (weapon)|]] with great proficiency), she has a more playful side (shown in My Room where she expresses great interest in playing video games).

Has [[black horns]], due to having some oni ancestry. These only become visible starting with her second ascension. The horns are initially [[black horns|black]] but turn [[red horns|red horns]] for her third ascension. She also has [[very long hair|very long]] [[aqua hair|aqua]], [[light blue hair|light blue]], or [[grey hair]] (sometimes in a [[ponytail]], or with a white [[headband]] and a [[red bow]]) and [[red eyes]]. Usually wears a [[short kimono|short]] [[white kimono]] with an [[obi]] and [[detached sleeves]], and [[hakama pants]] with [[side slit|side slits]]. Sometimes she also has [[kote]] and [[kusazuri]]. Her later outfit looks like a [[sleeveless turtleneck]] showing some [[sideboob]]. Her kote and kusazuri looks more colorful.

[b]Character Design[/b]: [[Shirabi]]
[b]Voice Actress[/b]: [[Kanemoto Hisako]]

title: nero_trainer
body:
A fictional manned military giant robot from the [[Gundam]] [[mecha]]verse. It first appeared in [[Gundam Sentinel]].
 
[b]MSA-007T Nero Trainer Type[/b]

A trainer variant of the [[nero_(mobile_suit)|Nero]] [[mobile suit]]. It is combat capable and has a red colored chest area.

title: nero_(mobile_suit)
body:
A fictional manned military giant robot from the [[Gundam]] [[mecha]]verse. It first appeared in [[Gundam Sentinel]].
 
[b]MSA-007 Nero[/b]

An Anaheim Electronics mass production version of the [[S Gundam]] with an upper body superstructure based on that of the Lambda Gundam prototype. The result is a high-performance mass production model potentially capable of rivaling higher-class [[mobile suit]]s with proper tuning. 

The design of Nero was also inspired by another of [[Anaheim Electronics]]' mass production mobile suits, the MSA-003 [[nemo_(mobile_suit)|Nemo]].

h4.Related development
* [[EWAC Nero]]
* [[Nero Trainer]]
other_names: ネロ(ガンダムセンチネル)

title: shirobakama_chii
body:
[b]The Little Fencer who's a Match for a Thousand[/b]

The Stage 2 boss of the [[Touhou]] fangame [[Hollow Song of Birds]]. Later reappears in Stage 6 alongside [[Torisumi Horou]], and the Extra Stage alongside [[Fujitsubo Mumei]].

Chii is the [[Tsukumogami]] of a small [[toothpick]], and as such, is described as having an inchling-like stature. Because of this, she is almost always seen carrying a toothpick around, usually like a [[sword]].

She has [[short]] light [[blue hair]] which is tied into a [[ponytail]] using a [[blue bow]] that has her name imprinted on it in kanji (ちい). Additionally, she has [[blue eyes]].

She wears a white [[haori]] (or [[white kimono]]) which is tied together by a [[sash]], as well as a matching [[hakama]]. Confusingly, she doesn't seem to be wearing any sort of [[undershirt]] or [[chest sarashi]].

Chii has the ability to multiply herself by imparting other toothpicks with their own will; multiple instances of the character should be tagged with [[clone]].

title: jegan
body:
A fictional manned military robot from the [[Gundam]] [[mecha]]verse. It first appeared in [[Char's Counterattack]] from 1988.

[b]RGM-89 Jegan[/b]

The Federation's successor to the versatile but terribly underperforming [[gm_(mobile_suit)|GM]] [[mobile suit]] series. Tougher armor and much more power ensured the Jegan was a much greater machine than the countlessly refitted GMs it was replacing. 

The [b]RGM-89D [[Jegan D Type]] [/b] is a minor update of the type, with more flexible loadouts and minute improved sensors and thruster packs. That not much was changed showed a degree of refinement in the original design that enabled it to remain at the cutting edge of mass produced MS even at the rapidly evolving environment of the Universal Century. The Jegan was later developed into the [[Jesta]] and the [[ReZEL]] mobile suit designs.

The Jegan is also strikingly similar to another of [[Izubuchi Yutaka]]'s mechs - the iconic [[AV-98 Ingram]], from [[Kidou Keisatsu Patlabor]].

h4. Related development
* [[Gustav Karl]]

h4. See also

title: yu_mei-ren_(fate)
body:
An Assassin-class Servant appearing in [[Fate/Grand Order]].

She has [[very long hair|very long]] [[brown hair|brown]]-[[black hair]], wears a [[black dress]] and [[dual wielding|wields]] two [[sword]]s. In her unascended form she has a [[braided ponytail]] and wears [[glasses]]. In her ascended form, she removes her glasses and has unbraided hair.

Historically she was known as the lover of [[Xiang Yu (fate)|]]. In Type-Moon lore she is an immortal hermit, a species of natural spirit and a vampire similar to "True Ancestors":http://typemoon.wikia.com/wiki/True_Ancestor like [[Arcueid Brunestud]]. Since she's been ostracized by humans for millennia for being a vampire, she greatly hates mankind. She also deeply despises [[Koyanskaya (fate)|]] because she witnessed "Daji":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Daji, another incarnation of the Great Fox, bring down an empire.

[spoilers]As her unascended form indicates, she is the true identity of [[Akuta Hinako]].[/spoilers]

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[toi8]]
[b]Voice Actress:[/b] [[Ise Mariya]]

title: daizyuzin
body:
The combined form of the Five Guardian Beasts in [[Kyouryuu Sentai Zyuranger]], better known to American viewers as the [[Dino Megazord]]. Daizyuzin is a sentient super robot that can actually speak, unlike the Dino Megazord, which is merely a mecha.

While Daizyuzin would return many times after Zyuranger in crossovers, his appearance in [[No.1 Sentai Gozyuger]], wearing a [[cloak]], garnered a lot of attention due to how cool he looked. Additionally, the show would see the first appearance of the merch-exclusive Black Daizyuzin.

title: umamusume
body:
[b]Umamusume: Pretty Derby[/b] is a mobile game developed and published by [[Cygames]] featuring [[horse girl|girls]] based on famous [[horse|racehorses]]. The game was first announced in 2016 and was initially slated for a Fall 2018 release, only for development to start out from scratch; with the ultimate release date pushed back to Febuary 2021. June 24 2024 In livestream Pakatube!, it announced the release of an English version of the game for June 26 2025. On June 21, 2023, a party game spinoff, [i][[Umamusume: Party Dash]][/i], was announced for a 2024 Worldwide.

The franchise received several anime adaptations, with the first season airing before the game's official release in Spring 2018, and a second season launching alongside the game in Winter 2021. A spinoff featuring [[Narita Top Road (Umamusume)|]] was aired for Spring 2023. The third season premiered in Fall 2023, followed by an anime film centered on [[Jungle Pocket (Umamusume)|]] in May 2024. An anime adaptation of the manga [i][[Umamusume: Cinderella Gray]][/i] is currently in the works and is slated for a 2025 release.

There is also the [i][[Umayon]][/i] spinoff, which was a 4koma manga that was adapted into an anime short in 2020, and the [i][[Umayuru]][/i] spinoff which was released directly on the [i]Umamusume[/i]'s YouTube channel in Fall 2022.


h4. Anime adaptations
* [i]Umamusume: Pretty Derby[/i] Seasons 1 to 3

title: shopping_cart
body:
Essentially a steel wire [[basket]] on wheels, often found in large department stores and [[groceries|grocery]] stores to accommodate shoppers who need to purchase a large quantity of items.

Note this tag is for shopping carts normally found at grocery stores or department stores. For carts not like this kind cart that can be found at home improvement, furniture, wholesale stores, or other stores, please use the appropriate cart tags such as [[platform truck]] instead.

h4. Types

title: flag
body:
A flag is a piece of fabric, often flown from a pole or mast. Often decorated with emblems, symbols, or shapes to represent one's country or an event. Soldiers may be carrying a [[war flag]].

[[Flag]] is only applicable if the fabric in question is horizontally-oriented, if it flows vertically use [[banner]] instead. 

If the flag is of a specifically known real country, please add that country as a tag.

title: laundry_cart
body:
A laundry cart is a [[cart]] for transporting laundry to and from the washer, dryer, folding table, ironing station, etc.  Most laundry room and [[laundromat]] carts will be small metal carts similar to a [[shopping cart]], but usually without the handle and may feature an elevated bar to hang clothes from.  Larger carts or trucks featuring a large canvas baskets may be used in places like a hotel where lots of clothes and/or linen have to be laundered.

h4. Example

* !post #4454677

title: kanami_(strinova)
body: Kanami is a popular idol who works secretly for The Scissors. A gorgeous pop idol, Kanami is as dedicated and persistent as any other member of The Scissors. Having witnessed a great deal of misfortune, she sings with all her might for the future of Strinova to protect her fans and companions from harm. She has [[Long Hair]], [[Thighhighs]], [[Medium Breasts]] and uses [[Anti-Materiel Rifle]] similar to [[Barrett M82]] in combat.

title: okita_souji_alter_(fate)
body:
A character from [[Koha-Ace]], an alter version of [[Okita Souji (fate)|]]. Originally known as "Majin Saber" during the manga's [i]XP[/i] run, she was a Saber-class gag character lampooning the concept of powerful fusions and [[dark persona]] (Alter forms in Fate universe), being a fusion of [[Oda Nobunaga (koha-ace)|]] and [[Okita Souji (koha-ace)|]]. In [[Fate/Grand Order]], she appears as an Alter Ego-class Servant, and is a version of Okita Souji who became a Counter Force guardian, similarly to [[Archer (fate)|]].

She appears as a young woman with [[long hair|long]] [[white hair]], tied with a [[hair bow]] and decorated with [[tassel hair ornament]]s. She wears a red and black dress bearing similarity to a short kimono and long European style coat, complete with [[high collar]] held closed by a rope tassel.

Her swimsuit variant is [[Okita Souji Alter (Swimsuit Saber) (fate)|]].

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[Takeuchi Takashi]]
[b]Voice Actress:[/b] [[Yuuki Aoi]]

title: sieg_(fate)
body:
One of the main protagonists of [[Fate/Apocrypha]] alongside [[Jeanne d'Arc (fate)|]]. He is a nameless homunculus created by [[Gordes Musik Yggdmillennia]] who becomes the secondary master of the [[Astolfo (fate)|Rider of "Black"]] after gaining a consciousness and escaping from the Black faction. He would later be given the heart of [[Siegfried (fate)|]] in order to save his life, allowing him to temporarily shapeshift into him in combat and giving him his moniker.

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[Konoe Ototsugu]]
[b]Voice Actor:[/b] [[Hanae Natsuki]]

title: chiron_(fate)
body:
The Archer of "Black" servant of [[Fiore Forvedge Yggdmillennia]] in [[Fate/Apocrypha]]. He appears as a [[horse boy]], though his true form as seen in [[Fate/Grand Order]] is a [[centaur]]. He is a divine spirit and demigod who was the teacher of many great Greek heroes, including [[Heracles (fate)|]], [[Jason (fate)|]], [[Castor (fate)|]], [[Asclepius (fate)|]], and [[Achilles (fate)|]]. Because he gave up his immortality, he is able to be summoned as a heroic spirit. He is the model for the [[Sagittarius (constellation)|]] constellation.

Not to be confused with [[Charon (fate)|]].

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[Konoe Ototsugu]]
[b]Voice Actor:[/b] [[Takeuchi Shunsuke]]

title: achilles_(fate)
body:
Rider-class Servant first seen in [[Fate/Apocrypha]] as the [b]Rider of "Red"[/b] servant of [[Cabik Pentel]]. The greatest hero of the Trojan War, and was responsible for slaying [[Hector (fate)|]]. When he was a child, his mother Thetis submerged his entire body into the river Styx to give him invulnerability, except for his heel where she held him. Achilles is thus killed by Hector's brother [[Paris (fate)|]] when he shot an arrow at his heel.

The term "Achilles' heel", meaning a weakness in someone who otherwise has a strong constitution, is attributed to this mythology.

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[Konoe Ototsugu]]
[b]Voice Actor:[/b] [[Furukawa Makoto]]

title: antonio_salieri_(fate)
body:
Avenger-class Servant seen in [[Fate/Grand Order]], first seen during the [[Anastasia (Lostbelt) (fate/grand order)|Russia Lostbelt]].

A composer who was the target of accusations concerning the death of [[wolfgang amadeus mozart (fate)|Mozart]], although there is no actual evidence of murder. Thus, Salieri is classified as an Innocent Monster. He doesn't call himself 'Salieri', but rather the 'Man in Grey' since this Servant is a personification of the concept of 'Mozart's murderer', a supposedly jealous man who took away God's gift to the world of music.

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[PFALZ]]
[b]Voice Actor:[/b] [[Seki Toshihiko]]

title: avicebron_(fate)
body:
The Caster of "Black" Servant of [[Caules Forvedge Yggdmillennia]] in [[Fate/Apocrypha]]. A magus and philosopher, founder of the Kabbalah and creator of the school of magecraft that [[Aozaki Touko]] uses. His NP is [[Golem Keter Malkuth]].

Caster wears a featureless [[mask]] without openings for eyes or a mouth, a full-[[bodysuit]], and a [[blue capelet]]. Due to the mask he wore, it was impossible to tell whether he was afraid or even felt any emotion at all.

[b]True Name:[/b] Solomon ibn Gabirol
[b]Character Design:[/b] [[Konoe Ototsugu]]
[b]Voice Actor:[/b] [[Miyamoto Mitsuru]]

title: osakabehime_(fate)
body:
An Assassin-class servant from [[Fate/Grand Order]] first appearing in the [[Halloween Strike!]] event. Osakabe-Hime is a youkai that haunts the walls of Himeji Castle, and a friend of [[Tamamo no Mae (Fate/Extra)|]] and [[Kiyohime (fate)|]]. While she uses a [[bat (animal)|]] motif, Osakabe is actually a kitsune that attained human form (and also notes that it would be confusing if there were two kitsune Servants in the game). She is also a massive [[hikikomori]], and has the ability to control the [[origami]] animals she creates.

Appearance-wise, Osakabe has [[very long hair|very long]] [[black hair]] [[gradient hair|fading into]] [[brown hair|brown]] tips that she wears in [[twintails]], [[purple eyes]], and wears [[glasses]]. Her standard outfit is a kimono-themed [[hoodie]] and a [[purple skirt]]. Due to her dialogue in her swimsuit variants, she is also often depicted with a [[plump]] body.

She has a [[osakabehime (swimsuit archer) (fate)|swimsuit version]] for the summer 2019 event.

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[Moriyama Daisuke]]
[b]Voice Actress:[/b] [[Fukuen Misato]]

title: mochizuki_chiyome_(fate)
body:
Assassin-class servant in [i][[Fate/Grand Order]][/i] first appearing in [[Shimousa (fate/grand order)|]] as the [b]Assassin of Paraiso[/b]. A legendary founder of the first kunoichi order of her era, she also served as a miko of Orochi, hence her connection to [[Shuten Douji (fate)|]] (who is depicted in Fate/Grand Order as Orochi's daughter).

Usually wears only a [[black ribbon]] with [[fishnets]] (where a part of the ribbon covers her right eye as an [[eyepatch]]), and wields a [[kunai]]. Has [[very long hair|very long]] [[black hair]] and [[purple eyes]]. Often some of her hair [[hair over one eye|covers her right eye]] too. Gains a kunoichi and miko outfit as she ascends, revealing that her covered eye is yellow and has a serpentine pupil, the mark of her priesthood serving Orochi.

[b]Character Design[/b]: [[Hiroyama Hiroshi]]
[b]Voice Actress[/b]: [[Sakura Ayane]]

title: nyoze_octo
body:
Minor character from the [[Evillious Nendaiki]]. 

Former lieutenant of USE's military force who was investigating the system's corruption after being falsely accused by [[Gallerian Marlon]]. He also is a major member of the Tasan party, the younger brother of [[Gammon Octo]] and the lover or [[Nemesis Sudou]]. [Spoilers]Eventually he found his demise at hands of a regretful Nemesis while researching a series of murders in the Rolled city, which triggered at Gallerian and PN to order a hit on him. This event lead to Nemesis sought revange against the corrupt judge and eventually take leadership over the Tasan party.[/Spoiler]

title: face_in_shadow
body:
When a character's face is [b]completely[/b] covered in shadow, rendering it almost, if not completely hidden. If the face is darkened but completely visible, consider [[shaded face]] or [[shade]] instead.

Can still overlap with [[faceless]], [[eyes in shadow]] and [[mouth in shadow]].

title: forklift
body:
A forklift (also called lift truck, jitney, fork truck, fork hoist, and forklift truck) is a powered industrial truck used to lift and move materials over short distances.

Please refer to this "helpful guide on forklift safety to learn more":[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ChOHnSL7ZCg&t=16s]

h4. See also

* [[Pallet jack]]

title: cargo_pallet
body: A type of flat-bedded structure, typically made of wood, used to aid in loading cargo via [[forklift]]s, [[crane (machine)|cranes]], or [[pallet jack]]s. They typically have distinct patterns of wooden boards on top, with holes in the side for the forks of a forklift to slide into.

title: penthesilea_(fate)
body:
Berserker-class Servant first appearing in [[Fate/Grand Order]]'s [[Agartha (fate/grand order)|]] Singularity as the [b]Berserker of El Dorado[/b]. The Queen of the Amazons, she is a [[white hair]]ed [[toned]] woman who wields a [[spiked ball and chain]] with great skill. Strangely calm for a Berserker, except when she sees or hears [[Achilles (fate)|]], and that's when she starts freaking out in typical Berserker fashion. Her sister is [[Hippolyta (fate)|]].

Her Noble Phantasm is Outrage Amazon, where she makes herself see the enemy in front of her is Achilles, and proceeds to RIP AND TEAR at the hapless target.

title: glint
body:
The sparkle of a polished or metal object. This should come from a physical object, such as [[jewelry]], a [[sword]], or [[teeth]].

[[Sparkle]], [b]glint[/b], and [[diffraction spikes]] all refer to similar patterns of bright lines radiating from a point. They are not clearly differentiated, and usage tends to be context-sensitive. In general:
* [[Sparkle]] is considered the base case. Usually four lines at right angles radiating from a point. Associated with eyes, liquid or particulate matter (e.g. raindrops, snow, sand), or nothing (appearing mid-air). Can appear in large numbers.
* [b]Glint[/b] is associated with solid objects, especially ones which are metallic and/or sharp. Usually appear singly or in small numbers.
* [[Diffraction spikes]] is the technical term for the phenomenon in general, but is used less often. Can be used for more realistic-looking effects or conversely when appearing extremely large and exaggerated. More likely than sparkle and glint to be asymmetric or to have more than four radiating lines.

h4. See also

* [[bokeh]]
* [[lens flare]]
* [[light particles]]

title: scheherazade_(fate)
body:
Caster-class Servant in [[Fate/Grand Order]] who debuted in the [[Agartha (fate/grand order)|]] singularity as the [b]Caster of Nightless City[/b]. Has [[long hair|long]] [[black hair]], [[dark-skinned female|dark skin]] and a [[curvy]] design featuring lots of [[skindentation]]. She is a character from the Middle Eastern story [i]One Thousand and One Nights[/i], where she dated a king who killed every woman he courted with so they wouldn't be unfaithful to him. Scheherazade avoided death by reading fascinating stories to the king every night, stopping the tale at dawn each time so she could keep his interest. After 1,001 nights together, the king spared her life and married her.

She first appeared in [[promotional art]] for Epic of Remnant (post #2635525). She's usually grouped together with [[Nitocris (fate)|]] and [[Queen of Sheba (fate)|]] in both official and fan works due to their common traits as middle eastern queens.

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[Namaniku ATK]]
[b]Voice Actress:[/b] [[Inoue Kikuko]]

title: emiya_alter
body:
Archer-class Servant first seen in [[Fate/Grand Order]]'s [[Shinjuku (fate/grand order)|]] Singularity. The same character as [[Archer (fate)|]], but has discarded his memories after a [[SE.RA.PH (fate/grand order)|tragic incident]] and became an emotionless killer. Emiya Alter has [[very dark skin|darker skin]] than his original version ([[second-party edit|edited]] back to his [[official alternate skin color|original skintone]] in the NA version), and has his hair very short with a [[crew cut]]. He first appeared in [[promotional art]] for Epic of Remnant (post #2635525).

Due to Danbooru's policy of avoiding spoilers as much as possible, as well as simplifying how their costume character tags are categorized, Archer and Emiya Alter are to be treated as wholly separate characters.

For the corrupted version of Archer seen in [[Fate/Grand Order: First Order]], see [[Archer Alter (fate)|]].

title: cart
body:
For tagging purposes a cart is an animal or human driven two or more wheeled vehicle used for carrying loads that is pulled or pushed. They're similar to carriages, but  the carriage tag covers vehicles specifically design for passenger transport, while the cart tag is intended for vehicles designed to transport cargo.

A true cart is an open two-wheeled vehicle for carrying loads that is pulled by animals or humans, for tagging purposes these will be tagged as a "pullcart".

The term "cart" over time has evolved to also refer to a variety of small wheeled vehicles that are pushed or pulled and include vehicles that have more than two wheels.

For the small motor vehicle, see [[go-kart]].

title: rkhdtyns

title: duramente_(racehorse)
body:
[tn]In musical terminology, denotes a passage marked to be played in a bold and firm style. From Italian: "Roughly, coarsely, harshly".[/tn]
Japanese [[horse|racehorse]]. Sired by King Kamehameha and foaled by Admire Groove (a daughter of [[Air Groove (racehorse)|]]), Duramente was a racehorse with an exceptional record (9: 5-4-0, 2 G1 wins) but his career was cut short due to injuries. He was [[Kitasan Black (racehorse)|]]'s major rival during their classics.

However, what makes him most exceptional is the quality of his offspring. Despite dying unexpectedly due to colitis on August 31, 2021 (he was aged 9) and thus, only having a few years worth of crops, his legacy is already set, thanks to [[Titleholder (racehorse)|]] and [[Stars on Earth (racehorse)|]], assuming they themselves survive long enough in stud.

In the context of [i][[Umamusume]][/i], the game had to settle with a stand-in NPC ([[Brusquement (Umamusume)|]]) until they could finally score Shadai Group horses, thus finally paving the way for [[Duramente (umamusume)|the real deal]] in Season 3 of the anime.

h5.G1 Winners:

* [[Titleholder (racehorse)|]]: 2021 Kikuka Sho, 2022 Spring Tenno Sho; Takarazuka Kinen
* [[Stars on Earth (racehorse)|]]: 2022 Oka Sho; Oaks
* [[Valle de la Luna (racehorse)|]]: 2022 JBC Ladies'Classic (Jpn1); 2023 Kashiwa Kinen (Jpn1)
* [[Dura Erede (racehorse)|]]: 2022 Hopeful Stakes (Active)
* [[Liberty Island (racehorse)|]]: 2022 Hanshin Juvenile Fillies; 2023 Triple Tiara (Oka Sho, Oaks and Shuka Sho) (Deceased)
* [[Champagne Color (racehorse)|]]: 2023 NHK Mile Cup (Active)
* [[Durezza (racehorse)|]]: 2023 Kikuka Sho (Active)
* Icon Tailor: 2022 JBC Ladies'Classic (Jpn1)
* Lugal: 2024 Sprinters Stakes (Active)

title: monomon_(hollow_knight)
body: A major NPC in [[Hollow Knight]]. [b]Monomon the Teacher[/b] is one of the three Dreamers [spoilers]and [[Quirrel]]'s former mentor, who provided him with a [[mask]] in her likeness as protection when she became a Dreamer[/spoilers].

title: lurien_(hollow_knight)
body: A major NPC in [[Hollow Knight]]. [b]Lurien the Watcher[/b] is one of the three Dreamers, who formerly watched over the City of Tears through his [[telescope]].

title: herrah_(hollow_knight)
body:
Major NPC in [[Hollow Knight]]. [b]Herrah the Beast[/b] is queen of Deepnest's [[Spider]] Tribe and one of the three Dreamers.
[spoilers]She is also the mother of [[Hornet (hollow knight)|]], as part of a deal she made with the [[Pale King (hollow knight)|]] in exchange for becoming a Dreamer[/spoilers].

title: battle_rally:_void_vortex_(2022)
body:
"Battle Rally or commonly called BR, is a routine comic event held by KMI (Komunitas Mangaka Indonesia) members, for KMI members. BR is a very unique event compared to other comic events, besides being carried out for a long period of time, participants are also given convenience by the scenario provided by the committee. So, participants only need to create characters and make comics based on the scenarios that have been provided."

-[[Benish0ga]]: ("Contest explanation and character entry page":[https://benishogabrvv.carrd.co/#]).

h4. "Official event trailer":[https://www.facebook.com/kmispace.id/videos/234939664730534/?mibextid=rS40aB7S9Ucbxw6v]

This year's theme for [[original]] character entries were [[prisoner|inmates]] placed in a sci-fi maximum security setting.

title: transcendent_blazer
body:
An original attack for [[Gogeta]] that originates from the game [[Dragon Ball Z Dokkan Battle]]. 

He crosses his arms, forming a [[Galick Gun|veil of golden ki]] over his right hand and a [[Kamehameha (Dragon Ball)|sphere of blue energy]] in his left, before bringing his arms together above his head, causing the two energies to merge into a tumultuous mass of yellow and blue light. Finally, Gogeta thrusts his arms forward to launch the devastating blast, completely annihilating the victim with its force. Most fanart represents this attack with the first part with his crossed arms.
other_names: エクシードブレイザー

body:

Notable for her rivalry with [[Tamamo no Mae (Fate/Extra)|]], [[gyaru|"JK" attitude]], wielding three swords in battle and [[no panties|her aversion for wearing underwear]], something which starts a friendship between her and fellow commando [[Rani VIII]].

In the arcade version of Fate/Grand Order, she has a [[suzuka gozen (santa) (fate)|Santa version]] under the Lancer designation.

title: hijikata_toshizou_(fate)
body:
Berserker-class Servant in [[Fate/Grand Order]] first appearing in the [[GudaGuda Meiji Ishin]] event. Wears a western-style outfit or a worn kimono and tattered grey Shinsengumi haori. Wields a katana, rifle and revolver in battle, and his Noble Phantasm is "Shinsengumi: Undying Sincerity", a powerful attack that only grows stronger the closer he is to death.

Like the other Shinsengumi servants, Hijikata is often depicted with certain personality from character based on the same figure in [i][[Gintama]][/i]. Specifically [[Hijikata Toushirou]]'s [[mayonnaise]] addiction.

[b]Character Design[/b]: [[Yogo Yuuki]]

title: arthur_pendragon_(fate)
body:
Originally called Archetype Saber, he is the version of [[Saber (fate)|]] that was to be used in the original [[Fate/stay night]] novel that was penned and left uncompleted. He would later make an official debut in [[Fate/Prototype]] as a Saber from an entirely different timeline, complete with his own characterization and contextual differences compared to the Saber from Fate/stay night.

Arthur plays a role in [[Fate/Grand Order]] as well: [spoiler]he is chasing Beast VI across time and space, with the intent to slay it for good after unsuccessfully attempting such in 1991 and 1999 of his own time tree.[/spoiler]

A [[blonde hair]]ed man with [[green eyes]], his [[armor]] set includes [[breastplate]], [[pauldrons]], [[gauntlets]], [[faulds]], [[greaves]] and [[hood]]; slight differences in design compared to Saber. His weapon is another version of [[excalibur (fate/prototype)|Excalibur]]. His casual outfit consists of red [[t-shirt]] with [[black pants]] and long, [[black jacket]]. Often seen with [[Sajou Ayaka (fate/prototype)|]].

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[Takeuchi Takashi]], [[Nakahara (mu tation)|]]
[b]Voice Actor:[/b] [[Sakurai Takahiro]]

title: mysterious_heroine_x_alter_(fate)
body:
A Berserker-class Servant in [[Fate/Grand Order]] who is the [[dark persona|alter]] version of [[Mysterious Heroine X (fate)|]].

Unlike other versions of [[Saber Alter]], Heroine X Alter retains [[Saber (fate)|]]'s iconic [[ahoge]] while wearing her school uniform. While her initial appearance is heavily influenced by [[Master Artoria]] (along with [[glasses]] for extra appeal), her later ascensions make her look more like a Sith Lord from [[Star Wars]], complete with Force lightning and dual-bladed lightsaber.

Gained an idol version called [[Mysterious Idol X Alter (fate)|]] for the Grail Live! event.

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[BUNBUN]]
[b]Voice Actress:[/b] [[Kawasumi Ayako]]

title: merlin_(fate)
body:
A minor character in [[Fate/stay night]] and a Caster-class Servant in [[Fate/Grand Order]], first briefly appearing in the [[E Pluribus Unum (fate/grand order)|]] Singularity before being featured in the [[Babylonia (fate/grand order)|]] Singularity.

The wizard from Arthurian legend who helped [[Artoria Pendragon (fate)|King Arthur]] throughout life. An immortal half-incubus sealed within the Reverse Side of the World in the [[Garden of Avalon]], who is usually unsummonable as a Heroic Spirit under normal circumstances. He was the original owner of [[Fou (fate)|]], who hates him.

For the female version from [[Fate/Prototype]], see [[Merlin (Fate/Prototype)]].

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[Taiki (luster)|]]
[b]Voice Actor:[/b] [[Takahiro Sakurai]]

title: jaguarman_(fate)
body:
A Lancer-class Servant first appearing in [[Fate/Grand Order]]'s [[Babylonia (fate/grand order)|]] singularity. Renamed [b]Jaguar Warrior[/b] in the English version. A Central and South American divine spirit representing war and death, inhabiting the body of [[Fujimura Taiga]] as a Pseudo-Servant.

Due to her host body's name, she often incorporates tiger puns in addition to jaguar puns. Wears a [[kigurumi]] [[onesie]] in her first two ascensions, while her third ascension is a reference to [[Fujimura Raiga]]'s background as a [[yakuza]]. Wields a [[club (weapon)|]] on a long [[polearm|pole]] in her first two ascensions and a [[naginata]] in her third.

Considered a different character than Taiga for tagging purposes. Only tag both if both are in the image. The two can be distinguished by Jaguarman's [[extra ears|extra]] [[cat ears]].

body:

title: gilgamesh_(caster)_(fate)
body:
[[Gilgamesh (fate)|]] as he appears as a Caster-class character in the [[Babylonia (fate/grand order)|]] chapter of [i][[Fate/Grand Order]][/i].

This version of Gil is taken from the end of his namesake epic, after a lengthy and ultimately fruitless journey in search of immortality. As a result, he is a much wiser man, and the much beloved king of Uruk, though he still keeps some of his trademark arrogance and he's fighting a war on three fronts by the time the player character comes in. He is also established to be a workaholic by this time.

Can be distinguished from his normal counterpart by the [[jewelry]] on top of his [[double-parted bangs]] and his [[tattoo]]s.

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[Ginka Sima]]
[b]Voice Actor:[/b] [[Seki Tomokazu]]

title: enkidu_(fate)
body:
[[Fate (series)|]] character first appearing in flashbacks in [[Fate/Zero]] and [[Fate/Extra CCC]]. They are the "False" Lancer-class servant of [[Wolf (fate)|]] in [[Fate/strange fake]], and first appear in [[Fate/Grand Order]] during the [[Babylonia (fate/grand order)|]] singularity. They are [[Gilgamesh (fate)|]]'s closest friend and the namesake for [[enkidu (weapon) (fate)|his chains]], which Enkidu also utilizes in combat.

They are depicted as a long, [[green hair]]ed [[androgynous]] homunculus with [[green eyes]] and wearing a [[robe]]. Their "[[otoko no ko|appearance of a woman]]" is due to taking on the appearance of [[Shamhat (fate)|]] after she civilized them as a tribute to her. They are canonically [[1other|genderless]], but often [[genderswap (otm)|portrayed as male]] in fanworks. In [[Sensha Otoko]], she is canonically [[genderswap (otf)|]]ped into a girl.

They have been nicknamed "best clay" or "claybae" by fans (a variant of "best girl") as a reference to their origins.

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[Morii Shizuki]]
[b]Voice Actor:[/b] [[Kobayashi Yuu]]

For her Alter variant, see [[Jeanne d'Arc Alter (Fate)|]].

title: sessyoin_kiara
body:
Wizard and master of [[Hans Christian Andersen (fate)|Caster]] in [[Fate/EXTRA CCC]].[spoiler] She leads a virtual Buddhist cult whose beliefs involve around rising to a higher plane of existence via sexual activity. She's the true antagonist and final boss of the game. [/spoiler]

Another version of her is the therapist of a branch of Chaldea in [[Fate/Grand Order]]'s chapter [i]Abyssal Cyber Paradise, SE.RA.PH[/i]. [spoiler] She's later taken over by the [[demon pillar (fate)|Demon God Zepar]], taking on the personality of her CCC self, and ultimately transforms into a Beast-class Servant.[/spoiler] Her playable version is under the Alter Ego designation. While her nun and demon designs are present in both CCC and FGO, her design with arms printed on a longer dress and horns adorned with rings and tassels is exclusive to FGO.

An [[sessyoin_kiara_(swimsuit_mooncancer)|alternate Moon Cancer-class Servant]] and her [[sessyoin_kiara_(lily)|aged down]] version were introduced in FGO's Summer 2020 event.

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[Takeuchi Takashi]]
[b]Illustrator:[/b] [[Wada Arco]]
[b]Voice Actress:[/b] [[Tanaka Rie]]

title: gawain_(fate)
body:
[[Fate (series)|Fate series]] character. A Saber-class servant who appears in [[Fate/EXTRA]], [[Fate/EXTRA CCC]], [[Fate/EXTRA CCC Fox Tail]], [[Fate/EXTELLA]], and [[Fate/Grand Order]].

A [[blonde hair]]ed man with [[blue eyes]], he dons [[white armor]] and owns [[Excalibur Galatine (fate)|]]. One of the [[Knights of the Round Table (fate)|]] that appeared in the Arthurian legends. As the son of King Lot and [[Morgan le Fay (fate)|]], his siblings include [[Gareth (fate)|]], [[Agravain (fate)|]], and [[Mordred (fate)|]] (half-sister).

Infamous for his notoriously difficult battle in the [[Camelot (fate/grand order)|]] singularity.

title: hans_christian_andersen_(fate)
body:
Caster-class Servant of [[Sessyoin Kiara]] in [[Fate/Extra CCC]] based on the Danish author of the same name.

He appears as a child who has messy blue hair and wears a formal outfit. Albeit he has an adult voice due to him intentionally manifesting that way to remind himself of his childhood and forget about his chaotic adult life.

Gains an [[hans christian andersen (adult) (fate)|adult version]] in the Summer 2020 event of [[Fate/Grand Order]].

title: meltryllis_(fate)
body:
[[Fate (series)|Fate series]] character. Also known as [b]Meltlilith[/b]. She appears in [[Fate/EXTRA CCC]], [[Fate/EXTRA CCC Fox Tail]], and [[Fate/Grand Order]].

She resembles [[Matou Sakura]], with [[long hair|long]] [[purple hair]] and [[blue eyes]]. She wears a large black cloak, with [[long sleeves]] that [[sleeves past fingers|cover her hands]], and a metal [[crotch plate]]. In [[Fate/Grand Order]], her crotch plate becomes a chain metal [[thong]]. Her most distinctive features are her metallic legs, which have long spikes that protrude from her knees and feet.

In [[Fate/EXTRA CCC]], she is the aspect of BB representing pleasure, and she uses ballet techniques in her fighting style. In [[Fate/Grand Order]], she appears as an Alter Ego-class Servant.

Her floral namesakes are the [[Amaryllis (flower)|]] and the [[Lily (flower)|]]. Her component spirits are [[Artemis (fate)|]], [[Leviathan (mythology)|]], and [[Saraswati]].

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[Wada Arco]]
[b]Voice Actress:[/b] [[Hayami Saori]]

title: nursery_rhyme_(fate)
body:
Caster-class Servant in [[Fate/EXTRA]], [[Fate/EXTRA CCC]], and [[Fate/Grand Order]]. She is the manifestation of Nursery Rhymes, and she is a representation of the imaginations and dreams of children across the ages.

First appears as an Enemy Servant in [[Fate/EXTRA]]. [[Alice (fate)|]] is her Master in that game, and Nursery Rhyme borrows her appearance. To tell the two apart, Nursery Rhyme wears black and purple clothes.

title: passionlip_(fate)
body:
A character in [[Fate/Extra CCC]] that greatly resembles [[Matou Sakura]], but has longer hair, [[gigantic breasts]], and wields a giant pair of talons. She can be summoned as an Alter Ego-class Servant in [[Fate/Grand Order]].

Her floral namesakes are the [[passion flower]] and the [[tulip]]. Her component spirits are [[Brynhild (fate)|]] (whom she shares the name of her noble phantasm with), [[Parvati (fate)|]], and [[Durga (fate)|]].

title: gquuuuuux
body:
Namesake [[mecha]] of [[gundam_gquuuuuux|Mobile Suit Gundam GQuuuuuuX]].  Pronounced "gee-KWUCKS", after the computer science metasyntactic variable [i]quux[/i]. 

[b]gMS-Ω Gundam QuuuuuuX[/b]

A latest [[mobile suit]] of the Principality of [[Zeon]], utilizing Omega-Psycommu technology that requires highest of Newtype ability.

It is also notable for being the first lead Gundam to be equipped with an [[axe]], which is usually a signature weapon of antagonist mass production type mobile suits, such as the [[Zaku II]]'s [[heat hawk]].

In [[real life]] it was designed by [[Yamashita Ikuto]] (famous for designing all the robots from [[neon_genesis_evangelion|Evangelion]]).

title: tohsaka_rin_(fate/extra)
body:
A version of [[Tohsaka Rin]] that appears in [[Fate/Extra]], being the Master of [[Cu Chulainn (fate/extra)|]] (since [[Archer (fate)|]] is one of Kishinami Hakuno's playable Servants). [spoilers]She is a distant relative of FSN Rin's, and her hair is actually blonde due to her avatar being tweaked to make it black[/spoilers]. She can be distinguished from the [[Fate/stay night]] version by the red trim on her hair bows.

Depending on the game this Rin appears in, her outfit varies:

* [[Fate/Extra]]: swaps out thighhighs for [[black footwear|black]] [[thigh boots]] that have thigh straps, and her [[red shirt]] has gloves on the ends (post #588235). This outfit is additionally adapted for the [b]Code Cast[/b] [[Craft Essence (fate)|]] (post #3254593).
** She also wears a second costume [spoilers]when she is revealed to be blonde in real life[/spoilers], where she wears skin-tight [[black pants]] which reveals her [[butt crack]], and a see-through [[black capelet]] (post #2170955).
* [[Fate/Extra CCC]]: may be seen wearing the [[Tsukumihara Academy Uniform (fate/extra ccc)|]].
* [[Fate/Extra Record]]: wears a black leotard-esque shirt, [[red skirt]], and black thigh boots (post #4019196).
* [[Fate/Extra Last Encore]]: becomes a [[tohsaka rin (lancer)|Lancer-class Demi-Servant]] fused with Cu Chulainn's Spirit Origin.

title: bb_(fate)
body:
[[Fate (series)|Fate series]] character. She appears in [[Fate/Extra CCC]] and [[Fate/Grand Order]].

Appearance-wise, she looks like [[Matou Sakura]], with [[long hair|long]] [[purple hair]] and [[purple eyes]]. 

In [[Fate/Extra CCC]], she is an advanced AI created by [[Matou Sakura (fate/extra)|]]. She is also the Master of the Sakura Five: [[Passionlip (fate)|]], [[Meltryllis (fate)|]], [[Kazuradrop (fate)|]], [[Violet (fate)|]], and [[Kingprotea (fate)|]].

[spoiler]Originally created as a friendly AI to aid masters who participatied in the lunar Holy Grail War. Due to a glitch in her coding, she has developed sadistic tendencies and later took over the Moon's electrical system. She often pretends to aid the players, only to put them in her own trap and mocking them of how powerless they are.[/spoiler]

In [[Fate/Grand Order]], she is a MoonCancer-class welfare Servant for the [[SE.RA.PH (fate/grand order)|Fate/Extra CCC event]].

title: nero_claudius_(fate/extra)
body:
Saber-class Servant originally from [[Fate/Extra]], who also appears in [[Fate/Grand Order]]. See [[Nero Claudius (Fate)]] for other versions of Nero.

Her normal outfit is a military-style [[red dress]] with [[epaulettes]] and a [[see-through clothes|see-through]] part that shows a white [[leotard]] underneath. Sometimes depicted with her [[sword]], [[Aestus Estus]]. Her Noble Phantasm is  [[Aestus Domus Aurea]], a giant [[colosseum]].

Despite their very similar appearances, Nero Claudius and [[Artoria Pendragon (fate)|]] are different characters.

Designed by [[Wada Arco]] and [[Takeuchi Takashi]], and voiced by [[Tange Sakura]].

title: cleopatra_(fate)
body:
[[Fate/Grand Order]]'s depiction of Cleopatra VII, one of the last pharaoh of [[ancient Egyptian|ancient Egypt]] from the Greek Ptolemaic dynasty. Best known for her intimate relationships with [[Gaius Julius Caesar (fate)|]] and Mark Anthony, her legend surrounding her beauty, and her struggle to keep Egypt independent from Rome's rule. She first appeared in the [[Halloween Comeback!]] event.

Cleopatra is depicted as a bright and fashionable woman, evident by her [[contemporary]] clothing in her first two ascensions. When it comes to her past relationships, Cleopatra does not have any romantic feelings towards Anthony and views him as a good friend, while she still retains her love for Caesar and is in a [[husband and wife]] relationship with him.

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[Komatsuzaki Rui]]
[b]Voice Actress:[/b] [[Kugimiya Rie]]

title: laser_hallway
body: A clichéd type of trap found in various action movies. As the name suggest, it is a [[hallway]] that is filled with several [[laser]] beams that should anyone come into contact with it, the trap will alert of their presence and/or trigger booby traps to kill the intruder.

title: neo_universe_(umamusume)
body:
Character from [[Umamusume]].

Notable for being the first Shadai Group horse to be implemented in the franchise since [[Orfevre (old design) (umamusume)|Orfevre]]'s and [[Buena Vista (old Design) (umamusume)|Buena Vista]]'s tentative appearances in the franchise's earliest days. In this case, being from Shadai Race Horse instead of Sunday Racing.

Personality-wise, she talks and acts as if she came from space. She is very intelligent but, due to her unusual syntax, her use of 4 letter contractions and the fact that she's always talking in esoteric outer space metaphors, she comes off as inscrutable and eccentric at best, living in her own little universe at worst. Despite her eccentric personality, she is often very affectionate to her [[trainer (umamusume)|]], as [spoiler] she is aware she is living in a different universe and went there due to her love and desire of meeting her trainer who is apparently an alternate universe version of Neo Universe's real life jockey [[Mirco Demuro]].[/spoiler]

h4. Appearance

h4. Related characters

body: A horse racing simulation game series released by Koei (later Koei Tecmo), featuring both fictional and [[real life]] [[horse|racehorses]] and [[jockey|jockeys]] as playable characters.

title: reverse_trap
body:
Per [[otoko_no_ko|trap]], a female character who looks and may or may not act masculine. Most likely also dresses like a male, although unlike mere [[crossdressing]] the character is assumed by others to be male until demonstrated otherwise.

As a rule of thumb, if you can correctly tell the gender with complete certainty from the thumbnail alone, it's not a reverse trap.

Often indicated on Pixiv by the [b]男装[/b] ([i]Dansou[/i] lit. "masculine clothes/disguising oneself as a man") and [b]男装の麗人[/b] ([i]Dansou no Reijin[/i] lit. "A beautiful woman disguised as a man") tags. See also [[tomboy]], which may overlap. pool #6118 may also overlap in some places, but is not necessarily the standard.

title: kei_(blue_archive)
body:
A character from [[Blue Archive]]. Depicted as being visually identical to [[Aris (blue archive)|]], with the difference being the [[glowing eyes|glowing]] [[pink eyes]] and, sometimes, the [[red halo]].

[spoilers]She is another personality that resides within [[Aris (blue archive)|]]' mind, and is the representation of her original programming to carry out a genocidal campaign in the name of the "Nameless Priests" who created her. She will often refer to Aris as "Princess" in reference to this role. Originally she was referred to as <Key> as the program meant to unlock Aris' nature as the Princess of the Nameless Priests, but would be given the name of "Kei" during the events of Volume F as Aris accepted her as a part of her existence.[/spoilers]

Due to her nature, fanart typically portrays her as having a more caustic or aggressive personality compared to the normally kind and curious Aris.

[spoilers] In Decagrammaton Chapter 2 "Sword of Flames" Kei has been revived and her consciousness was loaded onto a purpose-built AMAS robot produced by [[rio_(blue_archive)|Rio]].

In the upcoming chapter "Sky of Unity" and the 6th PV, Kei managed to integrate a body similar that of Decagrammaton, her purpose for it is unknown at the moment. [/spoiler]

h4. Appearance

* !post #5849411: Human
* !asset #22540813: [[Kei (Robot) (blue archive)|Robot]]

h4. See also

* [[Kei (Robot) (blue archive)|]]
other_names: ケイ(ブルーアーカイブ)

title: grand_admiral_thrawn
body:
[b]Grand Admiral Thrawn[/b] is a fictional character in [[Star Wars]] created by Timothy Zahn. He originally appeared in the Star Wars Expanded Universe's novels, the Thrawn trilogy, before he was made canon in the new Disney Star Wars' canon.

A Grand Admiral within the [[Galactic Empire (star Wars)|]], Thrawn is a [[Chiss]], a race of red eyed, blue skin aliens, which is unusual in the Empire since the Empire are pro-Human and discriminate against alien races. Yet despite that, Thrawn was not only accepted within the Empire but was able to rise to a high position within the Imperial Navy. A brilliant and very dangerous strategist who is well respected by his men, Thrawn commands the remants of the Galactic Empire, following their defeat with the Rebel Alliance.

In both the [[Star Wars: Rebels]] cartoon and the live action series [[Star Wars: Ahsoka]], Thrawn is voiced and portrayed by Lars Mikkelsen.

title: paptimus_scirocco
body:
A fictional character from the [[Gundam]] [[mecha]]verse. Main antagonist from the [[zeta_gundam|Mobile Suit Zeta Gundam]] anime TV series from 1985. 

[b]Paptimus Scirocco[/b] is a very tall, evil, charming and powerful [[titans_(gundam)|Titans]] Newtype, who commands the [i]Jupitris[/i] energy ship and designed a plethora of mobile suits. (Just don't give him any [[watermelon bar]]s...).

[spoiler]Scirocco's charm, almost a form of mind control, is enough to turn both [[Reccoa Londe]] and [[Sarah Zabiarov]], who were both on good terms with members of the [[AEUG]] [[Argama]]'s crew, into his undying followers (as well as influencing the actions of [[Yazan Gable]]). Regardless, he is mercilessly and brutally killed by a ferocious [[Kamille Bidan]] in the [[Zeta Gundam (mobile_suit)|]], who rams Scirocco's [[mobile suit]] [[The O (mobile_suit)|]], its capabilities amplified by the biosensor, straight into Scirocco's cockpit, crushing him to death.[/spoiler]

Paptimus' character design and personality traits are somewhat similar to those of [[Grand Admiral Thrawn]] from [[Star Wars]].
other_names: パプテマス・シロッコ

title: macross_plus
body:
[b][i]Macross Plus[/i][/b] (マクロスプラス) is a 1994 [[science fiction]] and [[mecha]] OVA series set in the [[Macross]] universe, directed by [[Kawamori Shouji]] and Watanabe Shinichirou and written by Nobumoto Keiko, with music by [[Kanno Youko]].

The story takes place in 2040, decades after the original [[choujikuu_yousai_macross|Super Dimension Fortress Macross]]. On the planet Eden, three former childhood friends are reunited during a military project to determine a new [[variable fighter]] successor, and old grudges and past traumas resurface.

The series was released in 1994 in [[Japan]] on home video spread across four episodes, and also saw release in North America and Europe courtesy of Manga Entertainment. A theatrical cut of the series was also released in theaters in 1995 under the name [i]Macross Plus: Movie Edition[/i].
