title: bedivere_(fate)
body:
A minor character in [[Fate/stay night]] and a Saber-class servant in [[Fate/Grand Order]] introduced in the [[Camelot (fate/grand order)|]] Singularity. He was one of [[Saber (fate)|]]'s knights of the Round Table. Has a very [[androgynous]] appearance to the point of either being a [[bishounen]] or even an [[otoko no ko]]. Is [[amputee|missing his right arm]] and is usually seen wearing a [[prosthetic arm|prosthesis]].

[spoiler]The version appearing in Fate/Grand Order is from a timeline where he never returned [[Excalibur (fate/stay night)|]] to the [[Lady of the Lake]], resulting in [[Artoria Pendragon (fate)|]] being unable to die. He ended up waiting in the Garden of Avalon with [[Merlin (fate)|]] for centuries until the events of the [[Camelot (fate/grand order)|]] singularity, where he was finally able to defeat Artoria, now having been taken over by the holy power of [[Rhongomyniad (fate)|]] and becoming the [[Lion King (lancer) (fate)|Lion King]].[/spoiler]

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[Takeuchi Takashi]]
[b]Illustrator:[/b] [[Tenkuu Sphere]] ([[Fate/Grand Order]])
[b]Voice Actor:[/b] [[Noto Mamiko]] ([[Fate/stay night]]), [[Miyano Mamoru]] ([[Fate/Grand Order]])

title: doro_(nikke)
body:
A [[meme]] character based on [[Dorothy (nikke)|]] from [[Goddess of Victory: Nikke]]. Has also been referred to as "Dororong", "Dororo", and "La creatura" (a nickname it shares with [[Neco-Arc]]). Its appearance was based on a peculiar fanart of [[Stella Unibell]] from [[Soulworker]] as a chibi dog.

It originated from the Korean NIKKE "forums":[https://arca.live/e/33292?target=tag&keyword=%EB%8B%88%EC%BC%80&p=] but has quickly spread to other communities such as [[Blue Archive]], [[Honkai: Star Rail]], and [[Hololive]]. The meme also gained attention from the developers themselves, Shift Up with the CEO, [[Kim Hyung Tae]] and his wife [[KKUEM]] are "seen holding a Santa-esque Doro plush alongside Shuhei Yoshida":[https://x.com/yosp/status/1778902056721592730]. The 2024 April Fools event for the game also features [[Matis (nikke)|Matis]] in the form of Doro as [[Syuen (nikke)|]]'s burst skill.

[i]Note: This tag is also applicable to any other characters that got the "Dorofication" treatment, not just Dorothy's Doro.[/i]

h4. Appearance
* !asset #25619367

h4. External links
* "Know Your Meme: Dororong":[https://knowyourmeme.com/memes/dororong]

She uses the [[Dress of Heaven]] and specializes in healing and support abilities in-game.

title: dragon_quest
body:
An immensely popular Japanese RPG series developed by [[Square Enix]]—formerly by Enix separately—with character designs by [[Toriyama Akira]]. The series—especially the earliest games—heavily influenced the development of the genre in Japan. The series was never as popular in the west as [i][[Final Fantasy]][/i] due to delayed releases and the closure of Enix's North America office in the 1990s, but its profile has grown since the 2003 Square Enix merger.

Formerly known as [i]Dragon Warrior[/i] in North America until 2005, due to a trademark conflict over a tabletop roleplaying game of the same name.

h4. Games

title: viola_(bayonetta)
body:
A playable character introduced in [[Bayonetta 3]]. A young witch-in-training from an [[Alternate universe]], she arrives to [[Bayonetta]]'s universe to help her fight against [b]Singularity[/b], the main antagonist in the 3rd game. 

Viola is later revealed as [spoilers]the daughter of her universe's Bayonetta and [[Luka Redgrave]][/spoilers]. In battle Viola uses a [[katana]] and her demon cat familiar, Cheshire.

title: nyatasha_nyanners
body:
An American [[cat girl]] [[virtual youtuber|VTuber]], and an old school YouTuber known for her singing and voice acting. Initially an [[indie virtual youtuber|Indie]], redebuted as one of the founding members of [[VShojo]], until leaving to return to being an indie on April 30, 2023. Her [[Live2D]] model is illustrated by [[origami (poinia)|Nia]].

Being a cat girl, she naturally has [[cat ears]] and a [[cat tail]] with [[long hair|long]] [[pink hair]] and [[purple eyes]].

title: nyatasha_nyanners_(old_design)
body:
The original design of [[Nyatasha Nyanners|Nyanners]], which she had used in some form since 2012, before having it refined in July 2020 with her [[nyatasha nyanners (1st costume)|VTuber]] debut. She used this design in many of her old videos, including in some song covers she did in the past.

The basics of the design was that she was a [[pink hair|pink-haired]] [[cat girl]],  a [[blue hoodie|blue hoodie]] with her [[hood down]], being a reoccurring outfit she wore, and ultimately be used as the basis of her [[Virtual YouTuber|VTuber]] model.

h4. Appearance

title: mysterious_heroine_x_(fate)
body:
Yet another version of [[Artoria Pendragon (fate)|]], this time summoned as the Assassin Class. Wears a [[scarf]], [[blue jacket|blue]] [[track jacket]], [[shorts]], and a [[baseball cap]] that somehow [[hair through headwear|fails to conceal]] Artoria's iconic [[ahoge]].

She appears in the Type-Moon [[April Fools]] joke [[Rojiura Satsuki: Chapter Heroine Sanctuary]], [[Fate/Grand Order]] and [[Fate/EXTELLA]].

Her goal is to rid the universe of the ever growing Artorias and their ilk as she considers them a plague upon the universe and once they are gone she shall be the one and only Artoria. Although primarily focused on her mission to exterminate all Artorias, she has opened her heart to [[Saber Lily]].

Consequently, Artoria wears Mysterious Heroine X's outfit as an alternate costume in [[Fate/EXTELLA]].

Wields the mysterious magical sword, the [[Himitsucalibur (fate)|]]. Its capabilities and powers are a secret.

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[Takeuchi Takashi]]
[b]Illustrator:[/b] [[BUNBUN]] ([[Fate/Grand Order]])
[b]Voice Actress:[/b] [[Kawasumi Ayako]]

title: malyuk
body:
Ukrainian bullpup [[assault rifle]] derived from the [[Kalashnikov rifle]] platform. Also known as the AS "Vulcan" in the military of Ukraine.

It is offered in either 7.62x39mm, using common [[AK-47]] magazines, or 5.45x39mm, using the same magazines as the [[AK-74]] and [[AK-74M]].

title: mandricardo_(fate)
body:
Rider-class Servant first seen in the [[Atlantis (fate/grand order)|]] Lostbelt of [[Fate/Grand Order]]. An enemy of the [[Paladins of Charlemagne (fate)|]], but overall a minor character in the stories. He was an adventurer who acquired [[Hector (fate)|]]'s armor and sought [[Durandal (fate)|]], eventually stealing it after [[Roland (fate)|]] threw it away. The version summoned as a servant is him in his mid-thirties from after his adventures, with an extremely jaded personality, who wields a [[wooden sword]] in lieu of Durindana.

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[Ginka Sima]]
[b]Voice Actor:[/b] [[Masuda Toshiki]]

title: pudding
body:
In the United States, pudding characteristically denotes a sweet [[milk]]-based [[dessert]] similar in consistency to egg-based custards, though it may also refer to other types such as bread and rice pudding.

In Japan, the "crème caramel":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cr%C3%A8me_caramel variety is the most common. Packaged varieties are sold throughout Japanese convenience stores under the name purin (プリン), or custard pudding. The Spanish word for this dessert, [i]flan[/i], often leads artists to make visual puns involving [[Flandre Scarlet]].

h4. See also

* [[custard]]
* [[Tag Group:Food Tags]]
* [[pudding a la mode]]

title: gate_-_jieitai_ka_no_chi_nite_kaku_tatakaeri
body:
ゲート 自衛隊彼の地にて、斯く戦えり (ゲート じえいたいかのちにてかくたたかえり) 
"Gate - Thus the JSDF Fought There", or simply "Gate". 

A light novel series by Yanai Takumi, based on his own online novella, illustrated by [[Izuka Daisuke]]. 

In August 20XX, a portal to a parallel world known as the "Gate", suddenly appeared in [[ginza (tokyo)|Ginza, Tokyo]] where monsters and human warriors wearing ancient armor poured out of the portal, killing everyone in their way and trying to claim the area as their own. This would later be known as the "The Ginza Incident". Immediately after the attack, the [[Japan Ground Self-Defense Force]]s launches a counter attack, repelling and pushing the invaders back to the Gate and reclaiming Ginza. 

A manga adaptation is adapted by [[Sao Satoru]]. A TV anime adaptation aired Summer 2015 with a continuation in Winter 2016.

Due to the overall theme, the series have been chosen by the [[Japan Self-defense Force]] as a promotional and a recruiting tool for the JSDF since 2016.

title: lemuen_(arknights)
body:
A playable Sniper operator in [[Arknights]].

An NPC that first appeared during the [i]Guiding Ahead[/i] event, she was later introduced as an operator in [i]The Masses' Travels[/i]. She is the adoptive elder sister of [[Exusiai (Arknights)|]] and a former squadmate of [[Mostima (Arknights)|]] and [[Fiammetta (Arknights)|]]. Like all Sankta, she has an angel motif.

Due to an incident in the past, she is confined to a [[wheelchair]]. [spoiler]This is the same incident that caused Mostima's "fall"; their superior officer attacked her while being controlled by Mostima's staff. Mostima shot him to protect Lemuen, but as she deliberately broke one of the Sankta's commandments she was transformed into her current fallen state.[/spoiler]

She has [[long hair|long,]] [[pink hair]] and [[pink eyes]], a simple white, circular [[halo]], and white [[energy wings]] that strongly resemble her sister's. She carries a small [[character doll]] of Exusiai and a [[sniper rifle]].

Her [[voice actor|voice actresses]] are [[Nakamura Eriko]] (Japanese) & Su Wan (Chinese).
other_names: レミュアン(アークナイツ)

title: toon_(style)
body:
Artwork in the style of typical Western animation and comics. This includes styles based on classic [[Disney]] or [[Warner Bros]] cartoons, modern cartoons such as [[The Simpsons]], [[Family Guy]], or [[South Park]], as well as styles from superhero, newspaper, or indie/underground comics.

While there are some Japanese characters that resemble toons, such as the casts of [[Sazae-san]] and [[Anpanman]], they do not count under this tag by default.

This tag is meant for characters who are drawn in the style of cartoons, [b]not[/b] for pictures of a character who merely originated from one.

h4. Substyles

* [[1930s (style)]] - Commonly referred to as "Inkblot" or "Rubberhose"
* [[western comics (style)|]] - Characters drawn in the style of American superhero comics; also known as "Amecomi"

h4. See also

* [[cartoonized]] - Non-cartoon characters drawn in the Toon style
* [[animification]] - Includes Western characters drawn in the style of anime and manga
* [[List of style parodies]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Toon":[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Toon]

[[yugo (yugotme97)]]'s [[original]] character originating from the [[Battle rally: void vortex (2022)]] contest where the theme of characters were prisoners placed in maximum security. She is now represented outside of that universe with a different background.

In [[Battle rally: void vortex (2022)]] she won the category of "Best fighter OC".

title: tennoji_rina
body:
A character in [[Love Live! Nijigasaki High School Idol Club]]. She's extremely shy and has trouble expressing her emotions, often covering her face with a [[sketchbook]] (dubbed the "[[Rina-chan Board]]") containing a [[drawing (object)|]] of her face. She has a pet robot cat named [[Aran (love live!)|]].

She has [[yellow eyes]] and [[medium hair|medium]] [[pink hair]] with [[blunt bangs]], [[blunt ends]], [[kishimen hair]] and an [[ahoge]]. Rather than her uniform blazer, she wears a [[blue jacket|blue]] [[hooded jacket]] with [[sleeves past fingers]] and always carries a [[marker]] in her pocket.

Her birthday is November 13, 2001.

She is a member of [[QU4RTZ (love live!)|]].

Voiced by [[Tanaka Chiemi]].

title: ump45_(girls'_frontline)
body:
An android representing the [[H&K UMP|H&K UMP45]] in [[Girls' Frontline]].

Has [[grey hair|grey]]-[[brown hair|dull-brown hair]] worn with [[one side up]], and wears a fairly practical (by fictional standards) outfit consisting of a [[white shirt]], a [[jacket]], [[black pantyhose]] and exoskeleton. She has [[brown eyes]] and has a [[scar across eye|scar on the left eye]].

UMP45 is portrayed as the older sister of [[UMP9 (girls' frontline)|]], sister (mostly young) of [[UMP40 (girls' frontline)|]], and is the leader of [[404 (girls' frontline)|Squad 404]]. UMP45 is often portrayed in the fandom as being the butt of [[flat chest]] jokes, often from either UMP9 or [[M37 (girls' frontline)|]]. Would receive a [[UMP45 (MOD3) (girls' frontline)|Neural Upgrade]]. In her appearance in [[Girls' Frontline 2: Exilium]], she would go by the name [[Leva (Girls' Frontline 2)|]].

Her original illustrator [[Infukun]] adapted her design from one of [[Renatus.Z]]'s Pixiv Fantasia characters, [[Renatus (pixiv fantasia)|]] (hence why they are credited as ZAGALA). Following Infukun's departure, other illustrators have picked her up to do her skins. She was previously voiced by Mineuchi Tomomi until she retired from voice acting in December 31, 2022 and is currently voiced by [[Sasahara Yuu]].

title: youkai_fox_(wild_and_horned_hermit)
body:
A shapeshifting [[fox]] youkai which impersonated [[kirisame_marisa|Marisa]] in [[Wild and Horned Hermit]] episodes 8 and 30. 

She shared in activities with "Kuda-gitsune":[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kuda-gitsune], a small fox familiar spirit used by "Izuna-tsukai":[http://eos.kokugakuin.ac.jp/modules/xwords/entry.php?entryID=193]. It is unknown whether she herself is the kudagistune, or the owner of it. 

Not to be confused with the other [[Youkai Fox_(forbidden_scrollery)|]], who impersonated a human child in [[Forbidden Scrollery]].

title: priestess_(arknights)
body: A character from [[Arknights]]. While little is known about her thus far, she lacks any distinctive animal traits that other characters possess and [spoiler]was responsible for placing the Doctor into the Chernobog Sarcophagus some time prior to the events of the game.[/spoiler] Priestess is a [[brown_hair|brunette]] with medium-length hair and [[purple eyes]], and is usually portrayed wearing a lab coat, a white shirt with a black ribbon tied around her neck underneath, and a black skirt.

title: thighhighs
body:
Stockings or [[socks]] that cover the legs from foot to thigh. They are held up by elastic thighbands, or sometimes a [[garter belt]].

Thighhighs differ from [[pantyhose]] in that pantyhose covers the legs from waist to toe. [[Over-kneehighs]] are similar to thighhighs but shorter, ending just above the kneecap.

title: imadake_dabuchi_tabemi
body:
A character introduced by [[McDonald's]] Japan to promote their limited edition Double Cheeseburger, sold from late October to November 2024. Her name most literally means "Try the Double Cheeseburger right now only", with the suffix 美 ([i]mi[/i], Eng: Beautiful) being a common feminine name component in Japan.

She has [[short_hair|short]] [[brown hair]] styled in [[twintails]] and wears a [[red_hat|red]] [[visor cap]] with a large [[McDonald's]] logo visible from the front that's adorned with a [[headset]] and [[microphone]].

Her outfit is based on the old [[fast_food_uniform|McDonalds uniform]] from the 1990s featuring a [[white shirt]] with red [[vertical-striped_shirt|vertical stripes]], topped off with a [[yellow happi]] with a bright red hem, which is secured with a red [[tasuki]] that's tied off into a large [[back_bow|bow on her back]].

Some further accents of her outfit are a [[black necktie]] with [[tie clip|tie clips]], two [[black wristband|black wristbands]], and a black [[button badge]] with the 今 kanji ([i]ima[/i], Eng: Now) which is the first syllable of her name.

Her bottom half consists of [[black shorts]], [[white socks]], and [[red footwear|red]] [[sneakers]] with [[velcro_footwear|velcro]] fasteners. 

h4. Appearance

* !post #8324932: Profile
* !post #8328754: Reference Sheet

h4. See also

* [[Imadake Dabuchi Tabesuke]]
* [[Samurai Tamago Tabemi]]

title: sessyoin_kiara_(swimsuit_mooncancer)
body:
Moon Cancer-class Swimsuit version of [[Sessyoin Kiara]] introduced in [[Fate/Grand Order]]'s event [i]Servant Summer Camp[/i]. Her outfit changes depending on her Ascension level. [spoiler]Struck by an instant death attack, Kiara respawned in place of her formerly defeated self in [i]SE.RA.PH[/i], mortally wounded at the bottom of the sea. There, she found and consumed the "clam-monster Shen":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shen_(clam-monster)] and mermaids, becoming a Moon Cancer-class Servant. She then formulated a plan to try to redo her childhood and affect the antagonist's plans by returning as a young girl.[/spoiler]

An [[aged down]] [[sessyoin kiara (lily)|version]] is also seen in the story and as the event shopkeeper. She's treated as a separate character from this one.

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[Wada Arco]]
[b]Voice Actress:[/b] [[Tanaka Rie]]

h4. Appearance

title: sessyoin_kiara_(lily)
body:
[[Aged down]] version of [[Sessyoin Kiara (Swimsuit Mooncancer)]] introduced in the Summer 2020 event of [[Fate/Grand Order]], [i]Servant Summer Camp[/i]. She was one of the main characters in the story and the event shopkeeper.

[spoiler]For her amusement and to deceive the event's antagonist, Kiara turned into her lily form and afflicted herself with amnesia. She prepared a sea shell that would transform her into [[Sessyoin Kiara (Swimsuit Mooncancer) (second ascension)|Police Kiara]] to fight enemies and save Fujimaru when necessary, turning back to her lily form before remembering the truth.[/spoiler]

title: isamu_dyson
body:
A character from the [[MACROSS]] series. He is the main protagonist of the [[Macross Plus]] OVA from the 90s.

[b]Isamu Alva Dyson[/b] is a very skilled -but hot-headed and cocky- [[U.N. Spacy]] [[variable fighter]] ace and prototype [[mecha]] test [[pilot]]. His mecha of choice are the [[VF-11]] and the [[YF-19]] variable fighters.

The character is voiced by "Bryan Cranston":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bryan_Cranston ([i]Malcolm in the Middle[/i], [i]Breaking Bad[/i]) in the American dub of the OVA. Cranston also voiced [[Marty Tohn]] in the anime [[Honneamise No Tsubasa]].
other_names: イサム・アルヴァ・ダイソン

title: n.u.n.s.
body:
The [b]New U.N. Spacy[/b] is the name of the successor to the original [[U.N. Spacy]] organization from [[Choujikuu Yousai Macross]].

According to the fictional [[Macross]] chronology, since the end of Space War I (2009 A.D. - 2010 A.D.) until the latest animated series, [[Macross Frontier]] (2059 A.D.), the original U.N. Spacy was reorganized into the "New U.N. Spacy" or N.U.N.S.

This new organization functions as a [[space]] [[military]] defense force that is in charge of the protection of all the different colonization fleets of the Human and cultured Zentradi alliance and the [[planet]]s they have colonized across the [[galaxy]]. 

The New U.N. Spacy now has a much bigger space navy composed mostly of military bases established on those planets as well as several defense fleets scattered among the colonization fleets. Each defense fleet is composed mostly of improved Human and [[Zentradi]] capital [[spacecraft]], new variable fighters and other mecha and at least one [[SDF-1]] sized vessel used as command base for the current fleet.

title: digimon_world_3
body: Digimon World 3 (デジモンワールド3 新たなる冒険の扉, Dejimon Wārudo 3 Aratanaru Bōken no Tobira, Digimon World 3: The Door of a New Adventure), also known as Digimon World 2003 in Europe and Australia, is a role-playing video game for the [[PlayStation]] developed by BEC and Boom Corp, and published by Bandai. It is the third installment in the [[Digimon World]] series and it was first released in June 2002 in North America and then in July 2002 in Japan and November 2002 in Europe. The game tells the story of Junior, who begins playing an MMORPG called "Digimon Online" with his friends, but when terrorists attack, Junior and the other players are trapped within the game and must find a way out using his [[Digimon]] partners.

title: yagiyama_yotsuyu
body:
Yotsuyu Yagiyama (八木山 夜露, Yagiyama Yotsuyu) is a secondary antagonist featured in the eighth part of the [[JoJo's Bizarre Adventure]] series, [[JoJolion]]. 

Yotsuyu is revealed to be a [spoilers]Rock Human with a stolen name, belonging to a Locacaca Organization.[/spoilers]. Yotsuyu is a [[Stand (jojo)|]] user who wields the Stand [[I Am a Rock (stand)|]]

Yagiyama is a Rock Human of slim build and average to above-average height. He has shoulder-length, straight black hair with short bangs. His eyes are black with small triangular highlights.
He wears a headpiece of [[leaves]] and a collar with a pin bearing the letter H. His arms, stomach, and legs are clad in a dark, leathery material studded with small metallic spikes. Over this, he wears a crop top and a pair of floral-printed bloomers. Attached to his belt is a small pouch.

title: pyotr_illyich_tchaikovsky
body: Pyotr Ilyich Tchaikovsky was a Russian composer during the Romantic period. He was the first Russian composer whose music made a lasting impression internationally. Tchaikovsky wrote some of the most popular concert and theatrical music in the classical repertoire, including the ballets Swan Lake and The Nutcracker, the 1812 Overture, his First Piano Concerto, Violin Concerto, the [[Romeo and Juliet]] Overture-Fantasy, several symphonies, and the opera Eugene Onegin.

title: sonic_(series)
body:
[[Sega]]'s flagship franchise, making its debut in 1991. Sonic games are chiefly high-speed platforming games where the titular hedgehog stops his nemesis, Dr. Eggman, from taking over the world. Created as Sega's rival to [[Mario]] of [[Nintendo]], the series skyrocketed to popularity. 

h4. Characters

* [[Amy Rose]]
* [[Big the Cat]] and [[Froggy (sonic)|]]
* [[Blaze the Cat]]
* [[Charmy Bee]]
* [[Cream the Rabbit]] and [[Cheese (sonic)|]]
* [[Dr. Eggman]] (a.k.a. Dr. Ivo Robotnik)
* [[E-123 Omega]]
* [[Espio the Chameleon]]
* [[Knuckles the Echidna]]
* [[Metal Sonic]]
* [[Orbot]] and [[Cubot]]
* [[Tails (Sonic)|Miles "Tails" Prower]]

title: faust_(project_wingman)
body:
The main antagonist of the Frontline-59 campaign DLC from [[Project Wingman]]. 

A ruthless and a win-at-all-costs leader, she serves as one of the commanding officers of the Cascadian Independence Force's invasion of the Federation Core States territory of Magadan. [spoilers]Eventually, her true nature was revealed, in which she seeks to destroy the Pacific Federation as a means of salvation for Cascadia and the world, regardless of the cost. After going rogue with her followers, she met her demise under the hands of [[Driver_(Project Wingman)|]] and Division K-9.[/spoilers]

title: paggi_outfit
body:
Cropped Hoodie, Skull Panties, and Thigh Highs Art Challenge is an art challenge that was popular on Twitter in July of 2024. The art challenge asks artist to draw their character wearing a black and pink [[cropped hoodie]], [[black panties]] with a pink skull on the front, and black thigh-high stockings.

h4. External links

title: binchou-tan
body:
A slice-of-life comedy manga (and later anime) following the central character [[Binchou-tan (character)|]], a lonely girl who is the personification of [i]binchoutan[/i] charcoal.

As several of the characters are in fact personifications of various types of charcoal and never appear in any other form, it is probably redundant to use the [[personification]] tag.

title: blade_(honkai:_star_rail)
body:
A playable character in [[Honkai: Star Rail]]. Called [i]Ren[/i] in Chinese and [i]Jin[/i] in Japanese. 

A member of the Stellaron Hunters, and a swordsman [spoilers]who abandoned his body to become a blade[/spoilers]. He pledges loyalty to Destiny's Slave, and possesses a terrifying self-healing ability.

He is portrayed with [[long hair|long]] dark [[blue hair|blue]]/[[black hair]] with a [[red hair|red]] [[gradient hair|gradient]], and [[red eyes]]. His default outfit consists of a [[brown shirt]] worn with a [[long sleeves|long-sleeved]] [[black jacket]], [[black belt]], [[grey pants]], multiple [[bandages]] on different parts of his body, [[single glove|single]] [[black gloves|black glove]] on his right hand, and [[black footwear|black]] [[shoes]]. Voiced by [[Miki Shin'ichirou]] (JP) and [[Daman Mills]] (EN). 

h4. Appearance

* !post #7690446: Splash art
* !post #8768580: The Unreachable Side (signature Light Cone)
* !post #7598448: [[Blade (Jepella Rebellion) (Honkai: Star Rail)|Jepella Rebellion]]

h4. Profile
[expand]
A member of the Stellaron Hunters, whose real name is unknown. Blade wields an ancient sword that has filled with cracks, just like his body and his mind.
[/expand]

h4. See also
* [[Yingxing (Honkai: Star Rail)]]
* [[Blade (Sesame Cake) (Honkai: Star Rail)|Ruan Mei's creations: Sesame Cake]]

body:
An independent trilingual [[Virtual YouTuber]], supported through [[VirtuaReal LINK]].
She is an [[fox girl]] [[android]] with [[long hair|long]] [[orange hair]] in [[low twintails]].
She has cybernetic [[fox ears]] and a [[fox tail]].
Underneath her synthetic skin is dark pink and red skin, and she has lights on her legs.

title: rick_dias_ii
body:
A fictional manned giant robot from the [[Gundam]] [[mecha]]verse. It first appeared in [[Gundam MSV]].

[b]MSA-099-2 Rick Dias II[/b]

It is an evolution of the legendary [[Rick Dias]] [[AEUG]] [[mobile suit]] from [[Zeta Gundam|The Gryps War]].

title: hyaku_shiki
body:
A fictional [[mecha]] from the [[Gundam]] series.

[b]MSN-00100 Hyaku Shiki (Type 100)[/b]

A high-performance [[mobile suit]] that serves as [[Quattro Bajeena]]'s final main personal unit in [[Zeta Gundam]]. Armaments include a [[beam rifle]], clay [[bazooka_(gundam)|bazooka]], and a pair of [[energy sword|beam sabers]]. It has a trademark golden color due to its experimental special and advanced anti-beam coating. The mecha can also use the [[beam_cannon|mega bazooka launcher]].

It is the actual final and definitive version of the MSN-001 [[Delta Gundam]], a prototype transformable Mobile Suit that was scrapped in the planning stages and later changed into a high-performance mobile suit. Vestiges of this can be seen in the flexible binders behind the Hyaku Shiki. 

[spoilers]The Hyaku was severely [[damaged]] in [[battle]] during the final [[duel]] of [[Haman Karn]] (in her [[Qubeley]]) and Quattro Bajeena. Apparently destroyed after Haman defeats Quattro, its [[wreckage]] is later shown floating in space (with its cockpit hatch open), implying Quattro's survival of the encounter. The repaired MS later appears in [[Gundam ZZ]] as part of the [[Argama]]'s [i][[Gundam Team]][/i] where it is operated mostly by [[Beecha Oleg]][/spoilers]

h4. Related development
* [[zero_shiki_(gundam)|Zero Shiki]]

* [[Hyaku Shiki Kai]]
** [[Full Armor Hyaku Shiki Kai]]

title: full_armor_hyaku_shiki_kai
body:
A fictional manned combat robot from the [[Gundam]] [[mecha]]verse. It first appeared in [[Gundam MSV]].

[b]FA-100S Full Armor Hyaku Shiki Kai[/b]

A variant of the MSR-00100 [[Hyaku Shiki Kai]] [[mobile_suit|MS]] equipped with additional heavy armor. 

Although its mobility is reduced by the added weight of the Full Armor system, it has an assortment of built-in armaments, including missiles, explosive bolts and additional powerful beam weaponry.

title: hyaku_shiki_kai
body:
A fictional manned combat robot from the [[Gundam]] [[mecha]]verse. It first appeared in [[Gundam MSV]].

[b]MSR-00100S Hyaku Shiki Kai[/b]

An improved variant of the MSN-00100 [[Hyaku Shiki]] [[mobile_suit|MS]]. 

Modifications include improved flexible wing binders and more powerful thrusters. It also features grenade launchers built into the forearms and optional shoulder-mounted weapons such as a beam Gatling gun and pulse laser gun.

h4. Related development
* [[Full Armor Hyaku Shiki Kai]]

title: fuyuyama_yoruko
body: [[Fuyuyama Asako]]'s twin sister, who is a [[ganguro]]-type [[gyaru]].

title: fuyuyama_umeko
body: [[Original]] character by [[Kuse (0201)]]. Mother of [[Fuyuyama Asako]] and [[Fuyuyama Yoruko|Yoruko]].

title: lucy_(chrono_ark)
body: Main character of the rougelike [[Chrono Ark]]. She has [[blonde hair]] and [[purple eyes|purple]]/[[blue eyes]], which are usually [[empty eyes|empty]].

title: geymalk
body:
A fictional manned giant combat [[robot]] from the [[Gundam]] [[mecha]]verse. It first appeared in the [[Gundam ZZ]] anime TV series from 1986.

[b]AMX-015 Geymalk[/b]

A heavy assault and psycommu equipped Newtype use [[mobile_suit|MS]] developed by [[Haman Karn]]'s [[Neo Zeon]]. In addition to being equiped with mega-particle guns all over its body, it possessed two [[funnels_(gundam)|"mother funnels"]] with 28 total [[bit_(gundam)|bit remote weapons]] between them. 

This overwhelming firepower made the Geymalk perhaps the most heavily armed and dangerous suit produced by Axis during the First Neo Zeon War. While it was intended to have been mass produced, only one unit was ever built and given to [[Chara Soon]].

title: lakilester
body: A [[Lakitu]] with [[sunglasses]] who is the eighth and last party member of [[Paper Mario 64]]

title: sushie
body: A small purple [[Cheep Cheep]] from [[Paper Mario 64]]

title: roswell_jegan
body:
A fictional manned military robot from the [[Gundam]] [[mecha]]verse. It first appeared in [[Gundam U.C. Engage]].

[b] RGM-89NT-1 Roswell Jegan[/b]

An [[Earth Federation]] data collecting and technology demostrator experimental variant of the [[Jegan]] [[mobile suit]] developed by [[Anaheim Electronics]] to test [[Fin Funnels]] technology before its adoption in the [[nu_gundam_mp_type|RX-94 Mass-Produced Nu Gundam]].
other_names: ロズウェル・ジェガン

title: kooper
body: A Adventure loving Blue-shell [[koopa troopa]] wint a [[red scarf]] from [[Paper Mario 64]]

title: gundam_mk_ii_banagher_links_custom
body:
A fictional manned combat robot from the [[Gundam]] [[mecha]]verse.

[b]RX-178S Gundam Mk II Banagher Link's Custom[/b]

An improved version of the [[Gundam Mk II]] used by [[Banagher Links]]. It has a modified right arm and is able to use the [[Unicorn Gundam]]'s Beam-magnum [[beam rifle]].

title: brute_abombinator
body:
Boss of the seventh raid in [[Final Fantasy XIV]] Dawntrail's Arcadion raid series.
The monstrous form [[Hector (FF14)|]] undertakes after fusing with multiple feral souls.

title: bombette
body: A pink [[Bob-omb]] from [[Paper Mario 64]]

title: dreissen
body:
A fictional [[mecha]] from [[Gundam]]. It first appeared in [[Gundam ZZ]] from 1986.

[b]AMX-009 Dreissen[/b]

A high speed, heavy (but very agile) [[mobile_suit|MS]] developed by [[Haman Karn]]'s [[Neo Zeon]]. Using data from the older [[Rick Dom II]] and inspired by the legendary [[Dom (mobile suit)|]] series, it performed very well using its sleeve cannons. It was [[Rakan Dahkaran]]'s first mecha of choice during Gundam ZZ.

[[gundam_unicorn|During the units' tenure with the Sleeves]], many issues with the design (namely the exposed [[arm cannon]] power cables) were ironed out and they were issued beam sabers to aid in close quarters combat.

title: bobby_(paper_mario)
body: A [[Bob-omb]] who lost his fuse and memories.

title: cursed_cat_(meme)
body:
Photoshopped [[black cat]] that instead resembles a strange bipedal shadow creature with no ears and long arms. Also known as "ANGRY AS FUK".

title: rezel
body:
A fictional variable  geometry [[mecha]] from the [[Gundam]] franchise. It first appeared in [[Gundam Unicorn]].

[b]RGZ-95 ReZEL[/b]

A high-performance transformable [[Mobile Suit]] fielded by the [[Earth Federation Space Forces]]. By utilizing the [[AEUG]] [[Methuss]]'s simplified transformation mechanism as a base, and integrating it with lessons learned from the [[Z II Gundam]] and the [[Zeta Plus]] series of MS as well as increasing parts commonality with the tried and proven [[Jegan]] made the ReZEL (short for [b]Re[/b]fined [b]Z[/b]eta [b]E[/b]scort [b]L[/b]eader) both highly competent and cheap enough to enter mass production. 

The type was effective in combat, and served as both a booster for the Jegans, who could grab onto ReZELs and fly with them to save fuel, and as a very powerful MS on its own, with a new design beam rifle that emulated the Zeta Gundam's (even able to generate a beam saber blade) and options of additional armament via the Defenser backpacks. 

The uprated [[ReZEL Commander Type]], distingushable from the rank and file ReZELs by its visor and sensors (red in the base model, green in the Commander Types) further pushed the already formidable performance of the unit. It was the EFF's first mass produced, widely operated transformable MS.

title: jitome
body:
When the top of the eye is drawn with a flat line. Used to effect listlessness, apathy, or a [[bored]], [[expressionless]], scornful, or [[smug]] face.

title: tai_yuan_(azur_lane)
body:
The personification of the Chinese (ex-Russian) destroyer [i]Tai Yuan[/i] (pennant 104) in [[Azur Lane]]. Character design by [[Shenbei Xiaoqiu]], voiced by [[Mizuhashi Kaori]]. 

She has [[short hair|short]] [[black hair]], [[purple eyes]], blue-colored scales on the side of her uniform, and a white [[snake]] wrapped around her right leg, reflective of her theme motif as the Black Chimera/Genbu of the class. 

Her [[rigging]] contains two 130 mm single gun mounts and two 533 mm triple [[torpedo tubes]].

Her real-life destroyer counterpart was originally built for the Soviet Pacific Fleet before being sold to China in 1953 (albeit initially named [i]Jilin[/i]) before being relieved of active service in 1991 to act as a stationary training ship.

h4. Skins

title: nevada_(azur_lane)
body:
The personification of the battleship USS [i]Nevada[/i] (BB-36) in [i][[Azur Lane]][/i]. 
Character designed by [[Hao (patinnko)|]], voiced by [[Uchiyama Yumi]].

Nevada has [[long hair|long]] [[blonde hair]] with some [[hair over one eye]] and [[yellow eyes]]. Her uniform is [[cowboy western]]-styled, featured what appears to be tanned-hide on her [[puffy short sleeves]], [[fingerless gloves]] and [[overskirt]], with [[fringe trim]] on these pieces. Under the western outfit pieces, she wears a corset-like [[strapless_shirt|strapless]] [[white shirt]], a [[pencil skirt]], [[black thighhighs]] with [[garter straps]]. She also wears [[red_footwear|red]] [[rudder_footwear|rudder]], and [[red ascot]].

Her [[rigging]] is a split-ship design, with her bow section on her left, and her stern section on her right. On each hull, a unique arrangement of one triple barrel [[ship turret|turret]] and one superfiring twin turret. On her back, her superstructure can be seen, as [[crane_(machine)|mechanical crane]]. She has several battleship shells carried in a [[utility belt]].

h4. Skins

* !post #2930375: Default
* !post #3170293: [[Nevada (retrofit) (azur lane)|Retrofit]]

title: albion_(azur_lane)
body:
[[Azur Lane]]'s personification of the aircraft carrier HMS [i]Albion[/i] (R07). Character design by [[Ng Jie]], voiced by Shiraki Nao. 

She is portrayed with [[very long hair|very long]] [[purple hair]], [[blue eyes]], [[pointy ears]], [[fairy wings]] and [[large breasts]]. 

Her default outfit consists of a [[midriff]] [[revealing clothes|revealing dress]] that [[bare shoulders|exposes her shoulders]], a white [[collar]] piece with a [[halterneck]], gold [[hair ornament]], large [[fairy wings]], [[white skirt]], long purple straps from the skirt, and [[barefoot|only wearing ankle ornaments]] for footwear. She uses a [[bow (weapon)|]] much like her sister and the US carrier girls, patterned off her real-life hull and masts.

Like her sister, she refers to all the other carrier girls as her [i]senpai[/i] (officially translated as "Elders") on account of the fact that they were, in real life, laid down in 1944 and commissioned [b]in 1953/1954[/b], well after the Second World War had ended.

title: fart
body:
The emission or flatus of gas inside the [[intestines]] from the [[ass]]/[[anus]]. Also known as a big part of toilet humor and even as a Japanese cultural phenomenon dating back to the Heian period. When He-gassen 屁合戦 was a common competition. Most common art depictions are illustrated with characters eating a [[sweet_potato]]. As it’s a classic gag of such an occurrence after eating them.

title: utsumi_erice
body:
Main protagonist of [[Fate/Requiem]], and [[Voyager (fate)|]]'s Master. She is the granddaughter of [[Manazuru Chitose]], and the daughter of an unnamed man and the heroic spirit "Izanami":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Izanami, making her a half-heroic spirit. She works as the "Grim Reaper" in Mosaic City, killing servants who break the rules established by the [[Holy Grail (fate)|]].

She appears in [[Fate/Grand Order]] as a Lancer and Avenger-class Servant.

title: manazuru_chitose
body:
[[Fate/Requiem]] character. [[Lucius Longinus (fate)|]]' Master, and [[Utsumi Erice]]'s grandmother who she uses non-aging magic to retain her youthful appearance. Manazuru is her maiden name, which she switched back to after giving birth to her son (Erice's father).

She and her servant Lucius Longinus won the [[Holy Grail (fate)|]] War 14 years ago and became the creator of Mosaic City, in addition to setting up the Holy Grail to distribute itself amongst the hearts of humans, allowing every human to summon their own servant.

h4. External links
* "Type-Moon Wiki":https://typemoon.fandom.com/wiki/Chitose_Manazuru

title: girls_und_panzer
body:
A [[tank]] combat action anime series originally produced by Actas, with a Summer 2012-2014 manga by [[Saitaniya Ryouichi]], serialized in Media Factory's [i]Comic Flapper[/i]. It spawned a manga, light novel, video games, and several feature length films, as well as a promotional collaboration with [[World of Tanks]].

Many of the major characters' designs were handled by [[Shimada Fumikane]], while [[Nogami Takeshi]] designed some of the other characters.

The series primarily revolves around the non-lethal tank battle tournament dubbed the [i]sensha-do[/i] contested by various all-girl high school teams.

body:
Lancer-class Servant from [[Fate/Grand Order]]. A version of [[Romulus (fate)|]] with his full Divinity unleashed. He is first seen in the second half of the Greek Lostbelt, [[Olympus (fate/grand order)|]]. [spoiler]There, [[Caligula (fate)|]] uses himself as a vessel for Romulus' Divinity, allowing him to be summoned as Grand Lancer.[/spoiler]

He considers himself to have ascended beyond gender as an ultimate being.

title: pollux_(fate)
body:
[[Fate/Grand Order]] character first appearing in the [[Atlantis (fate/grand order)|]] Lostbelt as one of [[Kirschtaria Wodime]]'s servants. She is [[Castor (fate)|]]'s [[genderswap (mtf)|]]ped [[twins|twin]] sister, the two together making up the Saber-class servant [b]Disocuri[/b]. Based off of the Greek mythological character of the same name. Unlike her mortal brother, she is an immortal demigod. The two were immortalized in the [[Gemini (constellation)|]] constellation.

The two voice actors for the Dioscuri, [[Uchida Maaya]] and [[Uchida Yuuma]], are [[brother and sister]] in [[real life]].

title: castor_(fate)
body:
[[Fate/Grand Order]] character first appearing in the [[Atlantis (fate/grand order)|]] Lostbelt as one of [[Kirschtaria Wodime]]'s servants. He is [[Pollux (fate)|]]'s [[twins|twin]] brother, the two together making up the Saber-class servant [b]Disocuri[/b]. Based off of the Greek mythological character of the same name. Unlike his sister, he is not a child of [[Zeus (fate)|]] and is a mortal human. [spoiler]Because of his anger on having his divinity removed in later legends (resulting in him being remembered as a human), he qualifies for the Avenger-class, and only appears as a Saber because he's summoned alongside his sister.[/spoiler] The two were immortalized in the [[Gemini (constellation)|]] constellation.

The two voice actors for the Dioscuri, [[Uchida Maaya]] and [[Uchida Yuuma]], are [[brother and sister]] in [[real life]].

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[Taiki (luster)|]]

title: lakshmibai_(fate)
body:
Saber-class servant debuted in [[Fate/Grand Order]]'s [[Yugakshetra (fate/grand order)|]] Lostbelt. An [[Indian]] queen and warrior. She was one of the greatest leaders of the Indian Rebellion of 1857 and became a symbol of resistance to British rule in India.

In-game, her overall appearance is similar to [[Jeanne d'Arc (fate)|]] (a nod to her nickname [i]Jeanne d'Arc of India[/i]), but with [[white hair]], [[dark skin]], and two long [[braid]]s. Thus, she also has the [i]Saberface[/i] trait. She dual-wields an Indian sword and a [[caplock]] firearm.

Due to the unique circumstances of the Indian Lostbelt, she also hosts a divided spirit of "Lakshmi":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lakshmi, in part due to their shared [[name connection]]. [spoiler]She actually specifically hosts "Alakshmi":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Alakshmi, the older sister of Lakshmi and a goddess of misfortune.[/spoiler] The divided spirit has very little influence on her personality, so she's mostly the same as she was in life.

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[Takeuchi Takashi]]
[b]Voice Actress:[/b] [[Satou Rina]]

title: dent
body:
A dent is a hollow in the surface of an object which has been caused by hitting, blunt impact or pressing it. 

h1. See also

* [[Bonk]]
* [[Crack]]
* [[Damaged]]
* [[Scratches]]

title: bonk
body:
A character being hit over the head in a comedic manner and/or accompanied by the eponymous sound effect. Sometimes resulting in a [[dent|dented]] head.

The purpose is often to dissuade the character from some course of action, or to punish them after the fact, but this is not necessary to qualify as a bonk. Likewise, the most common implement is a [[baseball bat]], but it can be any object or even bare-handed.

h4. See also

* [[>_<]]: common facial expression of the recipient of a bonk
* [[Dent]]
* [[Horny jail (meme)]]

title: gwechul
body: [b]괴담에 떨어져도 출근을 해야 하는구나[/b] (Lit: [i]Even if you fell into a ghost story, you still have to go to work[/i]), often abbreviated as 괴담출근 / GDCG or 괴출 / Gwechul, is a Korean fiction webnovel by DS.Back that tells the story of Kim Soleum who must enter various Ghost Stories in order to return to his world. It has horror elements and is rated 15+.

title: buddha's_temptation_(food)
body: Buddha's Temptation, also known as Fushouquan, is a famous dish from Fuzhou, Fujian Province, China. This dish was developed during the Daoguang period of the Qing Dynasty by Zheng Chunfa, the owner of the Juchun Garden restaurant in Fuzhou.

[spoilers]She is actually the corrupted form of the real [[Jeanne d'Arc (fate)|]], so wished into this state by her master [[Chiemon (fate)|]]'s intense desire to wreak vengance upon the Tokugawa Shogunate overpowering her immunity to corruption. title: crimson_codex_(fate)
body:
A supporting character in [[Fate/Samurai Remnant]]. A sentient [[grimoire|magical tome]] that floats in the air and speaks like a human. [[Miyamoto Iori (fate)|]] inherited him from his [[Miyamoto Musashi (Male) (fate)|adoptive father]]. He is an ancient Western book who taught Iori magecraft and recognized [[Jeanne d'Arc Alter (Lancer) (fate)|Lancer]]'s face upon first seeing her, though he initially couldn't place her identity.

He appears as a leather-bound book with two eyes and a mouth lined up vertically.

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[Wataru Rei]]

title: rpg_(weapon)
body:
[b]RPG[/b], short for [i]ручной противотанковый гранатомёт/Ruchnoy Protivotankovy Granatomyot[/i] in Russian, which translates to "hand-held anti-tank grenade launcher", refers to a hand-held [[weapon]] originally developed to destroy [[tank]]s and [[bunker]]s and comes in a variety of shapes, designs, purposes, and types. Although the [[RPG-7]] is the poster-child for the weapon, it is far from being the only type of RPG in the world.

It is commonly known under the backronym [i]Rocket-Propelled Grenade[/i] in the [[united states|United States]] even though not all of the designs are rocket-propelled.

This tag is intended to be used for describing [[rocket launcher]]s that has strong resemblance with the popular RPG-7, regardless of specified designated name. [b]Do not use[/b] this for role-playing games or ugly glasses (called "rape-prevention goggles" in the US military).

h4. See also

* [[Explosives]]
* [[Rocket Launcher]]
* [[Panzerfaust]]
* [[M1 Bazooka]]
* [[RPG-1]]
* [[RPG-2]] - Predecessor of the famous RPG-7
* [[RPG-29]]
* [[RPG-7]]
* [[List of Weapons]]

title: pussy_pump
body:
A device which applies suction to female genitalia. It usually consists of a cup or cylinder that fits over the vaginal area connected to a hand-operated or motorized pump mechanism that sucks the air from the cup. The design aims to boost blood flow to the vaginal area, thereby enhancing sensitivity and potentially elevating the pleasure of the sexual experience.

See also [[clitoris pump]]

title: breast_pump
body:
A device designed to assist in lactation among [i]human[/i] mothers for the purpose of filling bottles with milk for their children using suction.  

[[Milking machine]] is a more generic term for devices to induce lactation among any animal.  All breast pumps are milking machines, but if it is not for humans, (such as the especially popular cow milking machine) it's not a breast pump, but is a milking machine.  

Post #1715415 is an example of a breast pump. Post #97533 is a generic milking machine.

h4. Body Suction Devices
* [[breast enlargement pump]] (a similar device designed for a different purpose)
* [[pussy pump]]
* [[clitoris pump]]
* [[milking machine]]
* [[penis pump]]

title: 2nd_generation_(hololive)
body:
The second generation of [[hololive]] [[virtual YouTuber|VTuber]]s. Though not having a unique name like subsequent [i]hololive[/i] generations, Subaru herself has stated in some of her Saturday morning talks that she casually calls the generation as [i][[Exodia the Forbidden One|Exodia]][/i], as a [i][[Yu-Gi-Oh!]][/i] reference and as a lament on how they rarely collab as a group. 

[u]Use this tag when:[/u]
* The artist deliberately groups [b]all 5[/b] of the members (or their respective mascots) together. 
** May also apply to the three remaining members if the work was done after Aqua and Shion's graduation.

h4. Members
* !post #3931939: [[Minato Aqua]] (graduated)
* !post #3931950: [[Murasaki Shion]] (graduated)
* !post #3234515: [[Nakiri Ayame]]
* !post #3931960: [[Oozora Subaru]]
* !post #3389455: [[Yuzuki Choco]]

h4. See also
* [[List of hololive units and subgroups]]

title: nukumizu_kazuhiko
body:
One of the main characters of the anime [[Make heroine ga oo sugiru!]]
Character Traits: [[Black hair]] [[Brown eyes]] 
The protagonist of the series. He is a first-year high school student who is a loner with a philosophical personality and an otaku fond of reading light novels. He witnesses the girls being rejected by their crushes and decides to emotionally support them and help them move on, though at times, their antics tend to annoy him beyond belief.
Birthday: December 25

title: komari_chika
body:
One of the main characters of the anime [[Make heroine ga oo sugiru!]]
Character Traits: [[Red hair]] [[Yellow eyes]] 
A shy and insecure girl who tries to avoid communicating with people. However, in the circle of friends she becomes more open and talkative. She is a member of a literary club
Birthday: March 29
Height: 148 cm
Weight: 41 kg

title: nanashi_mumei_(1st_costume)
body:
The default costume of [[hololive English|hololive EN]]'s [[Nanashi Mumei]].

It consists of a [[brown capelet|brown]] [[hooded capelet]] secured by a [[brown bowtie]] and a longer [[two-sided cape]] that splits like feathers, a [[high collar|high-collared]] [[white shirt]] with a [[cleavage cutout]] and [[three-quarter sleeves|forearm length sleeves]], an [[underbust]] [[brown corset]], [[archery shooting glove]]s, a [[belt]] with a [[lantern]], a [[belt pouch|pouch]], and a small [[sheathed]] [[dagger]] hanging from it, a [[red skirt|red]] [[pleated skirt|pleated]] [[miniskirt]], [[single thighhigh|a thighhigh sock]] on her left leg, [[single kneehigh|a kneehigh sock]] on her right leg, and [[brown boots|brown]] [[ankle boots]].

Her main hairstyle here is [[very long hair|long hair]] in a [[split ponytail]], held in place with a [[feather hair ornament|feather hair tie]]. Her bangs are secured by a rune-shaped [[hairclip]].

h4. Appearance

title: unconventional_mermaid
body:
A [[mermaid]] or [[merman]] depicted differently from classical mermaids of the disney variety. Common traits are a [[taur]] body, multiple and pronounced animalistic traits ([[sharp teeth]], [[webbed hands]], [[gills]] in uncommon places, extra fins), or being based on specific animals that aren't your average fish.

To qualify for this tag, a character must have a reasonable amount of these differences to be "unconventional". For example, just [[webbed hands]] or [[sharp teeth]] and nothing else are not enough.

h4. See also
* [[reverse mermaid]]
